original: n-ya gro dha yi sa bon gyi //
analyzed: n-ya gro dha yi sa bon gyi //
translated: is present in the seed of the nyagrodha tree,

original: nang na yod pa'i n-ya gro dang // bud med skyes pa 'grogs la bu //
analyzed: nang na yod pa'i n-ya gro dang // bud med skyes pa 'grogs la bu //
translated: and a child is present in the union of a man and a woman.üîΩThe sound is present in the drum,

original: rnga yi nang na sgra gnas dang // zas kyi nang na phyis sogs //
analyzed: rnga yi nang na sgra gnas dang // zas kyi nang na phyis sogs //
translated: and the peel is present in the fruit.

original: shing la 'bar yod mi mthong zhes //
analyzed: shing la 'bar yod mi mthong zhes //
translated: One does not see the fire that is present in the wood.

original: gang zhig mngon sum spong byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum spong byed pa //
translated: How can one who rejects perception

original: de ni bden smra ji ltar yin //
analyzed: de ni bden smra ji ltar yin //
translated: be called a proponent of truth?

original: de ni yod kyang mi gsal bas //
analyzed: de ni yod kyang mi gsal bas //
translated: Although it exists, it is not manifest.

original: des na bya ba sngon ma mthong //
analyzed: des na bya ba sngon ma mthong //
translated: Therefore, the action is not seen prior to the effect.

original: zhe na mi gsal med min pas //
analyzed: zhe na mi gsal med min pas //
translated: If you say that it is not nonexistent because it is not manifest,

original: ae ma'o bstan bcos shin tu legs //
analyzed: ae ma'o bstan bcos shin tu legs //
translated: how excellent is this treatise!

original: de lta bas na kho bos sngar smras pa'i kho bo cag gi de kho na nyid ni rigs pa dang bcas pa yin no //üîΩdbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba las /üîΩgrangs can gyi de kho na nyid la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na kho bos sngar smras pa'i kho bo cag gi de kho na nyid ni rigs pa dang bcas pa yin no // dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba las / grangs can gyi de kho na nyid la 'jug pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the reality that we have previously described is endowed with reason.

original: le'u drug pa'o /
analyzed: le'u drug pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs entry into reality, the sixth chapter of the Commentary on the M≈´lamadhyamaka.

original: // / de nas da ni bye brag ba'i @242b de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pas rab tu byed pa bdun pa brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: // / de nas da ni bye brag ba'i @242b de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pas rab tu byed pa bdun pa brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Now, in order to ascertain the reality of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, the seventh chapter will be composed.

original: de la bye brag pas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' nyid 'di ltar mang du 'god par byed de /
analyzed: de la bye brag pas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' nyid 'di ltar mang du 'god par byed de /
translated: In this regard, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas extensively set forth their own tenets as follows:

original: gzhan dag la brten nas goms pa las thar pa ni gcig nyid yin pas bdag cag gi skyes bu ni byed pa med pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: gzhan dag la brten nas goms pa las thar pa ni gcig nyid yin pas bdag cag gi skyes bu ni byed pa med pa ma yin te ;
translated: Liberation is one, and it is attained through practice in dependence on others. Therefore our person is not devoid of activity.

original: ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: byed pa po dang / za ba po yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po dang / za ba po yin te /
translated: It is an agent and an experiencer.

original: gang gi phyir rtogs pa la sogs pa yon tan las gzhan pa'i bdag ni yod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtogs pa la sogs pa yon tan las gzhan pa'i bdag ni yod de /
translated: Because the self is different from qualities such as cognition.

original: de ni ma skyes pa /üîΩrtag pa / byed pa po /
analyzed: de ni ma skyes pa / rtag pa / byed pa po /
translated: It is unborn.üîΩIt is permanent.

original: za ba po /
analyzed: za ba po /
translated: It is an agent.üîΩIt is an experiencer.

original: khyad pa / bya ba med pa'o //
analyzed: khyad pa / bya ba med pa'o //
translated: It is distinct. It is devoid of activity.

original: de bzhin dus dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams kyi rdul phra rab de dag kyang rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin dus dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams kyi rdul phra rab de dag kyang rtag pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the atoms of earth, water, fire, and wind are permanent.

original: grangs ji lta ba bzhin du yon tan bzhi dang / yon tan gsum dang / yon tan gnyis dang / yon tan gcig dang ldan pa ni reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: grangs ji lta ba bzhin du yon tan bzhi dang / yon tan gsum dang / yon tan gnyis dang / yon tan gcig dang ldan pa ni reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: The four qualities, the three qualities, the two qualities, and the one quality are respectively like the tactile objects, the tastes, the forms, the smells, and the sounds.

original: de dag ni mi reg par rigs mthun pa la ltos nas rang dang mthun pa dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i bya ba rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni mi reg par rigs mthun pa la ltos nas rang dang mthun pa dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i bya ba rtsom par byed do //
translated: They are not in contact, but they are in contact with their own and other kinds of activities, in dependence on their own and other kinds of objects.

original: phyogs dang / nam mkha' dang / dus kyang ma skyes pa /
analyzed: phyogs dang / nam mkha' dang / dus kyang ma skyes pa /
translated: Space, time, and the directions are not produced.

original: khyab pa / rtag pa /
analyzed: khyab pa / rtag pa /
translated: They are all-pervading, permanent,

original: bya ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba med pa yin no //
translated: and inactive.

original: yid ni rtag pa bya ba dang bcas pa yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: yid ni rtag pa bya ba dang bcas pa yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: The mind is permanent, active, and limited.

original: spyi dang khyad par dang / 'du ba yang ma skyes ba /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par dang / 'du ba yang ma skyes ba /
translated: Universals, particulars, and inherence are not produced.

original: khyab pa / rtag pa /
analyzed: khyab pa / rtag pa /
translated: They are all-pervading, permanent,

original: cha med pa /
analyzed: cha med pa /
translated: partless,

original: bya ba med pa /
analyzed: bya ba med pa /
translated: and inactive.üîΩThey are based on substances, qualities, and actions.

original: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las la brten pa yin no// yon tan yang gcig ni rtag //
analyzed: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las la brten pa yin no// yon tan yang gcig ni rtag //
translated: One quality is permanent,

original: kha cig ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: but some are impermanent.

original: las ni mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: las ni mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: Actions are impermanent.

original: de bzhin du chad dang cha can dang / yon tan dang / yon tan can dang / bya ba dang / byed pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid can dag ni gzhan dang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chad dang cha can dang / yon tan dang / yon tan can dang / bya ba dang / byed pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid can dag ni gzhan dang gzhan yin no //
translated: Similarly, the part and the whole, the quality and the one possessing the quality, the action and the agent, the definition and the one possessing the definition are different.

original: de bzhin du dbang po dang don dang yid 'dus pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po dang don dang yid 'dus pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: Similarly, the cognition that arises from the union of the sense faculty, the object, and the mind is direct perception.

original: gzhan dag na re byed pa po ni yod bya ba ni med ces zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re byed pa po ni yod bya ba ni med ces zer ro //
translated: Others say that the agent exists, but the action does not.

original: de bzhin du tshig gi don drug gis thams cad bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig gi don drug gis thams cad bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, it should be understood that everything is included in the six categories.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the six?

original: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'du bzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'du bzhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are substance, quality, action, universality, particularity, and inherence.

original: de la rdzas zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don rnam pa dgu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rdzas zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don rnam pa dgu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, the word substance has nine meanings:

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / @243a * //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / @243a * //
translated: earth, water, fire, air, space, time, direction,üîΩself, and mind.

original: bdag dang / yid ces bya ba'i rdzas rnams so //
analyzed: bdag dang / yid ces bya ba'i rdzas rnams so //
translated: What are the nine meanings of the word quality?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: yon tan nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni yon tan gyi tshig gi don yin la de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yon tan nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni yon tan gyi tshig gi don yin la de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The twenty-four qualities are the meanings of the words ‚Äúquality.‚Äù

original: gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg bya dang / grangs dang / bod tshod dang / so so dang / 'du ba dang / 'bral ba dang / gzhan nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / blo rnams dang / bde ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg bya dang / grangs dang / bod tshod dang / so so dang / 'du ba dang / 'bral ba dang / gzhan nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / blo rnams dang / bde ba dang /
translated: They are as follows: form, taste, smell, touch, number, dimension, separateness, conjunction, otherness, non-otherness, cognition, pleasure,

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / 'bad pa zhes bya ba rnams ni yon tan no //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / 'bad pa zhes bya ba rnams ni yon tan no //
translated: pain, desire, hatred, effort, and the like.

original: de bzhin du las ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du las ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Similarly, action is of five types:

original: steng du 'byin pa dang / 'og tu gnon pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i las rnams so //
analyzed: steng du 'byin pa dang / 'og tu gnon pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i las rnams so //
translated: the actions of throwing upward, throwing downward, contracting, expanding, and going.

original: de bzhin du gang gi phyir rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las rnams la yod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las rnams kyi don las gzhan zhig yod pa de ni spyi zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi phyir rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las rnams la yod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las rnams kyi don las gzhan zhig yod pa de ni spyi zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: In the same way, that which is other than the meaning of substance, quality, and activity, which are said to exist, is called the universal.

original: khyad zhugs pa yod pa ni khyad par te /
analyzed: khyad zhugs pa yod pa ni khyad par te /
translated: The particular is that which is distinguished.

original: ji ltar dkar po dang / nag po zhes bya ba'i khyad par ltar de bzhin du rdzas dang yon tan zhes bya ba'i khyad par yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dkar po dang / nag po zhes bya ba'i khyad par ltar de bzhin du rdzas dang yon tan zhes bya ba'i khyad par yang yin no //
translated: Just as there is a distinction between white and black, so there is a distinction between substance and quality.

original: yang 'du ba ni ji ltar 'di la yod do zhes yang dag par blos rtogs par 'gyur ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang 'du ba ni ji ltar 'di la yod do zhes yang dag par blos rtogs par 'gyur ba'i don te /
translated: Moreover, the collection is the meaning by which one understands through the mind, ‚ÄúIt exists here.‚Äù

original: 'di dag ni tshig gi don drug yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni tshig gi don drug yin no //
translated: These are the six meanings of words.

original: de bzhin du khyad par med pa dang ldan pa'i rtag pa ni yod de rdzas dang ldan pa bya ba dang / byed pa dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las rnams kyi khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par med pa dang ldan pa'i rtag pa ni yod de rdzas dang ldan pa bya ba dang / byed pa dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las rnams kyi khyad par med pa'o //
translated: Similarly, there is a permanent substance that is devoid of particularity, for example, substance, action, universal, and particularity.

original: de bzhin du rdzas kyis ni rdzas gzhan rtsom par byed la yon tan gyis kyang yon tan gzhan rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzas kyis ni rdzas gzhan rtsom par byed la yon tan gyis kyang yon tan gzhan rtsom par byed do //
translated: In the same way, substance produces another substance, and quality produces another quality.

original: yang las la ni spyi med do //
analyzed: yang las la ni spyi med do //
translated: But action has no universal.

original: yang rdzas ni byed pa por yang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: yang rdzas ni byed pa por yang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Moreover, substance is not incompatible with being an agent.

original: yon tan ni gnyi ga'i'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni gnyi ga'i'o //
translated: Quality is both.

original: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid spyi ni bya ba dang ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pa 'du ba'i rgyur gyur pa ste rdzas kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid spyi ni bya ba dang ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pa 'du ba'i rgyur gyur pa ste rdzas kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The universal of substance is that which possesses action, possesses quality, and is the cause of inherence. This is the definition of substance.

original: rdzas la brten pa yon tan gzhan dang mi ldan pa 'du ba dang bral ba na yang rgyu med pa ltos pa med pa ni yon tan gyi mtshan nyid //
analyzed: rdzas la brten pa yon tan gzhan dang mi ldan pa 'du ba dang bral ba na yang rgyu med pa ltos pa med pa ni yon tan gyi mtshan nyid //
translated: The definition of quality is that which is not possessed by another quality, which is not possessed by another substance, and which is not the cause of inherence, but is the cause of inherence when it is not dependent on another.

original: yang las kyi mtshan nyid ni rdzas gcig pu yon tan med pa 'du ba dang bral ba na yang ltos pa med pa'i byed pa po ni las kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang las kyi mtshan nyid ni rdzas gcig pu yon tan med pa 'du ba dang bral ba na yang ltos pa med pa'i byed pa po ni las kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of action is: that which, even when separated from the substance, quality, and community, is the agent without depending on anything else.

original: de zhin du rdzas ni spyi'i byed pa po'o //
analyzed: de zhin du rdzas ni spyi'i byed pa po'o //
translated: In the same way, substance is the agent of the general action.

original: de bzhin du yon tan ni 'du ba dang @243b bral ba'i byed pa por 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan ni 'du ba dang @243b bral ba'i byed pa por 'jug pa'o //
translated: In the same way, quality is the agent of the action of separation from the community.

original: rdzas rnams ni rdzas kyi bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdzas rnams ni rdzas kyi bya ba ste /
translated: Substances are the agents of the action of substance.üîΩFor example, like two fingers.

original: ji ltar sor mo gnyis bzhin no// yon tan las yon 'byung ste //
analyzed: ji ltar sor mo gnyis bzhin no// yon tan las yon 'byung ste //
translated: From quality, there is the origination of quality.

original: ji ltar gzugs las gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs las gzugs bzhin no //
translated: For example, like form from form.

original: de bzhin du rdzas so so'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzas so so'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, the individual definitions of substance should be stated.

original: gzugs dang / ro dang dri dang / reg bya dang ldan pa ni sa'i rdzas so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / ro dang dri dang / reg bya dang ldan pa ni sa'i rdzas so //
translated: The substance earth has form, taste, smell, and touch.

original: gzugs dang / ro dang / reg bya dang ldan pa ni chu ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang / ro dang / reg bya dang ldan pa ni chu ste /
translated: The substance water has form, taste, and touch.

original: gsher ba dang rlan pa nyid do //
analyzed: gsher ba dang rlan pa nyid do //
translated: It has the nature of fluidity and moisture.

original: me ni gzugs dang reg bya dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: me ni gzugs dang reg bya dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Fire has form and touch.

original: rlung ni reg pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rlung ni reg pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Wind has only touch.

original: rtags mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rtags mi mthong ba'o //
translated: The sign of space is the non-perception of a sign.

original: nam mkha' ni yon tan sgra dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni yon tan sgra dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Space is endowed with the quality of sound.

original: gzhan yang gzhan ma yin pa dang / lhan cig dang lhan cig ma yin pa dang / dus ring ba dang thung ba zhes bya ba ni dus kyi rtags so //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan ma yin pa dang / lhan cig dang lhan cig ma yin pa dang / dus ring ba dang thung ba zhes bya ba ni dus kyi rtags so //
translated: Moreover, the sign of time is: not being different, being simultaneous or not being simultaneous, and being long or short.

original: gang 'di dang 'di zhes bya ba de ni phyogs kyi rtags te /
analyzed: gang 'di dang 'di zhes bya ba de ni phyogs kyi rtags te /
translated: That which is called here and now is the sign of direction.

original: sngar nyi ma dang ldan par gyur pa dang / phyis ldan par 'gyur ba las shar dang / de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang zhes bya bas phyogs kyi khyad par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar nyi ma dang ldan par gyur pa dang / phyis ldan par 'gyur ba las shar dang / de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang zhes bya bas phyogs kyi khyad par bstan pa yin no //
translated: From the sun being endowed with this and that, and from being endowed with this and that later, the differences of the directions east, south, west and north are taught.

original: dbang po dang / don dang / lhan cig gnas pa ni bdag yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang / don dang / lhan cig gnas pa ni bdag yin no //
translated: The self is the one who is endowed with the sense faculties, objects and the mind.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo med pa dang ngo bo yod pa ni yid kyi rtags so //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo med pa dang ngo bo yod pa ni yid kyi rtags so //
translated: The sign of the mind is the non-existence of the nature of consciousness and the existence of its nature.

original: gzhan yang 'dir thar pa 'dod pa dag bla ma dang nye bar song nas phyi dang nang dag la phun sum tshogs par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir thar pa 'dod pa dag bla ma dang nye bar song nas phyi dang nang dag la phun sum tshogs par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, those who desire liberation should approach a guru and perfect the outer and inner.

original: khrus dang dbang bskur ba dang / smyung bar gnas pa dang / tshangs par spyod pas bla ma'i khyim du gnas pa dang / nags su gnas ba dang / mchod sbyin dang / sbyin pa la phyogs ba dang / rgyu skar dang / dus nges pa la mthong bar spyod par byed pa'i mi mthong ba ni chos zhes brjod la /
analyzed: khrus dang dbang bskur ba dang / smyung bar gnas pa dang / tshangs par spyod pas bla ma'i khyim du gnas pa dang / nags su gnas ba dang / mchod sbyin dang / sbyin pa la phyogs ba dang / rgyu skar dang / dus nges pa la mthong bar spyod par byed pa'i mi mthong ba ni chos zhes brjod la /
translated: The Dharma is that which is seen by a person who is clean and consecrated, who lives in the house of a guru who is fasting, celibate, and living in the forest, who is devoted to sacrifice and giving, and who is observing the stars and the proper time.

original: de'i don du sten par byed pa la yang chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don du sten par byed pa la yang chos zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is practiced for the sake of that is also called the Dharma.

original: de las bzlog pa ni chos ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni chos ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that is called non-Dharma.

original: de lta bu'i chos dang chos ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal yin la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos dang chos ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal yin la /
translated: The characteristics of such Dharma and non-Dharma are pleasure and pain.

original: de dag la chags pa dang sdang pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la chags pa dang sdang pa'o //
translated: Attachment and aversion arise in regard to them.

original: des byas pas 'di ltar yang skye zhing 'khor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des byas pas 'di ltar yang skye zhing 'khor bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that, one is born and transmigrates in this way.

original: 'di ltar chos dang chos ma yin pa la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyis thog ma med pa'i dus nas bcings zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos dang chos ma yin pa la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyis thog ma med pa'i dus nas bcings zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, it is said that one is bound from beginningless time by the characteristics of engaging in Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: ji ltar 'khor ba thog ma med pa de bzhin du ci tha ma yang med pa'i bdag nyid gcig yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba thog ma med pa de bzhin du ci tha ma yang med pa'i bdag nyid gcig yin nam zhe na /
translated: Just as samsara has no beginning, does it also have no end, such that it is of the nature of having no end?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: thar pa yod pa ste /üîΩde kho na nyid @244a * //
analyzed: thar pa yod pa ste / de kho na nyid @244a * //
translated: Liberation exists.üîΩLiberation is attained through

original: shes pa las tha ma thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa las tha ma thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: understanding reality.

original: yang de ni gang chos dang chos ma yin pa dag spyad pas yang dang yang 'khor zhing 'khor bzo chun brgyud mo'i 'khrul 'khor gyi gnas lta bu'i 'khor bar 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang de ni gang chos dang chos ma yin pa dag spyad pas yang dang yang 'khor zhing 'khor bzo chun brgyud mo'i 'khrul 'khor gyi gnas lta bu'i 'khor bar 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, samsara is that in which one repeatedly cycles due to engaging in virtue and nonvirtue, like a waterwheel.

original: de med pas yang 'byung ba nying mtshams sbyor ba yang med pa'i phyir thar pa yin te /
analyzed: de med pas yang 'byung ba nying mtshams sbyor ba yang med pa'i phyir thar pa yin te /
translated: Liberation is the absence of that, because there is no further rebirth, since it does not exist.

original: mar me shi bar gyur pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mar me shi bar gyur pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the light of a butter lamp that has gone out.

original: lus dang bcas pa'i bdag yid dang ldan par gyur pa ni 'tsho ba yin la /
analyzed: lus dang bcas pa'i bdag yid dang ldan par gyur pa ni 'tsho ba yin la /
translated: The self that possesses a body and possesses mind is living.

original: de'i ma mthong ba mi 'byung bas med par gyur pa ni kun du sbyor ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ma mthong ba mi 'byung bas med par gyur pa ni kun du sbyor ba med pa ste /
translated: The absence of that, which is the nonexistence of the self, is the absence of fetters.

original: yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang po'i lus la sogs pa gtan mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang po'i lus la sogs pa gtan mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it will not arise again, the first body, etc. will never arise.

original: gal te chos dang chos ma yin pa med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chos dang chos ma yin pa med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If there is neither virtue nor nonvirtue, how can there be the future?

original: ma 'ongs pa mi 'byung zhing bsags pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa mi 'byung zhing bsags pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: The future does not arise, and the accumulation is stopped.

original: de la lus dang / dbang po dang / yid las tha dad pa'i bdag mthong ba na dge ba skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la lus dang / dbang po dang / yid las tha dad pa'i bdag mthong ba na dge ba skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: When one sees the self as separate from the body, the senses, and the mind, virtue does not arise.

original: de sgrub par byed pa yongs su spangs pas ma 'ongs pa yang mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa yongs su spangs pas ma 'ongs pa yang mi skye ba ste /
translated: Since one abandons its practice, the future does not arise.

original: bsags pa 'gog pa yang lus kyi de kho na nyid la rtog par byed pa na chags par mi rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: bsags pa 'gog pa yang lus kyi de kho na nyid la rtog par byed pa na chags par mi rtsom pa'o //
translated: The stopping of the accumulation is the noncommencement of attachment when one reflects on the reality of the body.

original: don dam pa'i bdag nges par rtogs shing tshig gi don drug gi de kho na nyid nges par shes pa na chos kyang med par 'gyur ba yin te /üîΩ'dir / lus dang yid kyi rnam rtog ni //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bdag nges par rtogs shing tshig gi don drug gi de kho na nyid nges par shes pa na chos kyang med par 'gyur ba yin te / 'dir / lus dang yid kyi rnam rtog ni //
translated: When one realizes the ultimate self and knows the reality of the six topics of the words, then even the Dharma does not exist.üîΩHere it says,üîΩAbandoning all concepts of body and mind,

original: thams cad spangs nas dri med pa'i //
analyzed: thams cad spangs nas dri med pa'i //
translated: the stainless

original: yongs su 'da' bar de 'gro ste //
analyzed: yongs su 'da' bar de 'gro ste //
translated: He goes to the state of complete nirvana,

original: shing zad pa yi me bzhin no //
analyzed: shing zad pa yi me bzhin no //
translated: like a fire whose fuel has been exhausted.

original: zhes dam la bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes dam la bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the Samkhyas.

original: ji ltar khyab pa'i bdag ni byed pa med pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar khyab pa'i bdag ni byed pa med pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Although the all-pervading self is inactive,üîΩnevertheless, because it is apprehended by the mind as the self, it is not disconnected from the mind, and so it does not arise again.

original: 'on kyang yid kyis bdag ces 'dzin par byed pas yid dang kun du sbyor ba med pa ni yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes nye bar 'dogs so zhes bya ba 'di lta bu ni bye brag pa'i grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang yid kyis bdag ces 'dzin par byed pas yid dang kun du sbyor ba med pa ni yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes nye bar 'dogs so zhes bya ba 'di lta bu ni bye brag pa'i grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: This is the philosophy of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: de la slob dpon gyis mdor pa sdus nas des 'dod pa'i de kho na nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la slob dpon gyis mdor pa sdus nas des 'dod pa'i de kho na nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In brief, the master has refuted the self that is asserted by the Samkhya and Vai≈õe·π£ika schools in terms of their own positions.üîΩHe says:üîΩThe yogi who has uprooted

original: blo sogs bdag gi yon tan bcad //
analyzed: blo sogs bdag gi yon tan bcad //
translated: the qualities of the self, such as the intellect,

original: drungs nas phyung ba'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: drungs nas phyung ba'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: knows liberation.

original: yid la bdag ces gnas pa ni //üîΩbye brag pa yis thar par shes //
analyzed: yid la bdag ces gnas pa ni // bye brag pa yis thar par shes //
translated: The mind that abides as the self

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: is known as liberation by the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: blo dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang ba dang / 'bad pa dang / chos ma yin pa @244b dang ; shes pa dang / 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi yon tan dgu'o //
analyzed: blo dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang ba dang / 'bad pa dang / chos ma yin pa @244b dang ; shes pa dang / 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi yon tan dgu'o //
translated: The nine qualities of the self are: intelligence, happiness, suffering, desire, hatred, effort, non-Dharma, knowledge, and conditioned states.

original: de dag gi bcad pa ni ma 'ongs pa na mi 'byung ba dang / bsags pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bcad pa ni ma 'ongs pa na mi 'byung ba dang / bsags pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: Their cessation is the non-arising of future [qualities] and the cessation of accumulated [qualities].

original: drungs nas phyung ba'i chos dang chos ma yin pa de dag gtan spangs pa ni drungs nas phyung ba ste /
analyzed: drungs nas phyung ba'i chos dang chos ma yin pa de dag gtan spangs pa ni drungs nas phyung ba ste /
translated: The complete abandonment of those qualities and non-qualities that have been uprooted is the complete uprooting.

original: thams cad du log pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du log pa'o //
translated: It is the complete reversal of all [qualities and non-qualities].

original: de ltar gyur pa na yid la byed pa la 'jug pa las ldog pa gang gi phyir brtags pa yin pas rang nyid la bdag ces bya ba'i yul du rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa na thar pa yin no zhes 'ug pa pas shesüîΩpa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa na yid la byed pa la 'jug pa las ldog pa gang gi phyir brtags pa yin pas rang nyid la bdag ces bya ba'i yul du rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa na thar pa yin no zhes 'ug pa pas shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: When that occurs, since the engagement in mental activity has been reversed, the object that was imagined as ‚Äúself‚Äù becomes the state of non-conceptuality. At that time, it is liberation. This is what the UkkƒÅmighosa S≈´tra teaches.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, this should be said:

original: rgyas par sngar bstan rim pa yis //
analyzed: rgyas par sngar bstan rim pa yis //
translated: In detail, as previously explained,

original: mi bden skye ba bkag pa'am //
analyzed: mi bden skye ba bkag pa'am //
translated: The non-existence of the self is established by the refutation of the arising of the non-existent,

original: dngos po yongs su bkag pas na //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su bkag pas na //
translated: Or by the refutation of the entity.

original: 'dod dang sdang sogs yon tan med //
analyzed: 'dod dang sdang sogs yon tan med //
translated: Desire, hatred, etc. do not exist as the self‚Äôs qualities.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rim pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rim pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the order of the teaching?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ma skyes byed por mi rung ste //üîΩbya ba nges par bya ba la //
analyzed: ma skyes byed por mi rung ste // bya ba nges par bya ba la //
translated: The non-arisen is not a maker,üîΩBecause the maker is determined in relation to the action.

original: byed po yin phyir sbrang rtsi'i rgyu //
analyzed: byed po yin phyir sbrang rtsi'i rgyu //
translated: Like the cause of honey,

original: nam mkha'i ma tog min pa bzhin //
analyzed: nam mkha'i ma tog min pa bzhin //
translated: Not like the sky-flower.

original: zhes bstan pa dang / ma skyes skyes pa ma yin te //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa dang / ma skyes skyes pa ma yin te //
translated: And: The non-arisen is not arisen,

original: nam mkha'i me tog ma skyes bzhin //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ma skyes bzhin //
translated: Like the non-arisen sky-flower.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bya ba med par 'ug pa pas yongs su brtags pa'i skye ba bkag pas 'dod pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma grub na bdag gi yon tan ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bya ba med par 'ug pa pas yongs su brtags pa'i skye ba bkag pas 'dod pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma grub na bdag gi yon tan ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Thus, by refuting the arising imagined by the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas as being without activity, if the intrinsic reality of desire, hatred, etc. is not established, how could the self‚Äôs qualities arise?

original: yang na de la /
analyzed: yang na de la /
translated: Or, in that regard:

original: 'byung ba'i ngo bo la sogs kyi //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i ngo bo la sogs kyi //
translated: The elements, etc.

original: don dam par na yod min te //
analyzed: don dam par na yod min te //
translated: Do not exist ultimately.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo rab tu bkag pa de kho na nyid du yon tan zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don gyi dngos po med pa yin pas bdag dang der nyid kyang med na chad pa ta ga la yod
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo rab tu bkag pa de kho na nyid du yon tan zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don gyi dngos po med pa yin pas bdag dang der nyid kyang med na chad pa ta ga la yod
translated: Thus, the intrinsic reality of all phenomena is utterly refuted. Since the meaning of the term ‚Äúquality‚Äù does not exist in reality, if the self and that which is called ‚Äúquality‚Äù do not exist, how could nihilism occur?

original: par 'gyur // yang na rgyu dang rkyen la ltos nas brten te 'byung ba'i spyi nyid la de yod par khas blang pa yang dpyad par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: par 'gyur // yang na rgyu dang rkyen la ltos nas brten te 'byung ba'i spyi nyid la de yod par khas blang pa yang dpyad par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Or, since the existence of a universal that arises in dependence on causes and conditions is also to be analyzed,

original: rtag pa'i bdag la shes mi rten //
analyzed: rtag pa'i bdag la shes mi rten //
translated: the self is not the support of cognition.

original: rgyu dang ldan phyir bum pa bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan phyir bum pa bzhin //
translated: Because it has a cause, like a pot.

original: gang re zhig dbang po dang / don dang yid phrad pa las skyes pa'i mngon sum gyi shes pa de yang don dam par bdag rtag pa la brten par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang re zhig dbang po dang / don dang yid phrad pa las skyes pa'i mngon sum gyi shes pa de yang don dam par bdag rtag pa la brten par mi rigs te /
translated: First, the arising of the consciousness of direct perception from the contact of a sense faculty, object, and mind is not tenable as the support of a permanent self.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa la sogs pa spyi yod pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa la sogs pa spyi yod pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it has a cause and so on, like a pot and so on.

original: yang na / blo ni bdag gi yon tan du //
analyzed: yang na / blo ni bdag gi yon tan du //
translated: Or, the mind is not a quality of the self.

original: mi rigs skye dang ldan pa'i phyir //üîΩji ltar de yi yon tan du //
analyzed: mi rigs skye dang ldan pa'i phyir // ji ltar de yi yon tan du //
translated: Because it is not reasonable that it be a quality of the self.

original: @245a * // gzugs la sogs pa mi 'dod bzhin //
analyzed: @245a * // gzugs la sogs pa mi 'dod bzhin //
translated: How is it that form, etc. are not accepted as its qualities?

original: blo ni bdag gi yon tan nyid yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: blo ni bdag gi yon tan nyid yin par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that cognition be a quality of the self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang dang gang skye ba dang ldan pa de ni bdag gi yon tan yin par ma mthong ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang skye ba dang ldan pa de ni bdag gi yon tan yin par ma mthong ste /
translated: Because whatever is produced and possesses a cause is not seen to be a quality of the self,

original: dper na gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs bzhin no //
translated: like form, etc.

original: yang na / 'du ba yin phyir bdag med pas ;
analyzed: yang na / 'du ba yin phyir bdag med pas ;
translated: Moreover, because it is not a unity, and because the self does not exist,

original: / rigs de mi rtag pa yi phyir //
analyzed: / rigs de mi rtag pa yi phyir //
translated: and because the class is impermanent,

original: ji ltar gzugs sngar yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs sngar yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: even though form did not exist previously,

original: bdag dang nye bar gnas pa las blo la bdag gi yon tan nyid do zhes zer ba thos te /
analyzed: bdag dang nye bar gnas pa las blo la bdag gi yon tan nyid do zhes zer ba thos te /
translated: it is heard that it is a quality of the self in relation to the self, because it is present in proximity to the self.

original: de bdag dang / bdag tu 'du bar yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phyogs so //
analyzed: de bdag dang / bdag tu 'du bar yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phyogs so //
translated: That is not the case, because the self and the self‚Äôs collection do not exist.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because it is impermanent,

original: sngar dbang po dang / yul phrad nas gnas pa'i dus na med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngar dbang po dang / yul phrad nas gnas pa'i dus na med pa'i phyir te /
translated: or because it did not exist previously when the sense faculty and object had contact and remained.

original: dper na gzugs ni bdag dang 'du ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs ni bdag dang 'du ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, form is not an assemblage of the self.

original: de bzhin du blo ni 'di'i yon tan yang ma yin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du blo ni 'di'i yon tan yang ma yin pa nyid yin no //
translated: In the same way, the mind is not a quality of the self.

original: de lta ba de dang sdug bsngal sogs //
analyzed: de lta ba de dang sdug bsngal sogs //
translated: The refutation of the arising of pleasure, etc.

original: dgag pa mthar thug shes par bya //
analyzed: dgag pa mthar thug shes par bya //
translated: should be understood as the final refutation of the self.

original: bde ba 'byung ba nyid kyang bdag gi yon tan ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba 'byung ba nyid kyang bdag gi yon tan ma yin te /
translated: The arising of pleasure is not a quality of the self,

original: skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no //
translated: because it is possessed by the arising, like form, for example.

original: bde ba ni bdag dang 'du ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba ni bdag dang 'du ba ma yin te /
translated: Pleasure is not an assemblage of the self,

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because it is impermanent,

original: snga na med pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no //
translated: or because it does not exist prior , like form, for example.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa dang ; zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams kyang dgag par bya'o zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa dang ; zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams kyang dgag par bya'o zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the same way, the refutation of pain, desire, hatred, etc. should be understood.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / yid ni rtag pa min par 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yid ni rtag pa min par 'dod //
translated: the mind is not permanent,

original: brjod bya yin phyir bum pa bzhin //
analyzed: brjod bya yin phyir bum pa bzhin //
translated: because it is an object of expression, like a pot, for example.

original: gal te gang blo la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir bdag dang 'du ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te gang blo la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir bdag dang 'du ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the mind and so on are not united with the self because they are impermanent,

original: yid ni 'dir rtag pa yin pas de dang 'du ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yid ni 'dir rtag pa yin pas de dang 'du ba yin no zhe na /
translated: but the intellect is united with the self because it is permanent here,

original: yid kyang rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyang rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: then the intellect is not permanent.

original: tshig gis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is expressed by words, it is like a pot and so on.

original: rtag pa nyid ma yin na ji ltar de dang 'du bar gyur pa yin zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid ma yin na ji ltar de dang 'du bar gyur pa yin zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: If it is not permanent, how can it be united with the self?

original: gzhan yang / 'di ni bdag gi byed pa min //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'di ni bdag gi byed pa min //
translated: Moreover: This is not the self‚Äôs action,

original: dngos po yin phyir bde ba bzhin //
analyzed: dngos po yin phyir bde ba bzhin //
translated: because it is a thing, like pleasure.

original: gang dang gang dngos po nyid yin pa de ni bdag gi byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang dngos po nyid yin pa de ni bdag gi byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is a thing is not the action of the self,

original: dper na bde ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bde ba bzhin no //
translated: like pleasure.

original: yid ni byed pa nyid du ma skyes pas 'du ba yin par bden du zin kyang /
analyzed: yid ni byed pa nyid du ma skyes pas 'du ba yin par bden du zin kyang /
translated: Since the intellect is not produced as an action, it is truly united with the self,

original: don mthong bar grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don mthong bar grub pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not established as seeing objects.

original: yang na rten med par brten pa yang mi 'grub pas des na @245b rten nyid bzlog par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: yang na rten med par brten pa yang mi 'grub pas des na @245b rten nyid bzlog par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Or else, if there is no basis, the based is not established. Therefore, in order to refute the basis itself,

original: bdag yod pa ni bkag zin kyang //
analyzed: bdag yod pa ni bkag zin kyang //
translated: The existence of the self has already been refuted.

original: 'dir yang brtag par bya ba ste //
analyzed: 'dir yang brtag par bya ba ste //
translated: But here it should be examined.

original: brten nas byung ba ma yin phyir //
analyzed: brten nas byung ba ma yin phyir //
translated: Because it does not arise dependently,

original: bdag med nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //
analyzed: bdag med nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //
translated: The self is like the sky flower.

original: dbang phyug bkag pa dang 'dra bar bdag kyang bkag pa yin yang /
analyzed: dbang phyug bkag pa dang 'dra bar bdag kyang bkag pa yin yang /
translated: Just as ƒ™≈õvara is refuted, the self is also refuted.

original: yang tshul bzhin gyis dgag par bya ste ;
analyzed: yang tshul bzhin gyis dgag par bya ste ;
translated: But it should be properly refuted.

original: bdag ni med do zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni med do zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: The proposition is: The self does not exist.

original: gtan tshigs ci yod /üîΩso so'am bsdus pas kyang skye bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen yongs su ma bzung bas /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ci yod / so so'am bsdus pas kyang skye bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen yongs su ma bzung bas /
translated: What is the reason?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not arise dependently, since the conditions for its arising are not apprehended either individually or collectively.

original: 'dir gang med pa de ni so so'am bsdus pa'i rkyen bzung nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gang med pa de ni so so'am bsdus pa'i rkyen bzung nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Here, what does not exist does not arise by apprehending conditions either individually or collectively,

original: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: like a sky flower.

original: gang yod pa de ni so so'am bsdus pas rgyu dang rkyen yongs su bzung nas 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yod pa de ni so so'am bsdus pas rgyu dang rkyen yongs su bzung nas 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: That which exists arises by taking up causes and conditions, either individually or collectively.

original: dper na gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i rkyen yongs su bzung nas sems skye bar 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i rkyen yongs su bzung nas sems skye bar 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the mind arises by taking up the conditions of form, light, space, attention, and the sense faculties.

original: yang na bdag ni med de /
analyzed: yang na bdag ni med de /
translated: Or, the self does not exist,

original: gzugs su rung ba dang / nyams su myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / so sor rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba dang / nyams su myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / so sor rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: because it lacks the characteristics of being visible, being experienced, apprehending signs, being conditioned, and being conscious, like the son of a barren woman.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / de yi spyi ni yod par yang ;
analyzed: gzhan yang / de yi spyi ni yod par yang ;
translated: the existence of its generality

original: / khas len pa yang brtag par bya //
analyzed: / khas len pa yang brtag par bya //
translated: should also be examined.

original: phung po 'dus pa'i rgyun bzhin byas nas /
analyzed: phung po 'dus pa'i rgyun bzhin byas nas /
translated: Having made the self a continuum of the aggregates,

original: kun rdzob tu bdag yod pas bdag gi spyi yod par khas len pa de yang kho bos 'dir dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bdag yod pas bdag gi spyi yod par khas len pa de yang kho bos 'dir dpyad par bya'o //
translated: we will now examine the assertion that the self exists conventionally and that the generality of the self exists.

original: 'di ni khyab min rtag pa min //
analyzed: 'di ni khyab min rtag pa min //
translated: It is not all-pervading, nor is it permanent.

original: rtogs bya yin phyir bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtogs bya yin phyir bum pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is an object of knowledge, like a pot.

original: rnal 'byor pa dag gi bsam gtan gyi mig gis 'di rtogs par bya ba yin pas /üîΩrtogs bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dag gi bsam gtan gyi mig gis 'di rtogs par bya ba yin pas / rtogs bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is to be realized by the eye of concentration of the yogis.üîΩBecause it is an object of knowledge,

original: rtogs bya yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i spyi bzhin no //
analyzed: rtogs bya yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i spyi bzhin no //
translated: like the universal of a pot.

original: des na 'di ni khyab pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: des na 'di ni khyab pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not all-pervading,

original: rtag pa nyid kyang ma yin no //üîΩbdag ni khyab pa nyid du yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyang ma yin no // bdag ni khyab pa nyid du yod pa yin te /
translated: nor is it permanent.

original: kun la khyab pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: kun la khyab pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no zhe na /
translated: The self is all-pervading, because it pervades everything, like space.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is not correct,

original: dpe nyid bsgrub bya dang mtshungs pa'i phyir dngos po'i don gang rang nyid kyang bsgrub par bya dgos pa des gzhan ji ltar sgrub par byed nus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dpe nyid bsgrub bya dang mtshungs pa'i phyir dngos po'i don gang rang nyid kyang bsgrub par bya dgos pa des gzhan ji ltar sgrub par byed nus zhes bya'o //
translated: because the example itself is the same as the probandum. How can something that itself must be proven be able to prove something else?

original: gal te nam mkha' thams cad la khyab pa yin na rdul phra rab kyi nang na nam mkha' yod dam med /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' thams cad la khyab pa yin na rdul phra rab kyi nang na nam mkha' yod dam med /
translated: If space pervades everything, is there space within a subtle particle or not?

original: @246a * // phyogs de gnyi ga yang 'ching ba'i zhags pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: @246a * // phyogs de gnyi ga yang 'ching ba'i zhags pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Both positions are bound by the noose of bondage.

original: gal te nam mkha' dang phra rab gnyis gcig na ni phra rab kyi cha dang nam mkha'i cha'o zhes phan tshun tha dad pas gnyi ga yang cha shas dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' dang phra rab gnyis gcig na ni phra rab kyi cha dang nam mkha'i cha'o zhes phan tshun tha dad pas gnyi ga yang cha shas dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If space and the most subtle particle are the same, then the part of the most subtle particle and the part of space are different from each other, and both would have parts.

original: dbye bar nus pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbye bar nus pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they can be divided, they would be impermanent, like a pot.

original: 'on te rdul phra rab kyi nang na nam mkha' med do zhe na ni phra rab kyang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on te rdul phra rab kyi nang na nam mkha' med do zhe na ni phra rab kyang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: But if you say that space does not exist in the most subtle particle, then the most subtle particle would be impermanent.

original: nam mkha' yang kun la khyab pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam mkha' yang kun la khyab pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: And space would not be all-pervading.

original: de lta bas na nam mkha' kun la khyab pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na nam mkha' kun la khyab pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: Therefore, either space is not all-pervading,

original: phra rab la dbye ba yod par khas blang dgos pas /
analyzed: phra rab la dbye ba yod par khas blang dgos pas /
translated: or the most subtle particle must be accepted as having parts.

original: des na phyogs gnyi ga yang skyon dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na phyogs gnyi ga yang skyon dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Thus both positions are flawed.

original: gzhan yang gal te kun la khyab pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin la 'dis lus la sbyor bar byed pa na ci phyogs gcig gis sbyor bar byed dam /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te kun la khyab pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin la 'dis lus la sbyor bar byed pa na ci phyogs gcig gis sbyor bar byed dam /
translated: If it is like space, it pervades all. If it connects with the body, does it connect with one part or with all?

original: 'on te thams cad kyis yin /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad kyis yin /
translated: Moreover, if it is like space, it pervades all. If it connects with the body, does it connect with one part or does it connect with all?

original: de la gal te phyogs gcig gis sbyor ro zhe na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te phyogs gcig gis sbyor ro zhe na ni /
translated: If it connects with one part,

original: phyogs cha dang ldan pa'i phyir bdag mi rtag pa nyid dang cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur te bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs cha dang ldan pa'i phyir bdag mi rtag pa nyid dang cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur te bum pa bzhin no //
translated: then the self would be impermanent and have parts, like a pot, because it would possess parts.

original: 'on te bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor ba yin na yang /
analyzed: 'on te bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor ba yin na yang /
translated: If it connects with its entire self,

original: de lta na lus gcig dang sbyor zhing phrad pa na lus gzhan thob par 'gyur ba med la /
analyzed: de lta na lus gcig dang sbyor zhing phrad pa na lus gzhan thob par 'gyur ba med la /
translated: then when it connects with and touches one body, it would not connect with and touch another body.

original: kun la khyab pa yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyis dus gcig tu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun la khyab pa yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyis dus gcig tu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And because it pervades all, it follows that all transmigrators would simultaneously experience pleasure and pain.

original: de yang 'di ltar dmyal ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyis kyang mtho ris kyi bde ba myong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar dmyal ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyis kyang mtho ris kyi bde ba myong bar 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, the beings of the hells would experience the pleasure of the higher rebirths,

original: mtho ris kyi 'gro ba rnams kyis kyang dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mtho ris kyi 'gro ba rnams kyis kyang dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Even the beings of the higher realms would experience the suffering of the hells.

original: gcig bcings ba na yang kun bcings par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gcig bcings ba na yang kun bcings par 'gyur la /
translated: And if one were bound, all would be bound.

original: gcig grol ba na yang 'gro ba thams cad grol bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig grol ba na yang 'gro ba thams cad grol bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And if one were liberated, all would be liberated.

original: skyon gzhan yang /üîΩblo skye 'gyur dang bcas she na //
analyzed: skyon gzhan yang / blo skye 'gyur dang bcas she na //
translated: Another fault:üîΩIf the self were to arise and cease,

original: khyod kyis bdag nyid nyams par 'gyur //üîΩ'on te 'gyur med shes pa min //
analyzed: khyod kyis bdag nyid nyams par 'gyur // 'on te 'gyur med shes pa min //
translated: you would be destroyed.üîΩIf it were not to arise and cease,

original: shes dang shes min ji ltar rung //
analyzed: shes dang shes min ji ltar rung //
translated: it would be neither cognition nor non-cognition.

original: gang yang bdag dang blo 'du bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: gang yang bdag dang blo 'du bar gyur pa na /
translated: If the self and cognition were to come together,

original: ci de'i tshe yongs su 'gyur ba 'byung ba zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ci de'i tshe yongs su 'gyur ba 'byung ba zhig yin nam /
translated: would there be transformation at that time?

original: 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin /
translated: Or would there not be?

original: gal te re zhig blo 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba na yongs su 'gyur ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te re zhig blo 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba na yongs su 'gyur ba yin na ni /
translated: If this cognition were to arise and transform,

original: @246b yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir 'bar ba la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: @246b yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir 'bar ba la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: it would be impermanent, because it would have the property of transformation, like burning and so on.

original: 'on te 'gyur ba brten pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'gyur ba brten pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is not a support for change,

original: yang 'di ji ltar rtogs pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang 'di ji ltar rtogs pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: how is it that it is understood?

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: Because it is without change, like space.

original: sngar rtog pa med pa'i ngo bo yin la ;
analyzed: sngar rtog pa med pa'i ngo bo yin la ;
translated: If it is not a conceptualization in the past,

original: phyis rtog pa'i ngo bor 'byung bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: phyis rtog pa'i ngo bor 'byung bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: but becomes a conceptualization in the future,

original: sngar gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su btang ba'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid du yongs su 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩrtag tu rtag pa zhig yin na yang rtog pa yang yin /
analyzed: sngar gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su btang ba'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid du yongs su 'gyur ba yin no // rtag tu rtag pa zhig yin na yang rtog pa yang yin /
translated: it would be impermanent, because it would be abandoning its previous nature.

original: mi rtog pa yang yin zhes bya ba ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi rtog pa yang yin zhes bya ba ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is permanent, how could it be both a conceptualization and not a conceptualization?

original: 'di blo dang 'du bar 'gyur ba zhig yin na yang ci blo'i ngo bo zhig tu 'gyur ba yin nam /üîΩ'on te ma yin /
analyzed: 'di blo dang 'du bar 'gyur ba zhig yin na yang ci blo'i ngo bo zhig tu 'gyur ba yin nam / 'on te ma yin /
translated: If it is associated with the mind, is it the nature of the mind or not?üîΩIf it is the nature of the mind, how can it be associated with the mind?üîΩIf it is not the nature of the mind, how can it be associated with the mind?

original: de la gal te rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di blo'i ngo bor gyur pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la gal te rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di blo'i ngo bor gyur pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is permanent, it cannot be the nature of the mind, because it is permanent.

original: blo dang 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba na yang bdag ni mi shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: blo dang 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba na yang bdag ni mi shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: When the cognition called ‚Äúmind and mental factors‚Äù arises, the self is not a knower,

original: sngar gyi ngo bo las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi ngo bo las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not become different from its previous state.

original: gal te blo dang 'dus par gyur pa na blo'i ngo bo nyid du 'di yang gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te blo dang 'dus par gyur pa na blo'i ngo bo nyid du 'di yang gyur na ni /
translated: If it becomes a knower when it is associated with mind,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo la tha dad pa'i phyir yon tan bzhin du 'di la yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i skyon 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo la tha dad pa'i phyir yon tan bzhin du 'di la yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i skyon 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, like the quality of pleasure, it would have the faults of impermanence, etc., because it would have a different nature from that of pain.

original: gal te bdag dang blo 'dus pa ni yod de /
analyzed: gal te bdag dang blo 'dus pa ni yod de /
translated: If you say that the self and mind are associated,

original: blo dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it has mind,

original: dper na dbyug pa dang / dbyug pa can bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na dbyug pa dang / dbyug pa can bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like a club and one who holds a club,

original: de la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ste /
translated: then we reply:

original: 'du ba dgag pa byas pas na //
analyzed: 'du ba dgag pa byas pas na //
translated: Since we have refuted association,

original: de dang 'brel pa'ang rigs pa min //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'ang rigs pa min //
translated: it is not reasonable to be related to it.

original: bdag gis rab tu byed pa 'dir 'du ba dgag pa byas pas 'du ba med par gyur na /
analyzed: bdag gis rab tu byed pa 'dir 'du ba dgag pa byas pas 'du ba med par gyur na /
translated: Since we have refuted association in this treatise, there is no association.

original: de dag gi 'brel pa yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'brel pa yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The relation between them would not exist.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: bdag ni rtag pa yin la blo ni mi rtag pa yin pas rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag mi 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir me dang grang ba bzhin du 'brel pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa yin la blo ni mi rtag pa yin pas rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag mi 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir me dang grang ba bzhin du 'brel pa med pa yin no //
translated: The self is permanent, but cognition is impermanent. Since the permanent and the impermanent are not similar, they are unrelated, like fire and cold.

original: blo dang 'du ba ji ltar bkag pa bzhin du yon tan gyi tshig gi don rnams kyang dgag par 'dod nas smras pa ;
analyzed: blo dang 'du ba ji ltar bkag pa bzhin du yon tan gyi tshig gi don rnams kyang dgag par 'dod nas smras pa ;
translated: Just as the connection between cognition and the self is refuted, the meaning of the words of the qualities are also to be refuted.

original: bde dang sdug bsngal 'bad dang 'dod //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal 'bad dang 'dod //
translated: Pleasure, pain, effort, and desire,

original: sdang la sogs kyang tshul 'di yin //
analyzed: sdang la sogs kyang tshul 'di yin //
translated: Aversion, etc., are also like this.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rtag pa'i bdag la bde mi brtan //
analyzed: rtag pa'i bdag la bde mi brtan //
translated: Pleasure is not permanent in a permanent self,

original: rgyu dang ldan phyir bum pa bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan phyir bum pa bzhin //
translated: because it has a cause, like a pot.

original: yang na bdag gi yon tan ni //
analyzed: yang na bdag gi yon tan ni //
translated: Or, the quality of the self

original: bde ba yin par ma rtogs te //
analyzed: bde ba yin par ma rtogs te //
translated: is not recognized as pleasure,

original: skye dang ldan phyir gzugs la sogs //üîΩde yi @247a * //
analyzed: skye dang ldan phyir gzugs la sogs // de yi @247a * //
translated: because it arises, like form, etc.üîΩIt is not accepted as

original: yon tan mi 'dod bzhin //
analyzed: yon tan mi 'dod bzhin //
translated: its quality.

original: yang na 'di dag 'du ba ni //
analyzed: yang na 'di dag 'du ba ni //
translated: Or, their connection

original: bdag la yod par ma rtogs nyid //
analyzed: bdag la yod par ma rtogs nyid //
translated: is not recognized as existing in the self.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, this should be applied to the ideas of suffering and so on.

original: de bzhin du bdag yod de zhes bya ba'i blo gang dag yod par grag pa de /üîΩspyi chen po dang 'brel te 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes grag na /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag yod de zhes bya ba'i blo gang dag yod par grag pa de / spyi chen po dang 'brel te 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes grag na /
translated: Likewise, the idea that the self exists is said to occur in relation to a universal.

original: spyi chen po dang 'brel pa de ci bdag rang gi ngo bo yod pa zhig yin nam /
analyzed: spyi chen po dang 'brel pa de ci bdag rang gi ngo bo yod pa zhig yin nam /
translated: If that is so, is the self that is related to a universal existent by nature?

original: rang gi ngo bo med pa zhig yin /üîΩde la / lhan cig yod chen dang 'brel bar //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo med pa zhig yin / de la / lhan cig yod chen dang 'brel bar //
translated: Or is it nonexistent by nature?üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:üîΩIt is illogical for something to exist

original: yod dang med pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: yod dang med pa mi rigs so //
translated: or not to exist in relation to a universal.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yod na'ang de sbyor don med la //üîΩmed na de yang med par 'gyur //
analyzed: yod na'ang de sbyor don med la // med na de yang med par 'gyur //
translated: If it exists, it is pointless to relate it to a universal.üîΩIf it does not exist, it is pointless to relate it to a universal.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba'i blo med pa zhig yin na ni spyi yod pa chen po dang 'brel pa yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba'i blo med pa zhig yin na ni spyi yod pa chen po dang 'brel pa yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If the idea of existence is nonexistent, then it would exist in relation to a universal.

original: rang gi ngo bo yod par gyur ba'i phyir bdag la ni yod pa chen po dang 'brel pa med de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yod par gyur ba'i phyir bdag la ni yod pa chen po dang 'brel pa med de /
translated: But since the self exists by nature, it is not related to a universal.

original: ji ltar grub zin pa'i bum pa la yang bsgrub mi dgos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar grub zin pa'i bum pa la yang bsgrub mi dgos pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as a pot that already exists does not need to be produced.

original: med na yang yod pa chen po dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med na yang yod pa chen po dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And if it does not exist, it cannot be related to what is great, because it does not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the son of a barren woman.

original: gal te bdag yod pa nyid la yod pa chen pos gsal bar byed pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te bdag yod pa nyid la yod pa chen pos gsal bar byed pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: If the self exists, it is clarified by what is great,

original: yod pa'i ngo bo zhig skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa'i ngo bo zhig skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but it is not that the nature of existence is produced.

original: gsal bar byed pas chos gzhan phyir //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pas chos gzhan phyir //
translated: Because it is a different property,

original: de ni gsal byed ji ltar yin //
analyzed: de ni gsal byed ji ltar yin //
translated: how can it be clarified?

original: khyod kyi bdag ni mi gsal ba nyid yin te byas pa ma yin pa nyid yin na de ji ltar yod pa chen pos gsal bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: khyod kyi bdag ni mi gsal ba nyid yin te byas pa ma yin pa nyid yin na de ji ltar yod pa chen pos gsal bar byed pa yin /
translated: Your self is not clarified because it is not produced. How can it be clarified by what is great?

original: 'dir 'di skad du smra bar yang nus te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad du smra bar yang nus te /
translated: Here, this can be said:

original: gsal ba ma yin pa ni gsal bar bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gsal ba ma yin pa ni gsal bar bya bar mi nus te /
translated: That which is not clarified cannot be clarified,

original: mi gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not clarified.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a sky flower.

original: mngon par gsal ba nyid ni rkyen rnyed nas gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba nyid ni rkyen rnyed nas gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Manifestation is the appearance of something that was not previously manifest, like a pot, for example, which is manifested by a lamp.

original: dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu dang / dbyug pa dang / 'khor lo dang / rdza mkhan gyi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen tshogs pa las mngon par grub pa'i bum pa ni mar mes gsal bar byed pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu dang / dbyug pa dang / 'khor lo dang / rdza mkhan gyi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen tshogs pa las mngon par grub pa'i bum pa ni mar mes gsal bar byed pa bzhin te /
translated: Manifestation is the appearance of something that was not previously manifest, like a pot, for example, which is manifested by a lamp.

original: byas pa nyid la mngon par gsal ba mthong bas chos mi mthun pa nyid la mngon par gsal bar grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byas pa nyid la mngon par gsal ba mthong bas chos mi mthun pa nyid la mngon par gsal bar grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since we see that manifestation is only of what is produced, it is established that manifestation is not established in the case of what is dissimilar.

original: yod pa chen po ni bdag gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa chen po ni bdag gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The great existent is not manifested by the self.

original: grangs la sogs dang 'brel pa yang //
analyzed: grangs la sogs dang 'brel pa yang //
translated: The connection with number and so on

original: 'di nyid kyis ni lan btab bo //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis ni lan btab bo //
translated: is also refuted by this.

original: ji skad smras pa'i dpyad pa'i rim pa @247b 'di nyid kyis gcig la sogs pa'i grangs la sogs pa dang skyes bu sbyor bar 'grub par dka'o //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i dpyad pa'i rim pa @247b 'di nyid kyis gcig la sogs pa'i grangs la sogs pa dang skyes bu sbyor bar 'grub par dka'o //
translated: By this very same process of analysis that has been explained, it is difficult to establish the connection of a person with number and so on, such as one and so on.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: yod pa'i gcig nyid dang sbyor ram /
analyzed: yod pa'i gcig nyid dang sbyor ram /
translated: Is the connection with the one that exists or

original: 'on te med pa zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on te med pa zhig yin /
translated: is it with the one that does not exist?

original: de la gal te yod pa'i gcig nyid grangs kyi gcig dang sbyor ba yin na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te yod pa'i gcig nyid grangs kyi gcig dang sbyor ba yin na ni /
translated: If the one that exists is connected with the number one,

original: yang sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the connection is meaningless.

original: 'on te med pa zhig yin na ni 'di ltar med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te med pa zhig yin na ni 'di ltar med pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if it does not exist, then it is just non-existent.

original: mngon par gsal bar byed pa dang sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar byed pa dang sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not connected with that which is manifested,

original: rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is permanent.

original: yod pa chen po dang grangs dag sbyor ba med pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yod pa chen po dang grangs dag sbyor ba med pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: Not only is the connection of the great existent with the number one not tenable,

original: gzhan tshig gi don gyi tshogs lhag ma rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par so sor tshul 'di nyid kyis lan btab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan tshig gi don gyi tshogs lhag ma rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par so sor tshul 'di nyid kyis lan btab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: but also the remaining classes of word-meanings should be individually answered in the same way, as is fitting.

original: tshig gi don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gi don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the words?

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩrdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / 'du ba dang / khyad par la sogs pa thams cad la yod par gyur pa zhig yod pa chen po dang 'brel par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / 'du ba dang / khyad par la sogs pa thams cad la yod par gyur pa zhig yod pa chen po dang 'brel par 'gyur ram /
translated: It is as follows:üîΩIf the great existent is connected with substance, quality, action, universal, collection, particularity, etc.,

original: med pa zhig 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa zhig 'gyur /
translated: is it connected with that which exists or that which does not exist?

original: yod pa zhig yin no zhe na yang sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa zhig yin no zhe na yang sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is existent, then the argument is pointless.

original: med pa zhig go zhe na ni med pa yin pa'i phyir lan smras ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa zhig go zhe na ni med pa yin pa'i phyir lan smras ma thag pa yin no //
translated: If it is nonexistent, then it is nonexistent, and so your response is immediately refuted.

original: gzhan gyi bsam pa blangs nas smras pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pa blangs nas smras pa ni //
translated: Taking up the opponent‚Äôs position, we say:

original: gal te spyi sogs dang 'brel bas //
analyzed: gal te spyi sogs dang 'brel bas //
translated: If it is related to universals and so on,

original: skyes bu spyi dang gcig rtogs par //üîΩde sogs rkyen dang phrad tsam gyis //
analyzed: skyes bu spyi dang gcig rtogs par // de sogs rkyen dang phrad tsam gyis //
translated: then the person is cognized as a universal and as one.

original: skyes bu 'byung bar 'dod na ni //
analyzed: skyes bu 'byung bar 'dod na ni //
translated: If you assert that the person arisesüîΩmerely through the condition of the arising of universals and so on,üîΩthen the person is the mere cause of the arising of the cognition that arises in the form ‚ÄúThe person is related to universals,‚Äù and the cognition that arises in the form ‚ÄúThe person is one‚Äù due to its relation to number, and the cognition that arises in the form ‚ÄúThe person is cognized‚Äù due to its relation to cognition.

original: skyes bu spyi dang 'brel pa tsam gyis spyi yin par rtogs la grangs dang 'brel pas gcig nyid dang / blo dang 'brel pas rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i blo skye ba'i rgyu tsam skyes bu yin no zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis yang dag pa'i tha snyad kyi don du mngon par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu spyi dang 'brel pa tsam gyis spyi yin par rtogs la grangs dang 'brel pas gcig nyid dang / blo dang 'brel pas rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i blo skye ba'i rgyu tsam skyes bu yin no zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis yang dag pa'i tha snyad kyi don du mngon par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: This is what you assert to be the meaning of the term ‚Äúperson‚Äù in correct nominal convention.

original: grol ba'i dus na ni /
analyzed: grol ba'i dus na ni /
translated: But at the time of liberation,

original: yod min med min du ma min //
analyzed: yod min med min du ma min //
translated: it is neither existent nor nonexistent nor both.

original: gcig min phra min chen po min //
analyzed: gcig min phra min chen po min //
translated: It is not one, nor is it many, nor is it large.

original: 'di ni rtag min mi rtag min //
analyzed: 'di ni rtag min mi rtag min //
translated: It is not permanent, nor is it impermanent.

original: gzhan min gzhan min min de nyid ;
analyzed: gzhan min gzhan min min de nyid ;
translated: It is not different, nor is it non-different.üîΩIt is not that itself.

original: / ji ltar bdag bzhin tshig gi don //
analyzed: / ji ltar bdag bzhin tshig gi don //
translated: It is like the self, the meaning of the words.

original: gzhan yang 'di ltar song ba ste //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ltar song ba ste //
translated: Moreover, it has gone like this:

original: 'bad nas gsungs su zin kyang ni //
analyzed: 'bad nas gsungs su zin kyang ni //
translated: Even though it is spoken of with effort,

original: gzegs zan pa yis gsal bar byas //
analyzed: gzegs zan pa yis gsal bar byas //
translated: the SƒÅ·πÉkhya has clarified it.

original: blo la sogs pa bdag gi yon tan bden pa'i ngo bo zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: blo la sogs pa bdag gi yon tan bden pa'i ngo bo zhig yin na ni /
translated: If the qualities of the self, such as intelligence, were the nature of reality,

original: yod pa la sogs pa rtag par 'gyur na bdag yon tan @248a * //
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa rtag par 'gyur na bdag yon tan @248a * //
translated: then existence and so on would be permanent. But for one who is devoid of the qualities of the self,

original: dang mi ldan par gyur pa de la ni yod pa dang med pa dang / gcig dang / du ma dang / phra rab dang / chen po dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa don dam par zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: dang mi ldan par gyur pa de la ni yod pa dang med pa dang / gcig dang / du ma dang / phra rab dang / chen po dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa don dam par zhi ba yin no //
translated: existence and nonexistence, one and many, subtle and coarse, large and small, permanent and impermanent, and so on are ultimately peaceful.

original: bdag 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzhan yang rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams kyang de bzhin te /üîΩyod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzhan yang rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams kyang de bzhin te / yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Not only the self, but also substance, quality, action, and so on, the meanings of the words, are like that.üîΩThey are not existent.

original: med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin /
translated: They are not nonexistent.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not permanent.

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: It is not impermanent.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: 'di dag bdag dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni rang gi mtshan nyid du grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di dag bdag dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni rang gi mtshan nyid du grub par 'gyur na /
translated: If these were to possess a self, they would be established by their own characteristics,

original: bdag dang bral bar gyur pas rang gi ngo bo gzung du med par gyur pa la yod pa dang / med pa dang / gcig dang / du ma dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba 'bad nas gsungs shing sbas kyang /
