analyzed: bdag dang bral bar gyur pas rang gi ngo bo gzung du med par gyur pa la yod pa dang / med pa dang / gcig dang / du ma dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba 'bad nas gsungs shing sbas kyang /
translated: but since they are devoid of self, their essence is not apprehended. How could they exist as existent, nonexistent, singular, plural, permanent, impermanent, and so on?üîΩAlthough he spoke with effort and concealed it,

original: gzegs zan pa'i 'dod pa'i lugs 'di ltar smras pa 'dis bdag cag gi lugs kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: gzegs zan pa'i 'dod pa'i lugs 'di ltar smras pa 'dis bdag cag gi lugs kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: this system of the assertions of KƒÅ≈õyapƒ´ya is spoken in this way.

original: stong pa nyid du shin tu bstan par byas pa yin na //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du shin tu bstan par byas pa yin na //
translated: It is taught that it is emptiness.

original: bdag cag gi lung las ni 'di ltar 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdag cag gi lung las ni 'di ltar 'byung ste /
translated: In our scriptures, it is stated as follows:

original: gzugs ni rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs ni rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: Form is not permanent.

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not impermanent.

original: bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is not blissful.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is not suffering.

original: bdag kyang ma yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang ma yin /
translated: It is not a self,

original: bdag med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it a selflessness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gzugs nyid kyang med na /
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang med na /
translated: Since form itself does not exist,

original: yang rtag pa dang mi rtag par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: yang rtag pa dang mi rtag par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could it be viewed as permanent or impermanent?

original: des na rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: des na rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of the emptiness of intrinsic identity,üîΩeven though you have expressed many different things, you are teaching just emptiness.

original: khyod kyis sna tshogs mang po zhig / brjod du zin kyang stong pa nyid de nyid rab tu ston par byed pa yin pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa kho na bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis sna tshogs mang po zhig / brjod du zin kyang stong pa nyid de nyid rab tu ston par byed pa yin pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa kho na bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, you have established only what is already established for us.

original: gal te grub pa'i mtha' gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bye brag pa la rab tu grub pa ste /
analyzed: gal te grub pa'i mtha' gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bye brag pa la rab tu grub pa ste /
translated: If you say that because there is only one philosophical system, what is well established for the Vai≈õe·π£ikas

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba yin par grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba yin par grub bo zhe na /
translated: is established as seeing reality,

original: 'di dag mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di dag mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i phyir //
translated: we reply: because they apprehend signs,

original: de nyid mthong bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de nyid mthong bar mi rigs so //
translated: it is illogical that they see reality.

original: mtshan ma mi bden par skyes pa'i //
analyzed: mtshan ma mi bden par skyes pa'i //
translated: Because signs arise falsely,

original: ngo bo rtog par mi bden 'dod //
analyzed: ngo bo rtog par mi bden 'dod //
translated: their nature is not accepted as real.

original: blo la sogs pa de rnams mi bden par skyes pa ni mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir chad pa yin la /
analyzed: blo la sogs pa de rnams mi bden par skyes pa ni mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir chad pa yin la /
translated: Since mind and so on arise as untrue, they are impermanent and thus nihilism.

original: sa la sogs pa ni rtag pa'i rdul phra rab dang ldan par 'byung bas rtag par 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ni rtag pa'i rdul phra rab dang ldan par 'byung bas rtag par 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Earth and so on arise possessing permanent subtle particles and thus are apprehended as permanent.

original: @248b des na rnam pa 'di gnyi ga yang mtshan mar lta bas legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @248b des na rnam pa 'di gnyi ga yang mtshan mar lta bas legs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore both of these aspects are not good because they are views of signs.

original: mthar lta ba yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mthar lta ba yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The point is that they are views of extremes.

original: gal te 'di'i don ni brjod par bya ba ma yin na yang spyi zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i don dang 'brel par gyur pa la spyi zhes brjod par bya ba yin gyi de yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor gyur pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di'i don ni brjod par bya ba ma yin na yang spyi zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i don dang 'brel par gyur pa la spyi zhes brjod par bya ba yin gyi de yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor gyur pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the meaning of this is not to be expressed, then it is said that the term generality is to be expressed in connection with the meaning of a thing called a generality, but it is not that it exists and so on.

original: de la brjod par bya ste /üîΩbdag las tha dad gyur pa'i don //
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ste / bdag las tha dad gyur pa'i don //
translated: To that we reply:üîΩWe do not assert that a thing

original: de dang 'brel bar mi 'dod de //üîΩyod pa'i blo phyir blo spyi la //
analyzed: de dang 'brel bar mi 'dod de // yod pa'i blo phyir blo spyi la //
translated: that is different from itself is related to it.üîΩJust as the cognition of existence

original: spyi zhes bya bar 'dod pa bzhin //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya bar 'dod pa bzhin //
translated: is asserted to be the generality of cognition.

original: bdag las tha dad pa'i spyi zhes bya ba dang 'brel pas bdag yod do zhes bya ba'i blo mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni phyogs so //
analyzed: bdag las tha dad pa'i spyi zhes bya ba dang 'brel pas bdag yod do zhes bya ba'i blo mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni phyogs so //
translated: The idea that the self exists because of its relation to a universal called ‚Äúother‚Äù is a position.

original: bden pa'i blo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: bden pa'i blo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The reason is: because the idea of ‚Äúother‚Äù is a true idea.

original: gang dang gang bden pa'i blo 'byung ba de la de las gzhan pa'i don dang 'brel pa ma mthong ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang bden pa'i blo 'byung ba de la de las gzhan pa'i don dang 'brel pa ma mthong ste /
translated: For, whenever a true idea occurs, it is not seen to be related to any other object.

original: ji ltar yod pa chen po de nyid la spyi zhes bya ba'i blo 'byung ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa chen po de nyid la spyi zhes bya ba'i blo 'byung ba de bzhin no //
translated: For example, the idea of ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù occurs in regard to that very thing that exists.

original: de bzhin grangs sogs 'brel pa yang //
analyzed: de bzhin grangs sogs 'brel pa yang //
translated: Likewise, the idea of ‚Äúone‚Äù and so on

original: bdag gam gzhan pa la la la //üîΩmkhas pas ji ltar rigs pa bzhin //
analyzed: bdag gam gzhan pa la la la // mkhas pas ji ltar rigs pa bzhin //
translated: is related to the self or to another,üîΩand the wise should understand

original: blo de min par rtogs par bya //
analyzed: blo de min par rtogs par bya //
translated: that the idea is not what it appears to be.

original: gang yang grangs gcig dang ldan pa las bdag kyang gcig ces rjod par byed kyi yang de nyid ni gcig kyang ma yin du ma yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang grangs gcig dang ldan pa las bdag kyang gcig ces rjod par byed kyi yang de nyid ni gcig kyang ma yin du ma yang ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, when one says that the self is one because it possesses one number, that very self is neither one nor many.

original: de bzhin du blo dang yang dag par ldan pa las rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du blo dang yang dag par ldan pa las rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, the cognition of one, etc., is due to the connection with one, etc., of the mind and the real.

original: yang gzhan sa la sogs pa yang grangs dang mtshungs par ldan pa las gcig la sogs pa'i sgras brjod pa yin gyi de rang nyid kyis ni gcig gi ngo bo yang ma yin la du ma'i ngo bo yang ma yin no thams cad du yang tshul 'di nyid
analyzed: yang gzhan sa la sogs pa yang grangs dang mtshungs par ldan pa las gcig la sogs pa'i sgras brjod pa yin gyi de rang nyid kyis ni gcig gi ngo bo yang ma yin la du ma'i ngo bo yang ma yin no thams cad du yang tshul 'di nyid
translated: Moreover, the expression of one, etc., is due to the connection with one, etc., of earth, etc., but they do not have the nature of one or many by themselves.

original: kyis mkhas pas dgag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kyis mkhas pas dgag par bya ba yin no //
translated: In all cases, the wise should refute them in the same way.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩgrangs dang mtshungs par ldan pa las //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / grangs dang mtshungs par ldan pa las //
translated: How so?

original: bdag dang sa la sogs pa gcig la sogs pa'i blo 'byung bar mi rigs te blo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang sa la sogs pa gcig la sogs pa'i blo 'byung bar mi rigs te blo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The cognition of one, etc., of self, earth, etc., is not tenable due to the connection with one, etc., because of being a cognition.

original: dper na grangs de nyid la grangs dang mtshungs par ldan pas gcig la sogs pa'i blo 'byung ba yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grangs de nyid la grangs dang mtshungs par ldan pas gcig la sogs pa'i blo 'byung ba yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the cognition of one, etc., in regard to the number itself is due to the connection with one, etc., of the number.üîΩMoreover,üîΩThe cognition of self, the non-separation of suffering,

original: gzhan yang / bdag gi blo dang sdug bsngal dang // bde sogs yon tan dang mi 'bral //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bdag gi blo dang sdug bsngal dang // bde sogs yon tan dang mi 'bral //
translated: happiness, etc., and qualities,

original: yon tan yin phyir grangs bzhin no //üîΩde phyir yon tan med bdag min //
analyzed: yon tan yin phyir grangs bzhin no // de phyir yon tan med bdag min //
translated: because of being a quality, like number.
Therefore, the self is not devoid of qualities.üîΩThe self is the substratum of the qualities of intelligence,

original: dang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / 'bad pa dang / chos ma yin pa dang / chos dang / shes pa dang / byas pa'i shugs zhes bya ba bdag gi yon tan kun ni chos can no //
analyzed: dang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / 'bad pa dang / chos ma yin pa dang / chos dang / shes pa dang / byas pa'i shugs zhes bya ba bdag gi yon tan kun ni chos can no //
translated: pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, effort, non-virtue, virtue, knowledge, and power.

original: de don dam par bdag dang mi 'bral te zhes bya ba ni chos so ;
analyzed: de don dam par bdag dang mi 'bral te zhes bya ba ni chos so ;
translated: It is not ultimately devoid of them.

original: / yon tan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: / yon tan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: Because of being a quality.

original: gang dang gang yon tan yin pa de ni de kho na nyid du bdag dang mi 'bral te /
analyzed: gang dang gang yon tan yin pa de ni de kho na nyid du bdag dang mi 'bral te /
translated: That which is a quality is not ultimately devoid of the self,

original: dper na grangs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grangs bzhin no //
translated: like number.üîΩEven when liberated, it is the self, and therefore, like number, it is not liberated from one.

original: grol bar gyur pa na yang bdag nyid yin pas grangs kyi gcig las grol bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin du blo la sogs pa las kyang thams cad du grol bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: grol bar gyur pa na yang bdag nyid yin pas grangs kyi gcig las grol bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin du blo la sogs pa las kyang thams cad du grol bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, intelligence and so on are not at all liberated from it.

original: bdag yon tan dang bral ba nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag yon tan dang bral ba nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that the self is devoid of qualities.

original: gang yang yid rang gi bdag la gnas pa na thar pa yin no zhes zer ba de la yang /
analyzed: gang yang yid rang gi bdag la gnas pa na thar pa yin no zhes zer ba de la yang /
translated: Also, for one who says that when the mind abides in its own self, that is liberation,üîΩthe mind would be devoid of its own self,

original: yul dang ngo bo dbyer med kyang //üîΩgang zhig rang gi bdag med 'gyur //
analyzed: yul dang ngo bo dbyer med kyang // gang zhig rang gi bdag med 'gyur //
translated: because the object and the nature are inseparable.

original: bdag dang sbyor ba 'dod pa las ;
analyzed: bdag dang sbyor ba 'dod pa las ;
translated: When the mind is connected to the self,

original: / dran nas shes pa kun du 'byung //
analyzed: / dran nas shes pa kun du 'byung //
translated: then mindfulness and cognition arise.

original: bdag gzugs dang ldan par gyur na ni phyogs dang yang ldan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag gzugs dang ldan par gyur na ni phyogs dang yang ldan par 'gyur la /
translated: If the self were connected to form, then it would be connected to space.

original: phyogs dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid yid rang nyid gnas par gyur na phyogs dang mi ldan pa'i bdag la ci ltar yid rang nyid la gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyogs dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid yid rang nyid gnas par gyur na phyogs dang mi ldan pa'i bdag la ci ltar yid rang nyid la gnas par 'gyur /
translated: If the mind that is connected to space abides in its own self, how could the self that is not connected to space abide in its own self?

original: gang gi tshe bdag nyid phyogs kyi rang gi gnas la yid sbyor bar gyur na ni 'khor ba'i dus na ni dran pa dang / shes pa 'byung bar 'dod la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag nyid phyogs kyi rang gi gnas la yid sbyor bar gyur na ni 'khor ba'i dus na ni dran pa dang / shes pa 'byung bar 'dod la /
translated: When the mind is connected to its own abode, space, then mindfulness and cognition arise in the period of cyclic existence.

original: thar pa'i dus na ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i 'dod pa nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: thar pa'i dus na ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i 'dod pa nyams pa yin no //
translated: But when one is liberated, nonconceptual intuition arises.

original: phyogs cha dbyer med pa yin pa'i phyir na yang /
analyzed: phyogs cha dbyer med pa yin pa'i phyir na yang /
translated: And because it is not divisible into parts,

original: ma mthong nges pa'ang sngar bzhin du //
analyzed: ma mthong nges pa'ang sngar bzhin du //
translated: certainty about nonperception is as before.

original: thal 'gyur lan yang 'di la yin //
analyzed: thal 'gyur lan yang 'di la yin //
translated: The reductio is also the same here.

original: med pa'i skye ba bkag pas na //
analyzed: med pa'i skye ba bkag pas na //
translated: Since the arising of the nonexistent is refuted,

original: de yi sbyor ba'ang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de yi sbyor ba'ang mi 'dod do //
translated: we do not accept its application.

original: ma mthong ba'i nges pa ni nges par chos la mngon par sbyor ba na chos ma yin pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i nges pa ni nges par chos la mngon par sbyor ba na chos ma yin pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The certainty of nonperception is the abandonment of non-Dharma when one definitely applies oneself to Dharma.

original: de ni phyogs cha med pa'i bdag la mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni phyogs cha med pa'i bdag la mi rigs so //
translated: That is not tenable for a partless self.

original: chos dang bdag gnyis sbyor bar 'gyur na yang ci phyogs gcig gis sbyor ram 'on te bdag nyid thams cad kyis yin /
analyzed: chos dang bdag gnyis sbyor bar 'gyur na yang ci phyogs gcig gis sbyor ram 'on te bdag nyid thams cad kyis yin /
translated: If Dharma and self were to be applied, then would they be applied in part or in their entirety?

original: de la phyogs gcig gis sbyor ro zhe na ni /
analyzed: de la phyogs gcig gis sbyor ro zhe na ni /
translated: If they are applied in part,

original: phyogs gcig pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: then, because they would have parts, they would be impermanent, like pots and so on.

original: bdag nyid thams cad @249b kyis sbyor ba yin na ni gcig chos dang ldan par gyur pa na /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad @249b kyis sbyor ba yin na ni gcig chos dang ldan par gyur pa na /
translated: If the self were the appropriator of all, then when one part possesses a property,

original: kun kyang chos dang ldan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: kun kyang chos dang ldan par 'gyur la /
translated: all would possess that property.üîΩWhen one part does not possess a property, all would not possess that property.

original: gcig chos ma yin pa dang ldan par gyur pa na thams cad kyang chos dang mi ldan par 'gyur ba la sogs pa ji ltar grangs can gyi de kho na nyid la 'jug par smras pa de bzhin du 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gcig chos ma yin pa dang ldan par gyur pa na thams cad kyang chos dang mi ldan par 'gyur ba la sogs pa ji ltar grangs can gyi de kho na nyid la 'jug par smras pa de bzhin du 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the SƒÅ·πÉkhya proponents of reality assert, here too it should be applied in the same way.

original: med pa la ni skye ba yang med par bdag gis sngar bsgrubs zin pas skye ba med pa'i yi dam ma mthong ba'i skyon med pa ji ltar bdag dang sbyor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa la ni skye ba yang med par bdag gis sngar bsgrubs zin pas skye ba med pa'i yi dam ma mthong ba'i skyon med pa ji ltar bdag dang sbyor bar 'gyur /
translated: Since I have already proven that what is nonexistent does not arise, how could the fault of not seeing the truth of nonarising apply to me?üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / yid dang bdag gi med pa la //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yid dang bdag gi med pa la //
translated: The self and mind do not exist.

original: rten dang brten par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rten dang brten par mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not assert that they are the support and the supported.

original: bdag dang yid ni yod na'ang /
analyzed: bdag dang yid ni yod na'ang /
translated: Even if the self and mind exist,

original: rten dang brten par mi 'dod do //üîΩre zhig bdag ni med de /
analyzed: rten dang brten par mi 'dod do // re zhig bdag ni med de /
translated: I do not assert that they are the support and the supported.

original: dmigs par ma gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par ma gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: First, the self does not exist because it is not observed.

original: yid kyang med de /
analyzed: yid kyang med de /
translated: The mind also does not exist because it is not observed.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not produced.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag dang yid dag rten dang brten par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag dang yid dag rten dang brten par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the non-existent self and mind be the supported and the supporter?

original: yang gal te bdag dang yid ni yod do zhe na /
analyzed: yang gal te bdag dang yid ni yod do zhe na /
translated: Moreover, if the self and mind exist,

original: de lta na yang 'di dag rtag pa med par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pas /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di dag rtag pa med par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pas /
translated: in that case, they would not be devoid of permanence, and so

original: rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could they be the supported and the supporter?

original: des na thar pa rgyu med par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des na thar pa rgyu med par bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, liberation is taught to be causeless.

original: rnam rtog rgyu mtshan bcas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam rtog rgyu mtshan bcas pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the conceptualization with a reason.

original: rdzas sogs mthong bas grol bar ni //
analyzed: rdzas sogs mthong bas grol bar ni //
translated: Liberation is not seen through seeing substance and so on.

original: ji ltar 'ug pa mi 'dod pa //
analyzed: ji ltar 'ug pa mi 'dod pa //
translated: Just as an owl does not desireüîΩa bat,

original: de bzhin 'ug pa pa mi 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin 'ug pa pa mi 'dod //
translated: so a bat does not desire an owl.

original: rnam rtog thams cad dang bral ba shing zad pa'i me bzhin du yongs su 'da' bar 'dod pa ni khyod kyi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam rtog thams cad dang bral ba shing zad pa'i me bzhin du yongs su 'da' bar 'dod pa ni khyod kyi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: You assert that liberation is the complete transcendence of all conceptualization, like a fire without fuel.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa de yang rdzas la sogs pa tshig gi don 'dzin par byed pas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa de yang rdzas la sogs pa tshig gi don 'dzin par byed pas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that non-conceptualization does not exist, because it grasps the meaning of words such as substance.

original: des na gang thams cad mthong bar 'dod pa'i thub pa 'ug pa pa yang re zhig grol bar gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gang thams cad mthong bar 'dod pa'i thub pa 'ug pa pa yang re zhig grol bar gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even the sage owl who desires to see everything is not liberated for a while,

original: rdzas la sogs pa rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa'i phyir na /
translated: because he conceptualizes substance and so on, and he has the signs of conceptualization.

original: yang de'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brang ba 'ug pa pa rnams rdzas la sogs pa'i tshig gi don de kho na nyid du goms par byas pas thar pa grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni srid pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: yang de'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brang ba 'ug pa pa rnams rdzas la sogs pa'i tshig gi don de kho na nyid du goms par byas pas thar pa grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni srid pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not possible for the followers of his scriptures, the owls, to attain liberation by cultivating the meaning of the words substance and so on in reality.

original: gzhan yang / sa sogs de nyid 'byung ba'i blo //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sa sogs de nyid 'byung ba'i blo //
translated: Moreover, Ka·πáƒÅda asserts that

original: thar pa min par gzegs zan 'dod //
analyzed: thar pa min par gzegs zan 'dod //
translated: the cognition of the reality of earth and so on is not liberation.

original: khyad par dag ni mi 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: khyad par dag ni mi 'dzin phyir //
translated: Because it does not apprehend distinctions,

original: 'tsho ba'i de nyid blo bzhin no //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i de nyid blo bzhin no //
translated: it is like the cognition of the reality of life.

original: sa la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ni sa la sogs pa'i de @250a * //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ni sa la sogs pa'i de @250a * //
translated: The reality of earth and so on is the reality of earth and so on.

original: nyid de / rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / 'du ba dang / spyi dang / khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyid de / rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / 'du ba dang / spyi dang / khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Substance, quality, action, universal, particular, inherence.

original: sa la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid la 'byung ba'i blo ni sa la sogs pa'i de nyid 'byung ba'i blo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid la 'byung ba'i blo ni sa la sogs pa'i de nyid 'byung ba'i blo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cognition of the reality of earth, etc. is the cognition of the reality of earth, etc.

original: chos can no //
analyzed: chos can no //
translated: This is the subject.

original: de ni grol ba'i yul ma yin pas gzegs zan la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ni blo nyid du mi rigs pa de ni de'i chos so //
analyzed: de ni grol ba'i yul ma yin pas gzegs zan la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ni blo nyid du mi rigs pa de ni de'i chos so //
translated: The reality of Kanada, etc. is not reasonable as cognition, because it is not the object of liberation. This is its property.

original: kun du 'dzin pa ni nye bar len pa'i khyad par gang la yod pa de ni kun du 'dzin pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: kun du 'dzin pa ni nye bar len pa'i khyad par gang la yod pa de ni kun du 'dzin pa'i khyad par te /
translated: That which has the distinction of grasping is the distinction of grasping.

original: de'i ngo bo ni kun du 'dzin pa'i khyad par nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni kun du 'dzin pa'i khyad par nyid do //
translated: Its nature is the distinction of grasping.

original: de yi phyir /
analyzed: de yi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: kun du 'dzin pa'i khyad par nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: kun du 'dzin pa'i khyad par nyid ces bya'o //
translated: it is called the distinction of grasping.

original: gang dang gang kun du 'dzin pa'i khyad par yin pa de ni gzegs zan la sogs pa'i grol ba ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang kun du 'dzin pa'i khyad par yin pa de ni gzegs zan la sogs pa'i grol ba ste /
translated: That which is the distinction of grasping is the liberation of Kanada, etc.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is unreasonable.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na 'tsho ba dang / zag pa dang / sdom pa dang / rgas pa med pa dang / 'chi ba dang / las dang / sdig pa dang / bsod nams dang / thar pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dgu la dmigs pa gcer pur spyod pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'tsho ba dang / zag pa dang / sdom pa dang / rgas pa med pa dang / 'chi ba dang / las dang / sdig pa dang / bsod nams dang / thar pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dgu la dmigs pa gcer pur spyod pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi blo bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition of reality of those who are nakedly engaged in the nine topics of discourse, namely, life, defilement, vow, aging, death, action, sin, merit, and liberation.

original: rab tu byed pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mdor bsdus pas gzegs zan la sogs pa'i mtha' spang ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mdor bsdus pas gzegs zan la sogs pa'i mtha' spang ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to abandon the extreme of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on, the summary of the complete treatise is stated:

original: bye brag pa yi de nyid la'ang //
analyzed: bye brag pa yi de nyid la'ang //
translated: The reality of the Vai≈õe·π£ika

original: lta ngan rab rib skyes pas na //
analyzed: lta ngan rab rib skyes pas na //
translated: is also born from the cataract of bad views.

original: des na rigs pa dang bral phyir //
analyzed: des na rigs pa dang bral phyir //
translated: Therefore, because it is devoid of reasoning,

original: blo ni dga' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: blo ni dga' bar mi bya'o //
translated: the mind should not delight in it.

original: lta ba ngan pa nyid rab rib yin pas lta ngan rab rib ste /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa nyid rab rib yin pas lta ngan rab rib ste /
translated: Since bad views themselves are cataracts, they are bad views and cataracts.

original: mun pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mun pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have the nature of darkness.

original: gang la 'dir lta ba ngan pa'i rab rib kyi dang tshul yod pa de ni bye brag pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: gang la 'dir lta ba ngan pa'i rab rib kyi dang tshul yod pa de ni bye brag pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i de kho na nyid de /
translated: That which has the mode of bad views and cataracts here is the reality that is asserted by the Vai≈õe·π£ika.

original: ji skad smras pa'i dpyad pa'i rim pas rigs pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i dpyad pa'i rim pas rigs pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is devoid of reasoning through the process of analysis as it is described.

original: kho bo cag bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa la dmigs pa rnams kyi blo ni de la dga' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa la dmigs pa rnams kyi blo ni de la dga' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, our minds do not delight in that.

original: des na ji skad du /
analyzed: des na ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sa las gzhan pa'i gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: sa las gzhan pa'i gzugs la sogs //
translated: ‚ÄúThe form and so on that are other than earth

original: gang dag ma mthong ba reg ces //
analyzed: gang dag ma mthong ba reg ces //
translated: Are not seen, but contact is.

original: mngon sum la yang slu byed na //
analyzed: mngon sum la yang slu byed na //
translated: If there is deception even in direct perception,

original: lkog tu gyur la de ci ltar //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur la de ci ltar //
translated: How could it be otherwise in the case of the hidden?‚Äù

original: ji ltar dkar sogs nges pa la //üîΩci yin zhes ni rtogs byed cing //
analyzed: ji ltar dkar sogs nges pa la // ci yin zhes ni rtogs byed cing //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as in the case of ascertaining white and so on,üîΩOne wonders what it is,üîΩAnd it is well known that one conceives of the existenceüîΩOf some other hidden substance.‚Äù

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i rdzas gzhan cig / yod ces rtog par byed pa grag / rmongs pas 'di ni mi shes pas //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i rdzas gzhan cig / yod ces rtog par byed pa grag / rmongs pas 'di ni mi shes pas //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of delusion, this is not understood.

original: ji srid gzugs kyi bsags pa la //
analyzed: ji srid gzugs kyi bsags pa la //
translated: As long as there is an accumulation of form,

original: bsags @250b zhes 'du shes rgyas 'byung ba //
analyzed: bsags @250b zhes 'du shes rgyas 'byung ba //
translated: The notion of accumulation arises.

original: mthong la de dag the tshom za //üîΩsor mo gnyis las gzhan gyur pa'i //üîΩsor gnyis zhes bya gzhan yod na //
analyzed: mthong la de dag the tshom za // sor mo gnyis las gzhan gyur pa'i // sor gnyis zhes bya gzhan yod na //
translated: When it is seen, they doubt it.üîΩIf there were something called ‚Äòtwo fingers‚ÄôüîΩThat was other than the two fingers,

original: ngos na gnas pa gcig nyid las //
analyzed: ngos na gnas pa gcig nyid las //
translated: Then it would be one that exists on the two sides.

original: gzhan pa'i sor mo gnyis mi dmigs //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i sor mo gnyis mi dmigs //

original: de yi phyed ni der yod pa //
analyzed: de yi phyed ni der yod pa //
translated: Half of it exists there.

original: ma yin yin na phyed gnyis mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ma yin yin na phyed gnyis mi 'gyur //
translated: If it were, it would not be half of two.

original: sor mo de gnyis kyi phyed pas //
analyzed: sor mo de gnyis kyi phyed pas //

original: des na phyed sor 'jug ma yin //
analyzed: des na phyed sor 'jug ma yin //
translated: Therefore, half a finger does not engage.

original: rten ni gzung ba med pas na //
analyzed: rten ni gzung ba med pas na //
translated: Since the basis is not apprehended,

original: rdzas gzung bar mi 'dod ce na //üîΩrdul gcig rdul gnyis kyis brtsams pas //
analyzed: rdzas gzung bar mi 'dod ce na // rdul gcig rdul gnyis kyis brtsams pas //
translated: It is not asserted that substance is apprehended.üîΩIs it not that one atom and two atoms are not apprehended

original: 'dzin pa med pa ma yin nam //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa ma yin nam //
translated: Because they are composed of two atoms?

original: gzugs dang rigs kyis khyad 'phags pa'i //
analyzed: gzugs dang rigs kyis khyad 'phags pa'i //
translated: By weaving yarn that is superior in form and type,

original: skud pa las ni gos byas pas //
analyzed: skud pa las ni gos byas pas //

original: de las gzhan pa'i sna tshogs can //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sna tshogs can //

analyzed: gzugs dang ris su rtog par byed // de bzhin mud ga chu dang tshva //
translated: Are imagined to have form and type.üîΩIn the same way, there is no vegetable dish

original: sogs las gzhan pa'i tshod ma med //
analyzed: sogs las gzhan pa'i tshod ma med //
translated: Other than mustard, water, salt, etc.

original: mtshon las gzhan pa mdung yang men //
analyzed: mtshon las gzhan pa mdung yang men //
translated: There is no spear other than a weapon,

original: gser dang shing las gzhan khri med //
analyzed: gser dang shing las gzhan khri med //
translated: And no throne other than gold and wood.

original: steng 'og 'byung dang gnas pa dag //
analyzed: steng 'og 'byung dang gnas pa dag //
translated: The upper and lower parts, arising and abiding,

original: phyogs gcig gos la gnas pa yin //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gos la gnas pa yin //

original: lung las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba dang // gnas pa zhes bya 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: lung las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba dang // gnas pa zhes bya 'ga' yang med //

original: gang phyir yul kun brten pa yi //üîΩyul can nyams pa'ang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gang phyir yul kun brten pa yi // yul can nyams pa'ang mi 'dod do //

original: yul rnams 'gro las bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yul rnams 'gro las bzlog pa'i phyir //

original: brkyang bskum sogs kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: brkyang bskum sogs kyang ma yin no //
translated: it is not like the stretching and contracting of the arms.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rtsom pa dang // srang las gzhan pa'i dma' ba ni //üîΩmig 'phrul mkhan las gzhan pa yi //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rtsom pa dang // srang las gzhan pa'i dma' ba ni // mig 'phrul mkhan las gzhan pa yi //
translated: The beginning of the performance of action and the loweringüîΩof the scale-pans are not established as being different from theüîΩscale-pans.üîΩThe well-known is not established as being different from the

original: rab tu grags pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: rab tu grags pa mi 'grub po //
translated: magician.

original: mi rtsom zhe na gang ji ltar //
analyzed: mi rtsom zhe na gang ji ltar //
translated: If it is said that it does not begin, then how is it that the

original: 'du ba'i bya ba dag dang rgyur //
analyzed: 'du ba'i bya ba dag dang rgyur //
translated: action of coming together is the cause?

original: byed pa gnas par mi rigs te //
analyzed: byed pa gnas par mi rigs te //
translated: It is not tenable that the agent abides in the action,

original: de ltar yon tan la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan la yang ngo //
translated: and it is the same for the qualities.üîΩBecause it is the cause of beginning, the scale-pan that is

original: rtsom pa'i rgyu phyir ma nyams la //
analyzed: rtsom pa'i rgyu phyir ma nyams la //
translated: not impaired

original: cha shas kyis ni gnas na yang //
analyzed: cha shas kyis ni gnas na yang //
translated: abides even when it is partially lowered.

original: bya ba dang ni mi 'gal nyid //
analyzed: bya ba dang ni mi 'gal nyid //

analyzed: gos kyi phyed dang nye bar gnas // de bzhin mar me dang sbyor bas //
translated: It is like the half-cloth that is nearby.üîΩJust as it is asserted that the form changes into another

original: gzugs gzhan nyid du 'gyur 'dod ltar //
analyzed: gzugs gzhan nyid du 'gyur 'dod ltar //
translated: form,

original: rdzas gzhan dag gi khyad par gyis //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan dag gi khyad par gyis //
translated: And by the difference of other substances.üîΩ

original: gsal bar byed pa yod min no //üîΩde ltar mig gis mthong don la'ang //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa yod min no // de ltar mig gis mthong don la'ang //
translated: There is no manifestation by the difference of other substances.üîΩThus, the mind is impaired by bad reasoning

original: rtog ge ngan pas nyams pa'i sems //
analyzed: rtog ge ngan pas nyams pa'i sems //
translated: with regard to the object seen by the eye.

original: ji bzhin don du mi mthong na //
analyzed: ji bzhin don du mi mthong na //
translated: If one does not see the object as it is,

analyzed: nang la ji ltar sems par byed // ces bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: how can one think about the internal?

original: de lta bas na sngar bstan pa'i de kho na nyid ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na sngar bstan pa'i de kho na nyid ni /

analyzed: rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir dga' ba skyed par byed pa yin no // dbu ma'i snying @251a * //
translated: generates joy because it is not in conflict with reasoning.

original: po'i 'grel ba rtog ge 'bar ba las bye brag pa'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: po'i 'grel ba rtog ge 'bar ba las bye brag pa'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa ste /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the reality of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, the seventh chapter of the Commentary on the Heart of the Middle Way called the Blazing Reasoning.

original: le'u bdun pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bdun pa'o /
translated: Chapter Eight: The Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka

original: // / de nas da ni rig byed kyi mtha' smra ba'i de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pas le'u brgyad pa brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: // / de nas da ni rig byed kyi mtha' smra ba'i de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pas le'u brgyad pa brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Now, in order to determine the reality of the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka proponents of the VedƒÅnta, I will begin the eighth chapter.

original: de la / rig byed mthar smras smras pa ni ;
analyzed: de la / rig byed mthar smras smras pa ni ;
translated: The Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas say:

original: /'dus byas stong par smra ba yi //
analyzed: /'dus byas stong par smra ba yi //
translated: The externalists who speak of compounded emptiness

original: phyi rol pa la bdag rig dkon //
analyzed: phyi rol pa la bdag rig dkon //
translated: rarely know the self.

original: bdag sdang thar pa ga la yod //
analyzed: bdag sdang thar pa ga la yod //
translated: How can one who hates the self be liberated?

original: rig pa'i mthar phyin pa ni rig byed mtha' pa ste //
analyzed: rig pa'i mthar phyin pa ni rig byed mtha' pa ste //
translated: The VedƒÅntins are those who have mastered the Vedas.

original: chags pa med par nges par rig pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa med par nges par rig pa'o //
translated: They are certain that there is no attachment.üîΩHow can they have the nature of speaking

original: de smra ba'i ngang tshul ga la yod pa'am /
analyzed: de smra ba'i ngang tshul ga la yod pa'am /
translated: or have words?

original: tshig de gang la yod pa ni rig byed kyi mthar smra ba'o //
analyzed: tshig de gang la yod pa ni rig byed kyi mthar smra ba'o //
translated: They are the VedƒÅntins who speak of the end of the Vedas.

original: de dag ni 'di skad smra ste /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di skad smra ste /
translated: They say this:

original: rig byed kyi mthar lta ba las gzhan pa phyi rol gyi bstan bcos la bdag rig pa yang shin tu dkon /
analyzed: rig byed kyi mthar lta ba las gzhan pa phyi rol gyi bstan bcos la bdag rig pa yang shin tu dkon /
translated: ‚ÄúOther than the view of the end of the Vedas, it is very rare to find someone who knows the self in the external treatises.

original: bdag la sdang pa'i sangs rgyas pa rnams gang la brten nas thar pa thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag la sdang pa'i sangs rgyas pa rnams gang la brten nas thar pa thob par 'gyur /
translated: How can those Buddhists who hate the self attain liberation in dependence on them?

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni 'dus byas thams cad stong pa'o snyam du sems shing 'dus byas stong pa ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ni skad cig skad cig la 'jig pa yin pas su zhig bcings shing grol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni 'dus byas thams cad stong pa'o snyam du sems shing 'dus byas stong pa ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ni skad cig skad cig la 'jig pa yin pas su zhig bcings shing grol bar 'gyur /
translated: Because they think that all conditioned phenomena are empty, and conditioned phenomena that are empty and devoid of essence disintegrate moment by moment. Therefore who is bound and who is liberated?‚Äù

original: bdag rtag pa'i ngo bo ni de'i rten yin pa'i phyir bcings pa dang grol bar rig pa'i ngo bo yin pas des na rig byed las grags pa'i skyes bu ni nye bar bsngags par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: bdag rtag pa'i ngo bo ni de'i rten yin pa'i phyir bcings pa dang grol bar rig pa'i ngo bo yin pas des na rig byed las grags pa'i skyes bu ni nye bar bsngags par bya ba yin pas /
translated: The nature of the eternal self is the nature of the one who is bound and liberated because it is the support of that. Therefore, the person who is known in the Vedas is to be praised.

original: mun pa las gzhan skyes bus ni //
analyzed: mun pa las gzhan skyes bus ni //
translated: The person is different from darkness.

original: chen por gyur pa nyi ma'i 'od //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa nyi ma'i 'od //
translated: The light of the sun is great.

original: dbang phyug chen po bdag de nyid //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po bdag de nyid //
translated: The self is the great lord.

original: mkhas pas shes na 'chi med 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pas shes na 'chi med 'gyur //
translated: If the wise know it, they become immortal.

original: mi bde bar gyur cing mi bde bar byed pas na mun pa ste /
analyzed: mi bde bar gyur cing mi bde bar byed pas na mun pa ste /
translated: Darkness is unpleasant and makes others unpleasant.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i cha bsags pa nyid kyi khams gsum du srid pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i cha bsags pa nyid kyi khams gsum du srid pa'o //
translated: The three realms are existence because they are the accumulation of the aspects of cause and effect.

original: khams gsum zhes bya bar grags pa'i mun pa de las gzhan pa ni khams gsum las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khams gsum zhes bya bar grags pa'i mun pa de las gzhan pa ni khams gsum las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Darkness is known as the three realms. The person who is different from that is said to transcend the three realms.

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor las shin tu 'das pa na mun pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor las shin tu 'das pa na mun pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Beyond the sphere of the earth is the sphere of darkness.

original: mun pa'i dkyil 'khor las shin tu 'das pa na skyes bu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: mun pa'i dkyil 'khor las shin tu 'das pa na skyes bu gnas pa yin te /
translated: Beyond the sphere of darkness is where the person abides.

original: skyes bu drang srong chen po nyi ma'i mdog / mun pa las gzhan gyur pa de rig na //
analyzed: skyes bu drang srong chen po nyi ma'i mdog / mun pa las gzhan gyur pa de rig na //
translated: The great sage, the sun, is known to be different from the darkness.

original: 'chi ba med par 'gyur te bdag gis rtogs //
analyzed: 'chi ba med par 'gyur te bdag gis rtogs //
translated: One becomes immortal, I have understood.

original: skye med gnas 'gro ba la lam gzhan med //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye med gnas 'gro ba la lam gzhan med // ces bya ba'o //
translated: There is no other path for going to the abode of the unborn.

original: 'jig pa'i sngon rol nas yod pa'am gnyid @251b log pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir skyes bu'am /üîΩskyong bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i sngon rol nas yod pa'am gnyid @251b log pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir skyes bu'am / skyong bar byed pa'am /
translated: Because it exists prior to destruction, or because it is different from sleep, it is a person.

original: 'gengs par byed pas na skyes bu'o //
analyzed: 'gengs par byed pas na skyes bu'o //
translated: Or, it is a person because it is a protector, or because it fills.

original: chen por gyur ba ni thams cad pas lhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen por gyur ba ni thams cad pas lhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is great because it is superior to all.

original: kha dog sna tshogs can yin pa'i phyir nyi ma'i 'od do //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs can yin pa'i phyir nyi ma'i 'od do //
translated: It is the sun because it has various colors.

original: nyi ma ni 'od sna tshogs can yin te /
analyzed: nyi ma ni 'od sna tshogs can yin te /
translated: The sun has various colors,

original: 'di ltar dkar po dang / sngon po dang / dmar po dang / ba bla dang / yung ba dang / phug ron dang / btsong dang / ka pi dza la'i kha dog 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dkar po dang / sngon po dang / dmar po dang / ba bla dang / yung ba dang / phug ron dang / btsong dang / ka pi dza la'i kha dog 'dzin pa'o //
translated: because it has the colors of white, blue, red, yellow, black, pigeon, copper, and kapi jala.

original: ci'i phyir nyi ma'i 'od zer 'di dag dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyi ma'i 'od zer 'di dag dang ldan zhe na /
translated: Why does the sun have these rays?

original: lha thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: lha thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa'am /
translated: because he is the nature of all the gods,

original: dbang phyug chen po'i ngo bo yang 'di yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i ngo bo yang 'di yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because he is the essence of Mahe≈õvara.

original: gang 'dir nyi ma'i dkar po'i ngo bor 'dug pa ni zla ba'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang 'dir nyi ma'i dkar po'i ngo bor 'dug pa ni zla ba'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Here, what appears as the white aspect of the sun is the nature of the moon.

original: gang me lha dang zla ba gnyis las ni chu'i mdog go //
analyzed: gang me lha dang zla ba gnyis las ni chu'i mdog go //
translated: From the two, Agni and Candra, is the color of water.

original: gang nor lha dag gis brten pa las ni de dmar po'o //
analyzed: gang nor lha dag gis brten pa las ni de dmar po'o //
translated: From what is supported by the gods of wealth, it is red.

original: gang ru tra bde byed dag gi bdag nyid yin pas ni dkar la dmar ba'o //
analyzed: gang ru tra bde byed dag gi bdag nyid yin pas ni dkar la dmar ba'o //
translated: From what is the nature of Rudra and ≈öiva, it is white and red.

original: gang dbang po yin pa las ni du ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang dbang po yin pa las ni du ba lta bu'o //
translated: From what is Indra, it is like smoke.

original: gang bshes gnyen yin pa las ni yung gi mdog go //
analyzed: gang bshes gnyen yin pa las ni yung gi mdog go //
translated: From what is B·πõhaspati, it is the color of indigo.

original: gang bshes gnyen dang chu lha yin pa'i bdag nyid las ni rdul dang yung gi mdog go //
analyzed: gang bshes gnyen dang chu lha yin pa'i bdag nyid las ni rdul dang yung gi mdog go //
translated: From what is the nature of B·πõhaspati and Varu·πáa, it is the color of dust and indigo.

original: gang dag ra ka nyid kyi ni smug por ro //
analyzed: gang dag ra ka nyid kyi ni smug por ro //
translated: From what is RƒÅhu, it is brown.üîΩFrom what is Vi·π£·πáu, it is yellow.

original: gang sna tshogs kyi lha yin pas ni myur ba'o //
analyzed: gang sna tshogs kyi lha yin pas ni myur ba'o //
translated: From what is the god of variety, it is swift.

original: gang dbang phyug yin pa de las ni tshangs pa'i mdog go //
analyzed: gang dbang phyug yin pa de las ni tshangs pa'i mdog go //
translated: From what is Mahe≈õvara, it is the color of BrahmƒÅ.

original: aa ta zhes bya ba rtag tu 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: aa ta zhes bya ba rtag tu 'gro ba ste /
translated: The word ata means always going.

original: 'byung po thams cad rtag tu 'dir 'gro ba'am 'byung po thams cad la rtag tu 'dir 'gro bas bdag go //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad rtag tu 'dir 'gro ba'am 'byung po thams cad la rtag tu 'dir 'gro bas bdag go //
translated: All beings always go here, or all beings always go here, so it is self.

original: de nyid ni kun la khyab pa yin pa'i phyir chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni kun la khyab pa yin pa'i phyir chen po'o //
translated: It is great because it pervades everything.

original: dbang phyug ni 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is lord because it transcends the entire world.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can nyid kyi skyes bu rnal 'byor pa gang gis lha'i mig gis mthong ba de ni 'ching ba las shin tu 'das nas rga ba dang 'chi ba med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can nyid kyi skyes bu rnal 'byor pa gang gis lha'i mig gis mthong ba de ni 'ching ba las shin tu 'das nas rga ba dang 'chi ba med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogi who sees this kind of person with the divine eye, having completely transcended bondage, attains immortality.

original: skyes bu ni kha dog sna tshogs can yin na yang de lta na yang 'gro bar gyur pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pa'i mtshan ma 'di yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu ni kha dog sna tshogs can yin na yang de lta na yang 'gro bar gyur pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pa'i mtshan ma 'di yin te /
translated: Although the person has various colors, even so, when becoming a yogi, this is the sign:

original: byed po dbang phyug gser mdog tu //
analyzed: byed po dbang phyug gser mdog tu //
translated: The creator, the lord, is golden-colored,

original: gang zhig mthong zhing lta ba de //
analyzed: gang zhig mthong zhing lta ba de //
translated: whoever sees and looks at him,

original: sdig dang bsod nams las 'das nas //
analyzed: sdig dang bsod nams las 'das nas //
translated: having transcended sin and merit,

original: mchog tu zhi ba thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mchog tu zhi ba thob par 'gyur //
translated: attains supreme peace.

original: gser ni sa les sam ste /üîΩde dang 'dra ba'i mdog can gyi bdag gang yin pa de yang dag par brtags nas bsam gtan gyi mig gis mthong bar gyur @252a * //
analyzed: gser ni sa les sam ste / de dang 'dra ba'i mdog can gyi bdag gang yin pa de yang dag par brtags nas bsam gtan gyi mig gis mthong bar gyur @252a * //
translated: Gold is the earth.

original: pa na bdag gis dbang phyug chen po mthong ngo zhes 'di ltar nges par bya'o //
analyzed: pa na bdag gis dbang phyug chen po mthong ngo zhes 'di ltar nges par bya'o //
translated: Having examined and contemplated that which has the color of gold, when one sees it with the eye of concentration, one should ascertain that one has seen Mahe≈õvara.

original: de lta bur mthong ba na sdig pa dang bsod nams kyi bdag nyid dang / gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i 'ching ba rnams bcad nas mchog ste /
analyzed: de lta bur mthong ba na sdig pa dang bsod nams kyi bdag nyid dang / gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i 'ching ba rnams bcad nas mchog ste /
translated: When one sees in this way, having cut the bonds of the nature of sin and merit and of both, one attains the supreme,

original: khyad par can ni zhi ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par can ni zhi ba ste /
translated: the special, peace.

original: zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid bya ba thams cad las log pa rnam par mi rtog pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid bya ba thams cad las log pa rnam par mi rtog pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of peace is the attainment of non-conceptuality, the cessation of all activity.

original: 'di 'jig rten gsum las shin tu 'das pa yin na byed pa po ji ltar yin /
analyzed: 'di 'jig rten gsum las shin tu 'das pa yin na byed pa po ji ltar yin /
translated: If this is utterly beyond the three worlds, how can it be the creator?

original: ring nas gnas pa yin na gang gi dbang phyug yin zhe na /
analyzed: ring nas gnas pa yin na gang gi dbang phyug yin zhe na /
translated: If it has existed for a long time, whose lord is it?

original: ring na gnas su zin kyang kun la khyab pa nyid du smras pa /
analyzed: ring na gnas su zin kyang kun la khyab pa nyid du smras pa /
translated: Even though it has existed for a long time, it is said to pervade all.

original: byung gyur byung dang 'byung ba bdag / thams cad skyes bu yin 'dod de //
analyzed: byung gyur byung dang 'byung ba bdag / thams cad skyes bu yin 'dod de //
translated: The past, present, and future are all the person.

original: de ni phyi nang ring ba dang // de ni nye dang de las byed //
analyzed: de ni phyi nang ring ba dang // de ni nye dang de las byed //
translated: He is the external and internal, the distant and the near, and he is the creator.

original: gang mi la sogs pa 'das par gyur pa dang / da ltar byung ba mthong bar gyur pa'i gzugs dang / gang phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba de thams cad skyes bus byin gyis brlabs nas gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gang mi la sogs pa 'das par gyur pa dang / da ltar byung ba mthong bar gyur pa'i gzugs dang / gang phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba de thams cad skyes bus byin gyis brlabs nas gnas pa'am /
translated: All that has been seen as form in the past and present, and all that will be seen in the future, is blessed by the person and exists.

original: khams gsum thams cad la 'dis khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad la 'dis khyab pa yin te /
translated: He pervades the entire three worlds.

original: gang gi phyir steng gi phyogs ni 'di'i mgo bo'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir steng gi phyogs ni 'di'i mgo bo'o //
translated: The upper part is his head.

original: 'og gi phyogs ni rkang pa'o //
analyzed: 'og gi phyogs ni rkang pa'o //
translated: The lower part is his feet.

original: nam mkha' ni lto'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni lto'o //
translated: The sky is his belly.

original: phyogs rnams ni lag pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs rnams ni lag pa'o //
translated: The directions are his arms.

original: gza' dang rgyu skar rnams ni skra'o //üîΩri bo rnams ni brang ngo //
analyzed: gza' dang rgyu skar rnams ni skra'o // ri bo rnams ni brang ngo //
translated: The planets and stars are his hair.üîΩThe mountains are his chest.

original: ri'i phreng ba ni rus pa'o //
analyzed: ri'i phreng ba ni rus pa'o //
translated: The mountain ranges are his bones.

original: chu klung rnams ni rtsa'i dra ba'o //
analyzed: chu klung rnams ni rtsa'i dra ba'o //
translated: The rivers are his network of veins.

original: nags tshal rnams ni spu dang sen mo'o //
analyzed: nags tshal rnams ni spu dang sen mo'o //
translated: The forests are his body hair and nails.

original: rgyab ni mtho ris kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: rgyab ni mtho ris kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The upper world is his back.

original: dpral ba ni tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: dpral ba ni tshangs pa'o //
translated: The forehead is Brahma.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa ni smin ma gnyis so //
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa ni smin ma gnyis so //
translated: The eyebrows are Dharma and Adharma.

original: khro gnyer ni 'chi bdag go //
analyzed: khro gnyer ni 'chi bdag go //
translated: The frown is the Lord of Death.

original: nyi zla ni mig gnyis so //
analyzed: nyi zla ni mig gnyis so //
translated: The eyes are the sun and moon.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa ni rlung ngo //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa ni rlung ngo //
translated: The inhalation and exhalation of breath are the wind.

original: ri bran rnams ni so'o //
analyzed: ri bran rnams ni so'o //
translated: The teeth are the mountains.

original: lce ni dbyangs can ma'o //
analyzed: lce ni dbyangs can ma'o //
translated: The tongue is Sarasvati.

original: aom zhes bya ba'i yi ge dang / ba sha tha zhes bya ba'i yi ge ni mchu gnyis so //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba'i yi ge dang / ba sha tha zhes bya ba'i yi ge ni mchu gnyis so //
translated: The two lips are the two syllables Om and Va.

original: mig phye ba dang btsums pa ni dus so //
analyzed: mig phye ba dang btsums pa ni dus so //
translated: The opening and closing of the eyes is time.

original: gyon pa'i phyogs ni bud med do //
analyzed: gyon pa'i phyogs ni bud med do //
translated: The side of the body is a woman.

original: gyas pa'i phyogs ni skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gyas pa'i phyogs ni skyes pa'o //
translated: The back of the body is a man.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten ma yin pa ni nu ma'i bar ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten ma yin pa ni nu ma'i bar ro //
translated: The space between the breasts is the mundane and the supramundane.

original: sor mo rnams ni ri'i bar ro //üîΩpus mo gnyis ni gser 'dab gnyis so //
analyzed: sor mo rnams ni ri'i bar ro // pus mo gnyis ni gser 'dab gnyis so //
translated: The fingers are the mountains.üîΩThe two knees are the two golden mountains.

original: rje ngar gnyis ni tha skar gyi bu gnyis so //
analyzed: rje ngar gnyis ni tha skar gyi bu gnyis so //
translated: The two shanks are the two sons of Aswini.

original: rked smad ni nyin zhag go //
analyzed: rked smad ni nyin zhag go //
translated: The lower part of the body is the day and night.

original: mje rlig ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: mje rlig ni dbang po'o //
translated: The penis is the lord.

original: dga' ba'i rang bzhin ni skye dgu'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rang bzhin ni skye dgu'i bdag po'o //
translated: The nature of pleasure is Prajapati.

original: rkang pa gnyis ni khyab @252b 'jug go //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis ni khyab @252b 'jug go //
translated: The two feet are the pervasion.

original: kha dog rnams ni khrag go //
analyzed: kha dog rnams ni khrag go //
translated: The colors are the blood.

original: de ni phyi dang nang dang ring ba dang nye ba na gnas pa yin pas dus thams cad du 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang smin par bya ba la sogs pa rnams la 'jug pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyi dang nang dang ring ba dang nye ba na gnas pa yin pas dus thams cad du 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang smin par bya ba la sogs pa rnams la 'jug pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since it is located externally and internally, far and near, it is always engaged in going, coming, ripening, etc.

original: gal te gcig nyid yin na bya ba du ma rnams la 'jug pa dang / mi zad par 'gyur ba nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gcig nyid yin na bya ba du ma rnams la 'jug pa dang / mi zad par 'gyur ba nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: If it is one, how can it be engaged in many actions and be inexhaustible?

original: dpe'i sgo nas sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: dpe'i sgo nas sgrub par byed de /
translated: It is established by way of example:

original: srid pa sna tshogs de las skyes //
analyzed: srid pa sna tshogs de las skyes //
translated: From it arises the variety of existences,

original: dar gyi srin bu'i skud pa bzhin //üîΩji ltar srin pa la byed pa'i srin bu srin bal gyi snal ma mang po skyed par byed kyang 'gyur ba yang med la /üîΩzad pa yang med pa de bzhin du skyes bus khams gsum du skyed par byed du zin kyang 'gyur ba yang med la /
analyzed: dar gyi srin bu'i skud pa bzhin // ji ltar srin pa la byed pa'i srin bu srin bal gyi snal ma mang po skyed par byed kyang 'gyur ba yang med la / zad pa yang med pa de bzhin du skyes bus khams gsum du skyed par byed du zin kyang 'gyur ba yang med la /
translated: like thread from a ball of thread.

original: zad pa yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: zad pa yang med pa yin no //
translated: Just as a silkworm, although it produces many threads, does not change and is not exhausted, so too, although a person produces the three realms, he does not change and is not exhausted.

original: 'di ni srid pa 'ba' zhig gi rgyur ma zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa 'ba' zhig gi rgyur ma zad kyi /
translated: This is not only the cause of existence,

original: srid pa dang bral ba'i yang byed pa po yin no zhes smras pa /
analyzed: srid pa dang bral ba'i yang byed pa po yin no zhes smras pa /
translated: but also the agent of freedom from existence.

original: mkhas pa de yi char thim pa //
analyzed: mkhas pa de yi char thim pa //
translated: The wise one dissolves into that,

original: yang srid len par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang srid len par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and does not take up existence again.

original: gang gi tshe mkhas pa bsam gtan la rnal 'byor pas blo gros kyi mig gis de mthong bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mkhas pa bsam gtan la rnal 'byor pas blo gros kyi mig gis de mthong bar gyur pa na /
translated: When the wise one, the yogi, sees that with the eye of intelligence,

original: de nyid du thim par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nyid du thim par 'gyur gyi /
translated: he dissolves into that.

original: de ni sdig pa thams cad spangs pa yin pas yang srid kyi 'gro bar skye zhing sdug bsngal gyi snod du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni sdig pa thams cad spangs pa yin pas yang srid kyi 'gro bar skye zhing sdug bsngal gyi snod du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Since he abandons all evil, he does not take birth in the transmigration of existence and become a vessel of suffering.

original: yang gang gi phyir rnal 'byor pas skyes bu ma mthong na bdud rtsi 'thob pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: yang gang gi phyir rnal 'byor pas skyes bu ma mthong na bdud rtsi 'thob pa ma yin pas /
translated: Moreover, since the yogi does not attain immortality if he does not see the person,

original: 'di'i rgyu smras pa /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu smras pa /
translated: the cause of that is stated:

original: 'chi bcas rnams la bdud rtsi med //
analyzed: 'chi bcas rnams la bdud rtsi med //
translated: Immortality does not exist for those who are mortal,

original: me la grang ba ji bzhin no //
analyzed: me la grang ba ji bzhin no //
translated: just like cold does not exist in fire.

original: des na bdud rtsi skyes bu nyid //
analyzed: des na bdud rtsi skyes bu nyid //
translated: Therefore, immortality is the person.

original: ma rtogs bdud rtsi yod mi rigs //
analyzed: ma rtogs bdud rtsi yod mi rigs //
translated: It is not reasonable that immortality exists without realization.

original: 'chi bar 'os pa'am /
analyzed: 'chi bar 'os pa'am /
translated: One who is worthy of death

original: 'chi ba yin pas na 'chi bcas te 'jig rten thams cad do //
analyzed: 'chi ba yin pas na 'chi bcas te 'jig rten thams cad do //
translated: ‚ÄúDeath‚Äù is the world, because it is subject to death.

original: de ni ngo bo nyid kyis rtag tu 'chi ba yin pas bdud rtsi nyid yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid kyis rtag tu 'chi ba yin pas bdud rtsi nyid yin par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that it is nectar, because it is always by nature subject to death.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir me'i rang bzhin tsha ba nyid la grang ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir me'i rang bzhin tsha ba nyid la grang ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is not its nature, just as the nature of fire is heat, and it is not cold.

original: de'i phyir na 'chi bdag gi yul las ma 'das pa'i skyes bu rtogs par ma gyur pa 'chi ba dang bcas pa rnams kyis bdud rtsi 'thob par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'chi bdag gi yul las ma 'das pa'i skyes bu rtogs par ma gyur pa 'chi ba dang bcas pa rnams kyis bdud rtsi 'thob par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that people who have not understood that they are not beyond the domain of the Lord of Death, who are subject to death, attain nectar.üîΩIn order to praise its greatness,

original: 'di ni mthu che ba nyid bsngags par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩgang las mchog gyur gzhan med phyir //
analyzed: 'di ni mthu che ba nyid bsngags par bya ba'i phyir / gang las mchog gyur gzhan med phyir //
translated: it is said:üîΩBecause there is nothing higher than it,

original: gang las dam pa gzhan med la //
analyzed: gang las dam pa gzhan med la //
translated: because there is nothing holier than it,

original: 'di las phra gyur gzhan med pas //
analyzed: 'di las phra gyur gzhan med pas //
translated: because there is nothing more subtle than it,

original: sna tshogs 'di dag rgyu gcig nyid //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'di dag rgyu gcig nyid //
translated: this variety is a single cause.

original: gang gi phyir mchog tu @253a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mchog tu @253a * //
translated: Because there is nothing higher than it,

original: gyur pa nyid dang / dam par gyur pa nyid dang / gtso bor gyur pa nyid dang / bra bar gyur pa nyid 'di las gzhan med do //
analyzed: gyur pa nyid dang / dam par gyur pa nyid dang / gtso bor gyur pa nyid dang / bra bar gyur pa nyid 'di las gzhan med do //
translated: It is the only one, the supreme one, the chief one, and the most excellent one.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan brgyad dang ldan pas phyug par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ba nyid bstan pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan brgyad dang ldan pas phyug par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ba nyid bstan pa /
translated: The yogi/nƒ´ who is rich with these eight qualities is taught:

original: de ni phra dang rags dang ldan //
analyzed: de ni phra dang rags dang ldan //
translated: That is subtle, coarse, and endowed,

original: yang ldan gtso bo dbang sgyur ba //
analyzed: yang ldan gtso bo dbang sgyur ba //
translated: endowed again, chief, and sovereign,

original: rab phye 'dod pa'i mthar thug gang //
analyzed: rab phye 'dod pa'i mthar thug gang //
translated: fully opened, and the ultimate of desires,

original: rnal 'byor ji ltar 'dod par 'gro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ji ltar 'dod par 'gro //
translated: the yogi/nƒ´ goes as desired.

original: de ni gcig nyid yin yang khams gsum sna tshogs bsdus pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni gcig nyid yin yang khams gsum sna tshogs bsdus pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Although that is one, it is the nature that includes the variety of the three realms.

original: der ni 'byung ba thams cad kyang //
analyzed: der ni 'byung ba thams cad kyang //
translated: There, all the elements

original: bdag nyid du ni 'dus par mthong //
analyzed: bdag nyid du ni 'dus par mthong //
translated: are seen as included in the self.

original: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i 'byung ba thams cad kyang bdag de nyid kyi khongs su 'dus par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i 'byung ba thams cad kyang bdag de nyid kyi khongs su 'dus par gyur pa yin no //
translated: All the elements, moving and unmoving, are included within that self.

original: gzhan yang bdag de nyid mthong na //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag de nyid mthong na //
translated: Moreover, when that self is seen,

original: byis dang mkhas dang gdol pa dang // bram ze sogs rnams mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: byis dang mkhas dang gdol pa dang // bram ze sogs rnams mnyam pa nyid //
translated: Child, learned, outcast, brahmin, and so on, are the same.

original: sdig dang bsod nams khyad par med par gyur pas mnyam pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sdig dang bsod nams khyad par med par gyur pas mnyam pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: They are the same because there is no difference between sin and virtue.

original: gal te 'ba' zhig 'di skad du /
analyzed: gal te 'ba' zhig 'di skad du /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThis is so,‚Äù

original: gang skyes bu ni thams cad du khyab pa gcig nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang skyes bu ni thams cad du khyab pa gcig nyid yin la /
translated: then the self that pervades all beings is one.

original: de las lha dang mi la sogs pa 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi lus rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: de las lha dang mi la sogs pa 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi lus rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: From that, the various bodies of beings, such as gods and humans, arise.

original: ji ltar lus can bzhin du mi rtag pa dang / thams cad du ma khyab pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lus can bzhin du mi rtag pa dang / thams cad du ma khyab pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that the self is not impermanent like the body and not a nature that pervades everything?

original: de la lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de la lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To respond to that, it is said:

original: bum pa 'byung zhing 'jig pa ltar //
analyzed: bum pa 'byung zhing 'jig pa ltar //
translated: Like a vase that arises and is destroyed,

original: nam mkha' de yi bdag nyid min //
analyzed: nam mkha' de yi bdag nyid min //
translated: space is not its nature.

original: lus can 'byung zhing 'jig pa ltar //
analyzed: lus can 'byung zhing 'jig pa ltar //
translated: Like embodied beings that arise and are destroyed,

original: de bdag yin pas bdag mi 'dod //
analyzed: de bdag yin pas bdag mi 'dod //
translated: the self is not accepted as being that.

original: ji ltar bum pa dang rdza so la sogs pa 'byung zhing 'jig par 'gyur ba na nam mkha' ni bum pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin pa ltar de bzhin du skyes bu yang lus can rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dbye ba skye zhing 'jig pa nyams
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa dang rdza so la sogs pa 'byung zhing 'jig par 'gyur ba na nam mkha' ni bum pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin pa ltar de bzhin du skyes bu yang lus can rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dbye ba skye zhing 'jig pa nyams
translated: Just as when a pot, a baked clay pot, and so on, arise and are destroyed, space does not become the nature of a pot.

original: su myong du zin kyang lus can gyi ngo bo nyid du ni gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: su myong du zin kyang lus can gyi ngo bo nyid du ni gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, even though a person experiences the arising and destruction of various types of embodied beings, he does not become the nature of an embodied being.

original: gzhan the tshom za ba bzlog par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha'i dpe grub par ston pa /
analyzed: gzhan the tshom za ba bzlog par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha'i dpe grub par ston pa /
translated: To eliminate the doubts of others, it is shown that the example of space is established:üîΩJust as the space in a pot is one with the space outside,

original: bum pa'i nam mkha' bzhin du gcig / du ma'o zhen bum pa dag / chag na dbyer med gcig nyid du //
analyzed: bum pa'i nam mkha' bzhin du gcig / du ma'o zhen bum pa dag / chag na dbyer med gcig nyid du //
translated: when the pot is destroyed, they are not differentiated as one or many.

original: thams cad mnyam par 'gyur bar 'dod //
analyzed: thams cad mnyam par 'gyur bar 'dod //
translated: It is asserted that all is equal.

original: gang khyod kyi nam mkha' gcig nyid yin yang bum pa che chung la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur @253b ba ltar bdag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhe na /
analyzed: gang khyod kyi nam mkha' gcig nyid yin yang bum pa che chung la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur @253b ba ltar bdag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhe na /
translated: You may say, ‚ÄúJust as space is one, it becomes differentiated by the divisions of large and small pots and so on. Likewise, the self is also like that.‚Äù

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: bum pa thams cad kyi nam mkha' la khyad par med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bum pa thams cad kyi nam mkha' la khyad par med pa nyid yin te /
translated: The space within all pots is not different.

original: bum pa gcig chag par gyur pa'i nam mkha' dang / bum pa gzhan chag pa'i nam mkha' khyad par med pa de bzhin du bum pa thams cad kyi nam mkha' yang yin pa /
analyzed: bum pa gcig chag par gyur pa'i nam mkha' dang / bum pa gzhan chag pa'i nam mkha' khyad par med pa de bzhin du bum pa thams cad kyi nam mkha' yang yin pa /
translated: The space within a single pot that has been destroyed is not different from the space within another pot that has been destroyed.

original: de bzhin du bdag kyang lus can thams cad la khyad bar med pa yin pas lus tha dad na yang bdag ni thams cad la mnyam par yod pa'i phyir bum pa'i nam mkha'i dpe ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag kyang lus can thams cad la khyad bar med pa yin pas lus tha dad na yang bdag ni thams cad la mnyam par yod pa'i phyir bum pa'i nam mkha'i dpe ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the space within all pots is the same, the self is also the same for all embodied beings. Therefore, although the bodies are different, the self is present equally in all of them. The example of the space within the pot is not unestablished.

original: yang tshul gzhan gyis bdag gcig pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir /üîΩji ltar bum sogs tha dad kyang ;
analyzed: yang tshul gzhan gyis bdag gcig pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir / ji ltar bum sogs tha dad kyang ;
translated: In order to prove the self‚Äôs oneness by another method, he says:üîΩJust as there is no difference at all

original: / sa la tha dad 'ga' yang med //üîΩde bzhin lus ni za dad kyang //
analyzed: / sa la tha dad 'ga' yang med // de bzhin lus ni za dad kyang //
translated: in the earth that is in a pot and so on,üîΩso there is no difference at all

original: bdag la tha dad 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: bdag la tha dad 'ga' yang med //
translated: in the self that is in different bodies.

original: ji ltar bum pa dang kham phor la sogs pa rdzas tha dad du yod du min kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa dang kham phor la sogs pa rdzas tha dad du yod du min kyang /
translated: Just as the earth that is in a pot, a plate, and so on is not different in substance,

original: de'i rgyur gyur pas yin pa la dbye ba 'ga' yang med pa de bzhin du lha la sogs pa'i lus kyi dbye ba yod du zin kyang /üîΩbdag la ni dbye ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pas yin pa la dbye ba 'ga' yang med pa de bzhin du lha la sogs pa'i lus kyi dbye ba yod du zin kyang / bdag la ni dbye ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: so too there is no difference in the self, even though there is a difference in the bodies of gods and so on.

original: gzhan yang / ji ltar bum pa'i nam mkha' gcig / rdul dang du bas bsgribs pa na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ji ltar bum pa'i nam mkha' gcig / rdul dang du bas bsgribs pa na //
translated: Moreover, just as space in a pot

original: thams cad de bzhin ma yin ltar //
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin ma yin ltar //
translated: is not everywhere,

original: bde sogs de bzhin bdag la min //
analyzed: bde sogs de bzhin bdag la min //
translated: so too pleasure and so on are not in the self.

original: gang sangs rgyas pas bdag tu smra ba rnams la sngar smras pa'i skyon bdag thams cad du khyab pa yin na gcig bde bar gyur pa na thams cad kyang bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir spang par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas pas bdag tu smra ba rnams la sngar smras pa'i skyon bdag thams cad du khyab pa yin na gcig bde bar gyur pa na thams cad kyang bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir spang par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The proponents of a self who are Buddhists have already been told that if the self is all-pervading, then the faults stated earlier, such as when one part is happy all would be happy, would apply.

original: nam mkha' ni kun la khyab pa yin na yang /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni kun la khyab pa yin na yang /
translated: Space is all-pervading,

original: bum pa gcig gi nang gi nam mkha'i rdul dang du ba la sogs pas bsgribs pa na bum pa thams cad kyis nam mkha' bsgribs par gyur pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: bum pa gcig gi nang gi nam mkha'i rdul dang du ba la sogs pas bsgribs pa na bum pa thams cad kyis nam mkha' bsgribs par gyur pa ma yin zhing /
translated: When the space within one vase is obscured by dust, smoke, and so forth, it is not the case that all vases obscure space.

original: gcig bsgribs pa dang bral bar gyur pas thams cad bsgribs pa dang bral ba ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir skyes bu gcig bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa na thams cad bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gcig bsgribs pa dang bral bar gyur pas thams cad bsgribs pa dang bral ba ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir skyes bu gcig bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa na thams cad bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa ma yin zhing /
translated: When one is obscured, and when one is freed from obscuration, it is not the case that all are obscured, and that all are freed from obscuration. In the same way, when one person is happy, it is not the case that all are happy.

original: gcig sdug bsngal par gyur pa na thams cad kyang sdug bsngal bar gyur pa na thams cad kyang sdug bsngal bar gyur pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig sdug bsngal par gyur pa na thams cad kyang sdug bsngal bar gyur pa na thams cad kyang sdug bsngal bar gyur pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: When one is suffering, it is not the case that all are suffering.

original: yang ji ltar 'di dag so so'i rgyud la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'di dag so so'i rgyud la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that happiness and suffering arise in the continuum of each individual?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / bdag ma zhes shing ma rtogs pas //üîΩrmi lam @254a * //
analyzed: smras pa / bdag ma zhes shing ma rtogs pas // rmi lam @254a * //
translated: Because of not knowing and not understanding selflessness,

original: longs spyod nga rgyal bzhin //
analyzed: longs spyod nga rgyal bzhin //
translated: like the pride of enjoying a dream,

original: las rnams sogs shing dge ba dang // mi dge'i 'bras bu spyod pa yin //
analyzed: las rnams sogs shing dge ba dang // mi dge'i 'bras bu spyod pa yin //
translated: And it experiences the results of virtue and nonvirtue.üîΩAs long as it does not see itself,

original: ji srid du 'dis bdag mthong bar ma gyur cing bdag ma shes pa de srid du /
analyzed: ji srid du 'dis bdag mthong bar ma gyur cing bdag ma shes pa de srid du /
translated: And as long as it does not know itself,

original: rmi lam gyi nang du mi bden pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod par nga rgyal byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang du mi bden pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar longs spyod par nga rgyal byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: It is like the person who is conceited about enjoying unreal forms and so on in a dream.

original: bdag kun nas mi shes pa nyid kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byas nas /
analyzed: bdag kun nas mi shes pa nyid kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byas nas /
translated: In the same way, the self, which is completely ignorant, performs virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba de'i 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod par byed pa yin no /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba de'i 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod par byed pa yin no /
translated: And it experiences the results of that virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
translated: The Blaze of Reasoning, a commentary on the essence of the middle way, volume 22

original: skyes bu ni byed pa po dang spyod pa po nyid yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu ni byed pa po dang spyod pa po nyid yin te /
translated: The person is the agent and the experiencer

original: sdig pa dang / bsod nams nye bar sogs par byed pa dang / nye bar spyod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdig pa dang / bsod nams nye bar sogs par byed pa dang / nye bar spyod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it accumulates and experiences sin and merit.
