original: chags sogs 'ching pa las grol ba //
analyzed: chags sogs 'ching pa las grol ba //
translated: One is liberated from the bonds of attachment, etc.

original: grol ba zhes ni brjod pa yin //
analyzed: grol ba zhes ni brjod pa yin //
translated: This is called liberation.

original: phul po'i rgyun nyid thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi snang bas grol ba'i lam bsgrubs nas 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba zhes bya ba kun du sbyor ba rnams bcad pa ni grol ba zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan par rigs pa yin la /
analyzed: phul po'i rgyun nyid thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi snang bas grol ba'i lam bsgrubs nas 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba zhes bya ba kun du sbyor ba rnams bcad pa ni grol ba zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan par rigs pa yin la /
translated: It is reasonable to teach that liberation is the cessation of the fetters called attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, and views, which are accomplished by the path of liberation through the light of the wisdom arisen from hearing, contemplating, and meditating on the excellent continuum.

original: gang skye ba dang / 'gag pa'i chos can nyid kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs skad cig ma snga ma las khyad par can du gyur pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma phyi ma 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni thar pa zhes bya bar brjod par rigs so //
analyzed: gang skye ba dang / 'gag pa'i chos can nyid kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs skad cig ma snga ma las khyad par can du gyur pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma phyi ma 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni thar pa zhes bya bar brjod par rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to call the arising of a later moment of mind, which is superior to the previous moment of mind and mental factors that have the nature of arising and ceasing, ‚Äúliberation.‚Äù

original: yang mu stegs can gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa'i /
analyzed: yang mu stegs can gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa'i /
translated: Moreover, the self that is imagined by other tƒ´rthikas

original: nam mkha' 'dra ba'i bdag la ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'dra ba'i bdag la ni //
translated: is like space.

original: 'di dag thams cad brjod par dka' //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad brjod par dka' //
translated: It is difficult to speak about all of these.

original: gal te bdag la lhag chags na //
analyzed: gal te bdag la lhag chags na //
translated: If one is attached to the self,

original: nam mkha'i me tog bdag 'dod kyi //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog bdag 'dod kyi //
translated: then I assert that the self is like a sky flower.

original: kha ba dang / ba mo 'bab pa dang / rlung shin tu drag po lang ba dang / me chen po 'bar bar gyur pa dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer shin tu tsha ba 'bab pa dang / phyogs bzhi nas langs pa'i rlung chen pos dkrugs pa'i sprin gyi phung po chen pos khebs par gyur cing 'jigs su rung ba'i 'brug gi sgra chen po sgrigs pa dang /
analyzed: kha ba dang / ba mo 'bab pa dang / rlung shin tu drag po lang ba dang / me chen po 'bar bar gyur pa dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer shin tu tsha ba 'bab pa dang / phyogs bzhi nas langs pa'i rlung chen pos dkrugs pa'i sprin gyi phung po chen pos khebs par gyur cing 'jigs su rung ba'i 'brug gi sgra chen po sgrigs pa dang /
translated: Snow, mist, very strong winds, great fires, the very hot rays of the sun, great clouds stirred up by great winds rising in the four directions, covering everything and making a great frightening sound of thunder,

original: glog gi tshogs kyi phreng ba 'byung bar 'gyur yang @260b nam mkha' la gnod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa bskyed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: glog gi tshogs kyi phreng ba 'byung bar 'gyur yang @260b nam mkha' la gnod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa bskyed pa ma yin la /
translated: and the appearance of a garland of lightning do not harm the sky or produce defilements.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i gnod pa de dag dang bral bar gyur pa yang sdar gyi mtshan nyid las mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur ba yang med do //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i gnod pa de dag dang bral bar gyur pa yang sdar gyi mtshan nyid las mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur ba yang med do //
translated: And even though it becomes free from the harm as it was taught, it does not become different from its former characteristics.

original: de bzhin du bdag kyang sngon dang phyi ma'i dus su khyad par yod par mi skye bas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag kyang sngon dang phyi ma'i dus su khyad par yod par mi skye bas /
translated: In the same way, I also do not arise with a difference in the past and future.

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal skye bar gyur pa na yang 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal skye bar gyur pa na yang 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: When desire, anger, and pride arise, there is no change.

original: nyon mongs pa zhi bar gyur ba na yang skad cig ma snga ma las rang bzhin gzhan du gyur pa med pas bcings pa dang / grol ba la sogs pa shin tu sdug bsngal dang bcas pas kyang brjod par mi nus pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhi bar gyur ba na yang skad cig ma snga ma las rang bzhin gzhan du gyur pa med pas bcings pa dang / grol ba la sogs pa shin tu sdug bsngal dang bcas pas kyang brjod par mi nus pa yin no //
translated: When the afflictions are pacified, there is no change in the nature of the mind from the previous moment. Therefore, it is not possible to say that it is bound or liberated, and so on.

original: des na bcings pa dang thar pa la sogs pa'i rten du yang 'di ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bcings pa dang thar pa la sogs pa'i rten du yang 'di ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the basis of bondage, liberation, and so on.

original: gal te thog ma med pa'i dus nas bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyis mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis khyod bdag la shin tu chags par byed na nam mkha'i me tog kyang 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid can yin pas de yang bdag yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te thog ma med pa'i dus nas bdag tu 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyis mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis khyod bdag la shin tu chags par byed na nam mkha'i me tog kyang 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid can yin pas de yang bdag yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If you are attached to the self because of the power of manifest clinging through the latent potential of self-grasping since beginningless time, then since even the sky flower has such characteristics, it too would be the self.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang / dpe'i chos mtshungs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang / dpe'i chos mtshungs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Because the property to be proven and the property of the example are similar in their characteristics.

original: gzhan yang / gang phyir bdag ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang phyir bdag ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Moreover, if the self is asserted

original: shes pa'i ngo bor 'dod na ni //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bor 'dod na ni //
translated: to be the nature of consciousness,

original: byed pa la sogs ltos pa'i phyir //
analyzed: byed pa la sogs ltos pa'i phyir //
translated: because it would rely on the eye and so on,

original: de ni gcig tu mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni gcig tu mi rigs so //
translated: it is not reasonable that it is one.

original: gal te bdag 'di snga nas shes pa'i ngo bo zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te bdag 'di snga nas shes pa'i ngo bo zhig yin na /
translated: If this self were previously the nature of consciousness,

original: ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa byed pa rnams la ltos pa yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa byed pa rnams la ltos pa yin /
translated: why would it rely on the eye and so on, which are its agents?

original: yang gal te mig la sogs ba med par 'di shes pa nyid mi dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: yang gal te mig la sogs ba med par 'di shes pa nyid mi dmigs so zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause without the eye and so on, consciousness is not observed,‚Äù

original: byed pa la sogs pa las gzhan pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir gcig nyid nyams par gyur te /
analyzed: byed pa la sogs pa las gzhan pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir gcig nyid nyams par gyur te /
translated: then because it is not observed to be different from the eye and so on, its oneness is undermined.

original: grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: This contradicts your tenets.

original: 'di ltar gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: bdag sogs shes bya yod pas na //
analyzed: bdag sogs shes bya yod pas na //
translated: because objects of knowledge such as the self exist,

original: shes pa ldog par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: shes pa ldog par mi 'gyur te //
translated: consciousness would not cease.

original: don byas zin pa'i mar me yang //
analyzed: don byas zin pa'i mar me yang //
translated: Even if a lamp has performed its function,

original: rang gi rgyud las skye bar mthong//
analyzed: rang gi rgyud las skye bar mthong//
translated: We see that it arises from its own continuum.

original: gal te don bya ba byas zin nas rnam par shes pa yul la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te don bya ba byas zin nas rnam par shes pa yul la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the object to be known has already been known, consciousness does not engage the object.

original: ji ltar mthong bar 'dod pa'i don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bzung ba'i mar mes dngos po mthong bar gyur zin nas phyis 'jug pa med pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong bar 'dod pa'i don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bzung ba'i mar mes dngos po mthong bar gyur zin nas phyis 'jug pa med pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Just as, for example, having already seen the object that is to be illuminated by the light, the light does not illuminate it again.

original: 'di mi 'dra ba nye bar bkod ba yin te /üîΩji @261a * //
analyzed: 'di mi 'dra ba nye bar bkod ba yin te / ji @261a * //
translated: This is not a similar example.

original: ltar mar me ni don bya ba byas zin nas /
analyzed: ltar mar me ni don bya ba byas zin nas /
translated: The light, having already performed its function,

original: snum dang / snying po la sogs pa rang gi rgyu rgyun ma chad par 'byung ba nyid yod na ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snum dang / snying po la sogs pa rang gi rgyu rgyun ma chad par 'byung ba nyid yod na ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: does not cease to exist as long as the continuum of its own causes, such as the wick and the oil, is not exhausted.

original: de bzhin du don bya ba byas su zin kyang bdag rnam par shes pa'i grol ba thams cad la khyab par mthong bas ldog par me 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don bya ba byas su zin kyang bdag rnam par shes pa'i grol ba thams cad la khyab par mthong bas ldog par me 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, even though the object to be known has already been known, the self does not cease to exist, because we see that it pervades all consciousnesses.

original: 'di ni mar me bzhin du grol ba'i dus na yang 'jug pa med par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mar me bzhin du grol ba'i dus na yang 'jug pa med par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that, like the light, it does not engage at the time of liberation.

original: des na shes pa'i mig gis skyes bu mthong bar gyur na yang grol ba bskyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na shes pa'i mig gis skyes bu mthong bar gyur na yang grol ba bskyed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even if a person is seen with the eye of knowledge, it does not generate liberation.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: ci srid yid la shes 'byung ba //
analyzed: ci srid yid la shes 'byung ba //
translated: As long as the mind arises,

original: de srid sa bon sogs 'gyur te //üîΩci srid sgra ni yod gyur pa //
analyzed: de srid sa bon sogs 'gyur te // ci srid sgra ni yod gyur pa //
translated: it is the seed of existence.üîΩAs long as sound exists,

original: de srid sgra brnyan 'byung ba bzhin //
analyzed: de srid sgra brnyan 'byung ba bzhin //
translated: an echo occurs.

original: byed pa med par shes pa ni //
analyzed: byed pa med par shes pa ni //
translated: Without an agent,

original: 'khor ba ji ltar shes pa yin //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji ltar shes pa yin //
translated: how can there be a knower of cyclic existence?

original: kun du khyab med yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kun du khyab med yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is not omnipresent,

original: gang las ji ltar bcings dang grol //
analyzed: gang las ji ltar bcings dang grol //
translated: from what and how is it bound and liberated?

original: ji ltar ji srid du sgra 'jug pa yod pa de srid du sgra brnyan yang 'byung bar 'gyur la ;
analyzed: ji ltar ji srid du sgra 'jug pa yod pa de srid du sgra brnyan yang 'byung bar 'gyur la ;
translated: As long as the engagement of sound exists, an echo occurs.

original: sgra 'jug par gyur pa med na ni /
analyzed: sgra 'jug par gyur pa med na ni /
translated: If the engagement of sound does not exist,

original: sgra brnyan yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra brnyan yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: an echo does not occur.

original: de bzhin du shes bya med par gyur na shes pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes bya med par gyur na shes pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, if objects of knowledge do not exist, consciousness does not occur.

original: dus ji srid du sems dang sems las byung ba bdag la dmigs nas 'jug par gyur pa de srid du sa bon yang sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus ji srid du sems dang sems las byung ba bdag la dmigs nas 'jug par gyur pa de srid du sa bon yang sogs par 'gyur te /
translated: For as long as mind and mental factors engage by observing the self, the seeds of samsara will be accumulated.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'khor ba'i zhes bya bar 'brel to //üîΩgzhan yang skyes bu grol ba'i dus na ni byed pa la ltos pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i zhes bya bar 'brel to // gzhan yang skyes bu grol ba'i dus na ni byed pa la ltos pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: It is because of samsara.

original: ci ltar shes pa skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ltar shes pa skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, when a person is liberated, consciousness would not arise, because it would be independent of an agent.

original: gzhan yang skyes bu 'di ni dus thams cad du rtag pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyes bu 'di ni dus thams cad du rtag pa /
translated: Moreover, since this person is permanent,

original: gcig pu nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba 'di la ji ltar bcings pa dang grol bar rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gcig pu nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba 'di la ji ltar bcings pa dang grol bar rigs par 'gyur /
translated: sole, and like space, how could it be logical for him to be bound or liberated?

original: gzhan yang / skyes bu ni dngos po'i don thams cad las tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang / skyes bu ni dngos po'i don thams cad las tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since the person is not different from all things,

original: sdug bsngal las kyang thar min te //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las kyang thar min te //
translated: he is not liberated from suffering.

original: thar dang gcig tu smra ba'i phyir //
analyzed: thar dang gcig tu smra ba'i phyir //
translated: Because he is said to be one with liberation.

original: bdag las de ni gzhan min phyir //
analyzed: bdag las de ni gzhan min phyir //
translated: Because he is not different from the self,

original: ji ltar me dang tsha ba bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar me dang tsha ba bzhin //
translated: he is like fire and heat.

original: ji ltar me dang lhan cig spyod pa'i tsha ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar me dang lhan cig spyod pa'i tsha ba ni /
translated: Just as heat, which is concomitant with fire,

original: me med par nam yang yod ma myong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: me med par nam yang yod ma myong ba de bzhin du /
translated: has never existed without fire,

original: sdug bsngal dang lhan cig spyod pa'i skyes bu yang thar pa'i dus na yang thar par rigs pa ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang / nyams dang ma skyes @261b pa yi blo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang lhan cig spyod pa'i skyes bu yang thar pa'i dus na yang thar par rigs pa ma yin no // gzhan yang / nyams dang ma skyes @261b pa yi blo //
translated: so it is not logical that the person who is concomitant with suffering would be liberated at the time of liberation.üîΩMoreover,üîΩHow could the mind that has deteriorated or not arisen

original: byed pa med pa ji ltar yin //üîΩgang pos gcod par byed pa yang //
analyzed: byed pa med pa ji ltar yin // gang pos gcod par byed pa yang //
translated: be without activity?üîΩHow could the one who cuts

original: sta re med par ji ltar rigs //
analyzed: sta re med par ji ltar rigs //
translated: be called a cutter without an axe?

original: gang gi phyir 'di'i mig la sogs pa'i blo dngos po ma mthong bas skyes par gyur pa dang / skyes pa yang nyams par gyur pa de'i tshe 'di shes pa nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di'i mig la sogs pa'i blo dngos po ma mthong bas skyes par gyur pa dang / skyes pa yang nyams par gyur pa de'i tshe 'di shes pa nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: Since the mind of this person has not seen such things as form, it has not arisen, and even if it has arisen, it has deteriorated. At that time, it is not logical that he would have knowledge.

original: ji ltar gang po zhes bya bas shing gcod pa na byed pa sta re la ma ltos par gcod pa po zhes bstan par mi rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gang po zhes bya bas shing gcod pa na byed pa sta re la ma ltos par gcod pa po zhes bstan par mi rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as it is not logical to say that the one called P≈´r·πáa is a cutter without depending on the axe, which is the instrument of cutting.

original: yang gal te ji ltar mes sreg pa yin na yang skyes bus mes sreg ces ston par byed pa de bzhin du shes pas shes pa yin na yang skyes bus shes so zhes zer gyi shes pas ni ma yin no zhe na de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: yang gal te ji ltar mes sreg pa yin na yang skyes bus mes sreg ces ston par byed pa de bzhin du shes pas shes pa yin na yang skyes bus shes so zhes zer gyi shes pas ni ma yin no zhe na de ni mi rigs te /
translated: But if you say that just as it is said that a person is burned by fire, even though it is fire that burns, so it is said that a person knows, even though it is consciousness that knows, and not consciousness itself, then that is illogical.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: me yis sreg ces smras pa na //
analyzed: me yis sreg ces smras pa na //
translated: When it is said ‚Äúburned by fire,‚Äù

original: me yis bsregs kyi byed pas min //
analyzed: me yis bsregs kyi byed pas min //
translated: it is fire that burns, not the agent.

original: de bzhin blo yis rigs smras pas //
analyzed: de bzhin blo yis rigs smras pas //
translated: Similarly, when it is said ‚Äúknown by mind,‚Äù

original: shes par rig gi skyes bus min //
analyzed: shes par rig gi skyes bus min //
translated: it is consciousness that knows, not the person.

original: 'di ltar nges par dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar nges par dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be investigated:

original: mes bsregs zhes bya ba 'dir me nyid kyis yin nam /
analyzed: mes bsregs zhes bya ba 'dir me nyid kyis yin nam /
translated: When it is said ‚Äúburned by fire,‚Äù is it fire itself that burns?

original: 'on te lha sbyin gyis yin /
analyzed: 'on te lha sbyin gyis yin /
translated: Or is it Devadatta?

original: de la sreg pa zhes bya ba 'di ni me la yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la sreg pa zhes bya ba 'di ni me la yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, ‚Äúburning‚Äù exists in fire,

original: sreg pa po la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sreg pa po la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in the burner.

original: de bzhin du blos rig ces smras pas blo nyid kyis rig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du blos rig ces smras pas blo nyid kyis rig pa yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, when it is said ‚Äúknown by mind,‚Äù it is mind itself that knows,

original: skyes bus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bus ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the person.

original: des na dpe me'i dpes bstan pa'i don sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dpe me'i dpes bstan pa'i don sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the meaning of the example of fire is not established.

original: gal te 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: gal te 'dir smras pa /
translated: But if you say,

original: ji ltar rdza mkhan la rdza ma mi byed pa'i dus na yang rdza mkhan zhes rjod par byed la /
analyzed: ji ltar rdza mkhan la rdza ma mi byed pa'i dus na yang rdza mkhan zhes rjod par byed la /
translated: Just as a potter is called a potter even when he is not making a pot,

original: ji ltar mes shing mi sreg pa'i dus na yang sreg byed ces rjod par byed pa de bzhin du skyes bu yang byed pa la mi ltos kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar mes shing mi sreg pa'i dus na yang sreg byed ces rjod par byed pa de bzhin du skyes bu yang byed pa la mi ltos kyang /
translated: and just as fire is called a burner even when it is not burning fuel, so too, even though a person does not rely on action,

original: shes pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: he is still said to be an agent.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: rdza mkhan bzhin du de mi 'grub //
analyzed: rdza mkhan bzhin du de mi 'grub //
translated: It is not established as a potter,

original: de yi ngo bo med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo med pa'i phyir //
translated: because it does not have its nature.

original: sreg byed bzhin du'ang 'grub mi 'dod //
analyzed: sreg byed bzhin du'ang 'grub mi 'dod //
translated: Nor is it established as a burner,

original: bsreg bya med pas me med phyir //üîΩdus gang gi tshe 'dis rdza ma'i bya ba la zhugs par gyur pa de'i tshe rdza mkhan zhes bya bar rigs kyi /
analyzed: bsreg bya med pas me med phyir // dus gang gi tshe 'dis rdza ma'i bya ba la zhugs par gyur pa de'i tshe rdza mkhan zhes bya bar rigs kyi /
translated: because without fuel there is no fire.üîΩWhen he engages in the activity of making a pot, then it is reasonable to call him a potter.

original: 'dis rdza ma byed par 'gyur gyi 'dis rdza ma byas pa'i phyir rdza mkhan zhes bya ba nyid ni nye bar btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis rdza ma byed par 'gyur gyi 'dis rdza ma byas pa'i phyir rdza mkhan zhes bya ba nyid ni nye bar btags pa yin gyi /
translated: But he is called a potter because he makes a pot, not because he has made a pot.

original: rdza mkhan gyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the potter‚Äôs own nature.

original: de bzhin du gang gi tshe mes shing sreg par byed pa de'i tshe sreg byed ces btags pa legs @262a * //üîΩpa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi tshe mes shing sreg par byed pa de'i tshe sreg byed ces btags pa legs @262a * // pa yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, when fire burns fuel, it is correct to call it a ‚Äúburner.‚Äù

original: bsreg par bya ba thal ba'i gnas skabs su gyur pa na /
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba thal ba'i gnas skabs su gyur pa na /
translated: But when the fuel has become ash,

original: me'i rang gi ngo bo yang med pas sreg byed yin par mi 'grub pa ltar /üîΩde bzhin du skyes bu yang gang gi tshe byed pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa yod pa de'i tshe shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin par rigs kyi ;
analyzed: me'i rang gi ngo bo yang med pas sreg byed yin par mi 'grub pa ltar / de bzhin du skyes bu yang gang gi tshe byed pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa yod pa de'i tshe shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin par rigs kyi ;
translated: the fire‚Äôs own nature is no longer present, and so it is not established as a burner.üîΩIn the same way, when a person is engaged in an action, it is correct to say that he is the nature of consciousness.

original: de las gzhan pa ni mi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid la shes pa nyid du btags pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni mi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid la shes pa nyid du btags pa tsam yin no //
translated: But when he is not engaged in an action, he is not the nature of consciousness, and so consciousness is merely ascribed to him.

original: shes pa ma yin pa la bstan pa tsam gyis shes par 'grub pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: shes pa ma yin pa la bstan pa tsam gyis shes par 'grub pa ma yin pas /
translated: Consciousness is not established as consciousness merely by being taught to be consciousness.üîΩIf you are a knower who does not know,

original: gal te mi shes byed po dang // za bo khyod kyis shes ci ltar //
analyzed: gal te mi shes byed po dang // za bo khyod kyis shes ci ltar //
translated: how do you know that you are a knower?

original: mkha' 'dra rtog pa med pa yang //
analyzed: mkha' 'dra rtog pa med pa yang //
translated: You are like space, devoid of conceptualization.

original: lung 'ba' zhig gis btags ci bya //
analyzed: lung 'ba' zhig gis btags ci bya //
translated: What is the point of merely ascribing ‚Äúknower‚Äù to you?

original: gal te yang mi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na yang 'di'i byed pa nye bar gnas pa na shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang mi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na yang 'di'i byed pa nye bar gnas pa na shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is the nature of the self to be ignorant, then when its activity is present, it becomes the nature of consciousness.

original: de lta na yang dang po srid pa'i sngon rol na byed pa skyes pa med pas mi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang dang po srid pa'i sngon rol na byed pa skyes pa med pas mi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: But even so, since the activity of the self does not arise prior to the existence of the world, it is the nature of ignorance.

original: rdo las brkos pa'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: rdo las brkos pa'i gzugs sam /
translated: It is like a form carved in stone

original: ri mor bris pa bzhin du sems pa med pa yin pas srid pa rnam pa du ma'i ngo bo'i bye brag tha dad pa rnams bskyed pa'i byed pa po ji ltar yin /
analyzed: ri mor bris pa bzhin du sems pa med pa yin pas srid pa rnam pa du ma'i ngo bo'i bye brag tha dad pa rnams bskyed pa'i byed pa po ji ltar yin /
translated: or a drawing on rock, because it is mindless, how can it be the agent that produces the various different aspects of the world?

original: sems pa med pa yin pa'i phyir za ba po nyid yin par yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: sems pa med pa yin pa'i phyir za ba po nyid yin par yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also illogical that it is the experiencer because it is mindless.

original: yul thams cad ni rnam par shes pas spyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yul thams cad ni rnam par shes pas spyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because all objects are to be experienced by consciousness.

original: / gzhan yang /
analyzed: / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa yin pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa yin par khyod kyis smras pas byed pa po dang za ba po nyid gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa yin pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa yin par khyod kyis smras pas byed pa po dang za ba po nyid gsal ba yin no //
translated: since you say that it is equal to space and is devoid of conceptualization, it is clear that it is neither an agent nor an experiencer.

original: gal te bdag gi lung las grags pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi lung las grags pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is known from our scriptures,

original: rigs pa dang bral ba'i lung 'ba' zhig tsam ni tshad ma ma yin te ;
analyzed: rigs pa dang bral ba'i lung 'ba' zhig tsam ni tshad ma ma yin te ;
translated: then a scripture that is devoid of reason is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: lung tsam gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lung tsam gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning that you want to prove is not established by a scripture alone.

original: mi shes pa'am shes dngos min //
analyzed: mi shes pa'am shes dngos min //
translated: It is neither an unknowable nor a knower.

original: 'di ni dngos po med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po med par 'gyur //
translated: It would be a non-entity.

original: dngos med bdag tu mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: dngos med bdag tu mi 'gyur te //
translated: A non-entity cannot be a self.

original: 'di ni mo gsham bu bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mo gsham bu bzhin no //
translated: It would be like the son of a barren woman.

original: gal te 'di mi shes pa yang ma yin /üîΩshes pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di mi shes pa yang ma yin / shes pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is neither an unknowable nor a knower,

original: 'o na 'di dngos po med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na 'di dngos po med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be a non-entity.

original: des na gang dngos po med pa de bdag tu 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gang dngos po med pa de bdag tu 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, that which is a non-entity cannot be a self,

original: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin te /üîΩdper na mo gsham gyi bu ni mi shes pa'i ngo bo'am /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin te / dper na mo gsham gyi bu ni mi shes pa'i ngo bo'am /
translated: like the son of a barren woman.

original: shes pa'i ngo bor yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bor yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: For example, the son of a barren woman is not observed as an unknowable entity or a knower.

original: gzhan @262b yang lus thams cad la khyab pa yin pa'i phyir de ni thams cad kyi bdag gcig pu zhig yin no zhes gang 'dod pa yang /
analyzed: gzhan @262b yang lus thams cad la khyab pa yin pa'i phyir de ni thams cad kyi bdag gcig pu zhig yin no zhes gang 'dod pa yang /
translated: Moreover, since it pervades the entire body, it is the single self of all.

original: gang la gnod dang phan pa las //üîΩgang la gnod pa bde mi 'byung //
analyzed: gang la gnod dang phan pa las // gang la gnod pa bde mi 'byung //
translated: If it is harmed or benefited,

original: de de'i bdag tu mi rigs te //
analyzed: de de'i bdag tu mi rigs te //
translated: then it would not be the self.

original: nam mkha' de ba shar ma bzhin //
analyzed: nam mkha' de ba shar ma bzhin //
translated: It would be like the sky or the son of a barren woman.

original: gal te dmyal ba la sogs par sdug bsngal gyis lus la gnod par gyur pa na /
analyzed: gal te dmyal ba la sogs par sdug bsngal gyis lus la gnod par gyur pa na /
translated: If the body were harmed by suffering in the hells and so on,

original: bdag la yang gnod pa skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag la yang gnod pa skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: then the self would also be harmed.

original: mtho ris la sogs par bde ba nyams su myong ba na yang 'di la phan par 'gyur ba zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: mtho ris la sogs par bde ba nyams su myong ba na yang 'di la phan par 'gyur ba zhig yin na ni /
translated: If the self were benefited when pleasure is experienced in the higher realms and so on,

original: 'di thams cad kyi bdag yin no zhes bya bar rigs na /
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyi bdag yin no zhes bya bar rigs na /
translated: then it would be logical to say that it is the self of all.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni rtag pa mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo de yin pa'i phyir bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni rtag pa mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo de yin pa'i phyir bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa ma yin na /
translated: But since it is permanent and unchanging, it is not harmed by pleasure or pain.

original: 'di ji ltar na bdag gis bdag yin zhes brjod par rung /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar na bdag gis bdag yin zhes brjod par rung /
translated: So how can it be logical to say that it is the self?

original: ji ltar nam mkha' ni de ba shar ma'i bdag yin par mi rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' ni de ba shar ma'i bdag yin par mi rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as it is not tenable that space is the self of the devas.

original: nyi tshe'i bdag gang grol bar ni //
analyzed: nyi tshe'i bdag gang grol bar ni //
translated: If you assert that a limited self is liberated

original: bsam gtan shes sogs kyis 'dod na //
analyzed: bsam gtan shes sogs kyis 'dod na //
translated: Through the knowledge of meditative concentration, and so on,

original: bdag med don la 'bad pa yis //
analyzed: bdag med don la 'bad pa yis //
translated: Then, through striving for the meaning of selflessness,

original: shi ba mi 'chi ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: shi ba mi 'chi ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How will the dead not die?

original: sngar nas nyi tshe'i bdag 'di 'chi ba'i ngo bo nyid yin na des na 'chi ba med par thob par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi shes pa la mngon par sbyor bar byed cing ;
analyzed: sngar nas nyi tshe'i bdag 'di 'chi ba'i ngo bo nyid yin na des na 'chi ba med par thob par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi shes pa la mngon par sbyor bar byed cing ;
translated: If this limited self is by nature dead, then in order to attain immortality, you apply yourself to the knowledge of meditative concentration,

original: bdag mchog gi don du 'bad pa byas kyang de mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: bdag mchog gi don du 'bad pa byas kyang de mi 'grub ste /
translated: and you strive for the meaning of the supreme self.

original: 'chi ba'i ngo bo las 'gyur ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'chi ba med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i ngo bo las 'gyur ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'chi ba med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But that will not be accomplished, because it is not possible to change the nature of death. How will you become immortal?

original: rang gi ngo bo las nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no degeneration from your nature.

original: gal te 'chi ba'i ngo bo nyid btang nas 'chi ba med pa nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'chi ba'i ngo bo nyid btang nas 'chi ba med pa nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you give up the nature of death and go to immortality,

original: de lta na ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were so, then the faults of impermanence and so on would arise.

original: gal te 'di ltar nyi tshe ba'i bdag dang / bdag dam pa gnyis gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar nyi tshe ba'i bdag dang / bdag dam pa gnyis gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the limited self and the highest self are neither the same nor different,

original: 'dir 'di ltar dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'di ltar dpyad par bya ste /
translated: then this should be investigated:

original: nyi tshe'i bdag ni bdag las gzhan //
analyzed: nyi tshe'i bdag ni bdag las gzhan //
translated: If the limited self is different from the self,

original: zhe na thams cad skyes bu yin //
analyzed: zhe na thams cad skyes bu yin //
translated: then all would be human beings.üîΩIf it is the limited self and the highest self,

original: de ni nyi tshe gnyis bdag dang // phyi zhes dam bcas nyams pa yin //üîΩbdag las nyi tshe'i bdag de ni //
analyzed: de ni nyi tshe gnyis bdag dang // phyi zhes dam bcas nyams pa yin // bdag las nyi tshe'i bdag de ni //
translated: then your thesis is undermined.üîΩIf the limited self is not different from the self,

original: gzhan min zhe na'ang dam bcas nyams //üîΩgang yang bdag gi bde sdug sogs //üîΩ'gro bas mi shes gtso bo min //
analyzed: gzhan min zhe na'ang dam bcas nyams // gang yang bdag gi bde sdug sogs // 'gro bas mi shes gtso bo min //
translated: then your thesis is undermined.üîΩAnd also:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan ma @263a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan ma @263a * //
translated: The self is not the principal, since the world does not know its happiness, suffering, and so on.

original: yin pa nyid yin na de nyid kyis ji ltar skul bar byed /
analyzed: yin pa nyid yin na de nyid kyis ji ltar skul bar byed /
translated: If it is not different, then how could it motivate?

original: pha rol po la 'di ltar yang brjod par bya ste /üîΩgal te phra min 'di tshe min //
analyzed: pha rol po la 'di ltar yang brjod par bya ste / gal te phra min 'di tshe min //
translated: You should also say to the opponent:üîΩIf it is not subtle, it is not the self.

original: chen po yin na phra ba min //
analyzed: chen po yin na phra ba min //
translated: If it is great, it is not subtle.

original: gcig kyang ma yin gzugs kyi chos //
analyzed: gcig kyang ma yin gzugs kyi chos //
translated: It is not one, nor is it a phenomenon of form.

original: ji ltar gzugs med bdag gi yin //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs med bdag gi yin //
translated: How can a formless self possess form?

original: gzugs dang ldan pa zhig yin na 'dir phra ba dang / chen po dang / gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa zhig yin na 'dir phra ba dang / chen po dang / gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If it were endowed with form, then the conceptual thoughts of ‚Äúsmall,‚Äù ‚Äúlarge,‚Äù ‚Äúone,‚Äù ‚Äúmany,‚Äù and so on would arise.

original: yang ngo bo med pa'i skyes bu la ni 'di ltar gal te phra ba yin na ni chen po ji ltar yin /
analyzed: yang ngo bo med pa'i skyes bu la ni 'di ltar gal te phra ba yin na ni chen po ji ltar yin /
translated: But if the person is essentially formless, then how could it be small or large?

original: 'on te chen po yin na yang phra ba ji ltar yin /üîΩgal te gcig yin na ni du mar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te chen po yin na yang phra ba ji ltar yin / gal te gcig yin na ni du mar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is large, how could it be small?üîΩIf it is one, how could it be many?

original: 'on te du ma yin na yang gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te du ma yin na yang gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is many, how could it be one?

original: des na rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this contradicts your own words.

original: 'dir pha rol pos glang po che dper nye bar 'god par byed de /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol pos glang po che dper nye bar 'god par byed de /
translated: Here the opponent presents the analogy of an elephant.

original: dmus long mang po zhig glang po che rang gi ngo bos shes par 'dod nas 'dus pa las /
analyzed: dmus long mang po zhig glang po che rang gi ngo bos shes par 'dod nas 'dus pa las /
translated: Many blind people gathered together and wanted to know the nature of an elephant.

original: gang sna la reg pa de dag gis ni glang po che'i gshol mda' 'dra ba zhig go zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: gang sna la reg pa de dag gis ni glang po che'i gshol mda' 'dra ba zhig go zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Those who touched its trunk thought it was like an elephant's goad.

original: gang rkang pa la reg pa de dag gis ni gtun shing 'dra ba zhig tu'o //üîΩgang rna ba la reg pa de dag gis ni zhi ba ma dang 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: gang rkang pa la reg pa de dag gis ni gtun shing 'dra ba zhig tu'o // gang rna ba la reg pa de dag gis ni zhi ba ma dang 'dra bar ro //
translated: Those who touched its legs thought it was like a pestle.üîΩThose who touched its ears thought it was like a winnowing basket.

original: gang dang gang gis phyogs gang la reg par gyur pa des de lta bu'i rnam pa zhig tu glang po che rtogs so //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis phyogs gang la reg par gyur pa des de lta bu'i rnam pa zhig tu glang po che rtogs so //
translated: And those who touched its tail thought it was like a rope.

original: de bzhin du bdag la yang de kho na nyid ma mthong ba rnams kyis rnam pa du ma zhig tu lta bar byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag la yang de kho na nyid ma mthong ba rnams kyis rnam pa du ma zhig tu lta bar byed de /
translated: In the same way, those who do not see reality see the self in many different ways.

original: kha cig gis ni kun la khyab par ro //üîΩgzhan dag gis ni lus kyi tshad tsam du'o //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni kun la khyab par ro // gzhan dag gis ni lus kyi tshad tsam du'o //
translated: Some think it is all-pervading.üîΩOthers think it is the same size as the body.

original: yang gzhan dag gis phra rab kyi ngo bo tsam yin no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag gis phra rab kyi ngo bo tsam yin no snyam du sems te /
translated: Still others think it is just the size of an atom.

original: glang po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gcig nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: glang po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gcig nyid kyang yin la /
translated: But just as the elephant's own nature is one,

original: yan lag dang nying lag bzhin du du ma nyid kyang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag bzhin du du ma nyid kyang yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is also multiple, like the limbs and parts of the body.

original: de la brjod par bya ste /üîΩgcig nyid du ma'i ngo bo ru //
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ste / gcig nyid du ma'i ngo bo ru //
translated: To this we reply:üîΩThe example of the elephant

original: glang po'i dpe 'di mi rigs te //
analyzed: glang po'i dpe 'di mi rigs te //
translated: is not correct for a single entityüîΩthat has a multiple nature.

original: sna ni glang du mi 'dod phyir //üîΩsna tshogs rnams kyang gcig nyid min //üîΩgang glang po de'i sna ni sna nyid yin /
analyzed: sna ni glang du mi 'dod phyir // sna tshogs rnams kyang gcig nyid min // gang glang po de'i sna ni sna nyid yin /
translated: For the trunk is not asserted to be the elephant.

original: rkang pa ni rkang pa nyid yin /
analyzed: rkang pa ni rkang pa nyid yin /
translated: The foot is the foot,

original: rna ba ni rna ba nyid yin pas glang po nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rna ba ni rna ba nyid yin pas glang po nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: the ear is the ear, and so the elephant does not exist.

original: gcig gi ngo bo nyid med de sna la sogs pa du ma nyid la gcig gi ngo bo nyid med pa @263b yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo nyid med de sna la sogs pa du ma nyid la gcig gi ngo bo nyid med pa @263b yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not have a single nature. The multiple things such as the trunk do not have a single nature.üîΩMoreover,üîΩIf the self were the color of the sun and so on,

original: gzhan yang / gang yang bdag ni nyi sogs mdog / yin na mdog bral ji ltar yin //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang yang bdag ni nyi sogs mdog / yin na mdog bral ji ltar yin //
translated: how could it be devoid of color?

original: bdag de du ma'i ngo bo yi //
analyzed: bdag de du ma'i ngo bo yi //
translated: The self that has a multiple nature

original: dper na pa la sha mi 'dod //
analyzed: dper na pa la sha mi 'dod //
translated: is not asserted to be like a peacock.

original: gzugs med pa yin pa'i phyir kha dog med pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa yin pa'i phyir kha dog med pa zhig yin na /
translated: If it is formless, it is devoid of color.

original: nyi ma bzhin du kha dog du ma can du ji ltar 'gyur gal te yang shing pa la sha bzhin du gcig nyid kyis thams cad la khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: nyi ma bzhin du kha dog du ma can du ji ltar 'gyur gal te yang shing pa la sha bzhin du gcig nyid kyis thams cad la khyab pa yin te /
translated: If it is one, it pervades everything like the pƒÅla≈õa tree.

original: ji ltar pa la sha rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / yal ga dang / yal ga phra mo dang / de'i yal ga la sogs pa yod pa bzhin du de yang du ma'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar pa la sha rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / yal ga dang / yal ga phra mo dang / de'i yal ga la sogs pa yod pa bzhin du de yang du ma'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Just as the pƒÅla≈õa tree has roots, a trunk, branches, twigs, and so on, it too has many natures.

original: rgyu mang po yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mang po yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it has many causes.

original: de ni mi bden te ;
analyzed: de ni mi bden te ;
translated: That is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: gcig pu pa la sha med de //
analyzed: gcig pu pa la sha med de //
translated: The one does not exist as the pƒÅla≈õa tree.üîΩHow could it have a nature that is completely transformed

original: kun du 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid dang // ji ltar rtsa ba sogs du mar //
analyzed: kun du 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid dang // ji ltar rtsa ba sogs du mar //
translated: Into many roots and so on

original: rkyen la sogs pas 'byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rkyen la sogs pas 'byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is differentiated by conditions and so on?

original: pa la sha'i ljon shing ni gzhon nu dang / bar ma dang / tha ma'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa dang / me dang / rlung dang / sta re la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis kyang tha dad du byed par nus pa yin la /
analyzed: pa la sha'i ljon shing ni gzhon nu dang / bar ma dang / tha ma'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa dang / me dang / rlung dang / sta re la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis kyang tha dad du byed par nus pa yin la /
translated: The palasha tree has the nature of being in the states of youth, middle age, and old age, and conditions such as fire, wind, and an axe can cause it to be differentiated.

original: bdag ni mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa dang / rkyen rnams kyis kyang dbye bar mi nus pa yin pas des na pa la sha'i dpes dpe bstan pa'i don 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa dang / rkyen rnams kyis kyang dbye bar mi nus pa yin pas des na pa la sha'i dpes dpe bstan pa'i don 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But the self is not a phenomenon that changes, and conditions cannot differentiate it. Therefore the example of the palasha tree does not establish the meaning of the example.

original: skyon mang po gzhan 'di yang yod de /
analyzed: skyon mang po gzhan 'di yang yod de /
translated: There are also many other faults.üîΩThe self is the principal

original: gtso bo nyid dang dam pa nyid //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid dang dam pa nyid //
translated: and the highest,

original: de las gzhan la ltos nas 'dod //
analyzed: de las gzhan la ltos nas 'dod //
translated: but it is asserted in dependence on others.

original: gcig nyid yin na tshul 'di nyid //
analyzed: gcig nyid yin na tshul 'di nyid //
translated: If it is one,

original: yod par ji ltar 'dod par bya //üîΩ'di ni gtso bo yin /
analyzed: yod par ji ltar 'dod par bya // 'di ni gtso bo yin /
translated: how can it be asserted to exist?üîΩThis is the principal

original: 'di yang gtso bo yin la /üîΩ'di dag gam /
analyzed: 'di yang gtso bo yin la /üîΩ'di dag gam /
translated: and this is the principal.üîΩThis is the principalüîΩand this is the principal.

original: 'di rnams gtso bor ma gyur pa dag las shin tu gtso bor gyur pa yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di rnams gtso bor ma gyur pa dag las shin tu gtso bor gyur pa yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa yin la /
translated: It is correct to say that it is the most important of all that which is not primary.

original: de bzhin du dman par gyur pa mang po dag las mchog tu gyur pa la dam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dman par gyur pa mang po dag las mchog tu gyur pa la dam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Similarly, that which is supreme among many things that are inferior is called ‚Äúexcellent.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag gtso bo ma yin pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa la ltos nas /üîΩbdag de gtso bo'am /
analyzed: gzhan dag gtso bo ma yin pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa la ltos nas / bdag de gtso bo'am /
translated: In dependence on other things that are not primary and not excellent,üîΩthat self is established as primary or excellent.

original: dam par 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dam par 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: But if that is so,

original: dngos po thams cad dang tha mi dad par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dang tha mi dad par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: then since it is not different from all things,

original: 'di gzhan gang la ltos nas gtso bo nyid dang dam pa nyid yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di gzhan gang la ltos nas gtso bo nyid dang dam pa nyid yin par 'gyur /
translated: in dependence on what other thing would it be primary or excellent?

original: yang 'di rdzas nyid dang thams cad la khyab pa nyid yin par yang ji ltar rigs te /
analyzed: yang 'di rdzas nyid dang thams cad la khyab pa nyid yin par yang ji ltar rigs te /
translated: Moreover, how could it be tenable that it is a substance and that it pervades everything?

original: gal te bdag de rdzas @264a * //
analyzed: gal te bdag de rdzas @264a * //
translated: If that self were a substance,

original: yin na // rdzas yin phyir na kun khyab min //
analyzed: yin na // rdzas yin phyir na kun khyab min //
translated: then because it is a substance, it would not be all-pervading.

original: bum pa bzhin du rtag mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bum pa bzhin du rtag mi 'gyur //
translated: Like a pot, it would not be permanent.üîΩHow could it be the one who arranges

original: des na 'gro ba rgyas ci ltar //
analyzed: des na 'gro ba rgyas ci ltar //
translated: the world?

original: bkod par byas na rdzas yin te //
analyzed: bkod par byas na rdzas yin te //
translated: If it is a substance,

original: ji srid phyin par bya bar ro //
analyzed: ji srid phyin par bya bar ro //
translated: until one arrives at the goal.

original: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid ni yin la /
analyzed: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid ni yin la /
translated: The definition of substance is that which is the basis of the quality of existence.

original: de ni bum pa la sogs pa ni rtag pa nyid dang kun la ma khyab pa la yang mthong la /
analyzed: de ni bum pa la sogs pa ni rtag pa nyid dang kun la ma khyab pa la yang mthong la /
translated: But that is seen in such things as a pot, which is not permanent and is not all-pervading.

original: des na gal te bdag rdzas yin na mi rtag pa nyid dang / kun la khyab pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: des na gal te bdag rdzas yin na mi rtag pa nyid dang / kun la khyab pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, if the self were a substance, it would not be permanent and would not be all-pervading,

original: rdzas yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rdzas yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it would be a substance, like such things as a pot.

original: gang yang byung bar 'gyur ba dang byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba thams cad skyes bu yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la yang /üîΩrdzas ni rten du rigs 'gyur na //
analyzed: gang yang byung bar 'gyur ba dang byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba thams cad skyes bu yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la yang / rdzas ni rten du rigs 'gyur na //
translated: As for the statement that ‚Äúthe self is the agent of all action, whether past, present, or future,‚ÄùüîΩif the self were a substance,

original: bdag ni rdzas su mi rigs te //
analyzed: bdag ni rdzas su mi rigs te //
translated: it would not be tenable that the self is a substance,

original: nam mkha'i me tog ji lta bar //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ji lta bar //
translated: just like a sky flower.

original: de bzhin ma skyes phyir rdzas med //
analyzed: de bzhin ma skyes phyir rdzas med //
translated: It is not a substance because it is not produced.

original: rdzas nyid yod na rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rdzas nyid yod na rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yin te /
translated: If it were a substance, it would be the basis of the quality of existence.

original: ji ltar chu steng la shing thog shing la bya tshang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar chu steng la shing thog shing la bya tshang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: For example, a fruit on a tree is the basis of the quality of being on the tree, and a bird‚Äôs nest in the tree is the basis of the quality of being in the tree.

original: bdag ni rdzas su yod par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: bdag ni rdzas su yod par mi 'grub ste /
translated: The self is not established as a substance.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: Because it is not produced, it is like a sky flower.

original: gang gi phyir bdag rdzas nyid du ma grub pas des na 'dir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag rdzas nyid du ma grub pas des na 'dir /
translated: Since the self is not established as a substance, therefore here:

original: thams cad byung gyur byung ba dang // 'byung 'gyur bdag med ji ltar mthong //
analyzed: thams cad byung gyur byung ba dang // 'byung 'gyur bdag med ji ltar mthong //
translated: All that has arisen and will arise, and that which will arise, is seen to be selfless.

original: rten ma grub na brten pa gang la sbyor bar 'gyur zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rten ma grub na brten pa gang la sbyor bar 'gyur zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: If the basis is not established, how could the dependent be applied?

original: rdzas su med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rdzas su med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it does not exist as a substance.

original: bdag med bdag tu mi rigs te //
analyzed: bdag med bdag tu mi rigs te //
translated: The selfless is not suitable as a self.

original: ji ltar dngos med ngo bo bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos med ngo bo bzhin //
translated: Like the nature of a non-entity.

original: bdag med pa'i rdzas bdag gi bdag nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rdzas bdag gi bdag nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The substance of selflessness is not suitable as the nature of a self.

original: ji ltar nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid bzhin no //
translated: Like the nature of non-entities such as sky flowers and so forth.

original: byis sogs khyad par med ma yin //
analyzed: byis sogs khyad par med ma yin //
translated: It is not that the self is not distinguished from the childish and so forth.

original: rten med pa dang dpe med phyir //
analyzed: rten med pa dang dpe med phyir //
translated: Because it has no basis and no example.

original: bdag gcig yin na du ma yi //
analyzed: bdag gcig yin na du ma yi //
translated: If it were a single self, the faults

original: skyon rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: skyon rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ma yin //
translated: of multiplicity would not arise.

original: gang smras pa /
analyzed: gang smras pa /
translated: What was said:

original: byis pa dang / mkhas pa dang / gdol pa dang / bram ze la sogs pa rnams mnyam pa nyid do zhes zer ba de yang dam pa'i bdag nyid ma grub na gang byis pa la sogs pa rnams khyad par med pa de'i rten gang zhig yin /
analyzed: byis pa dang / mkhas pa dang / gdol pa dang / bram ze la sogs pa rnams mnyam pa nyid do zhes zer ba de yang dam pa'i bdag nyid ma grub na gang byis pa la sogs pa rnams khyad par med pa de'i rten gang zhig yin /
translated: But if the self of a holy person is not established, then what is the basis of the claim that children and so on are not different from him?

original: rtag pa kun la khyab pa gcig pu las rigs mthun pa'i dngos po'i don gzhan med pas /
analyzed: rtag pa kun la khyab pa gcig pu las rigs mthun pa'i dngos po'i don gzhan med pas /
translated: Since there is no other object that is a thing that is of a homogeneous kind apart from the permanent, omnipresent, and unitary self,

original: 'di la @264b dpe med pa yin pa'i phyir byis pa la sogs pa khyad par med pa nyid mi 'grub po zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la @264b dpe med pa yin pa'i phyir byis pa la sogs pa khyad par med pa nyid mi 'grub po zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: it is thought that the self is not established as being the same for children and so on because it is without example.

original: bdag gcig pu nyid du yod pa yin na skyon mang po dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag gcig pu nyid du yod pa yin na skyon mang po dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: If the self exists as a solitary entity, it would have many faults.

original: skyon de dag kyang gang zhe na /üîΩtsee tra'i bdag de mee tra'i byed //
analyzed: skyon de dag kyang gang zhe na / tsee tra'i bdag de mee tra'i byed //
translated: What are those faults?üîΩThe self of Maitreya is the self of Upagupta.

original: mee tra'i bdag gi'ang de bzhin te //
analyzed: mee tra'i bdag gi'ang de bzhin te //
translated: The self of Upagupta is also the self of Maitreya.

original: tsee tra'i tha dad min dngos phyir //
analyzed: tsee tra'i tha dad min dngos phyir //
translated: Because the self of Maitreya is not a different thing from the self of Upagupta,

original: yang na yul la dbye med phyir //
analyzed: yang na yul la dbye med phyir //
translated: or because the object is not differentiated.

original: tsee tra'i lus kyi nang na yod pa'i bdag ni de nyid kyi lus la yod pa'i mig la sogs pa de nyid nas lta bar de byed pa yin gyi gzhan gyi lus la yod pa nas ni ma yin no zhes pha rol pos 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: tsee tra'i lus kyi nang na yod pa'i bdag ni de nyid kyi lus la yod pa'i mig la sogs pa de nyid nas lta bar de byed pa yin gyi gzhan gyi lus la yod pa nas ni ma yin no zhes pha rol pos 'dod pa yin la /
translated: The self that exists in the body of Caitra sees from the eyes and so on that exist in Caitra‚Äôs body, but it does not see from the eyes and so on that exist in the body of Maitreya.üîΩThis is what the opponent asserts.

original: bdag ni gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar tsee tra'i rang gi byed pa rnams nas mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag ni gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar tsee tra'i rang gi byed pa rnams nas mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: But because the self is one, just as it sees from Caitra‚Äôs own eyes,

original: mee tra'i byed pa rnams nas kyang mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mee tra'i byed pa rnams nas kyang mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: it would also see from Maitreya‚Äôs eyes.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: ngo bo tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo bo tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not different in nature.

original: gzugs la dbye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la dbye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that form is not differentiated.

original: bdag gi yul la bya ba med pa yin pas mee tra'i bdag gi yul gyi phyogs na yang tsee tra'i bdag kyang gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi yul la bya ba med pa yin pas mee tra'i bdag gi yul gyi phyogs na yang tsee tra'i bdag kyang gnas pa yin la /
translated: Since the self does not act on the object of Maitreya, the self of Caitra would also exist in the place of the object of the self of Maitreya.

original: ji ltar de rang gi byed pa nas mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar de rang gi byed pa nas mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it sees from its own eyes,

original: gzhan gyi byed pa nas kyang mthong bar 'gyur bar rigs na de ltar mthong ba ni med pas des na 'di dag gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi byed pa nas kyang mthong bar 'gyur bar rigs na de ltar mthong ba ni med pas des na 'di dag gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is reasonable that one would see the other‚Äôs actions, but since this is not seen, therefore they are not the same.üîΩMoreover:üîΩIf the self were one, then when one self is happy, all would be happy.

original: gzhan yang / bde dang sdug bsngal skyod pa dang // de grol bas kyang grol ba dang // de bcings pas kyang bcings pa dang // de sdug pas kyang sdug nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bde dang sdug bsngal skyod pa dang // de grol bas kyang grol ba dang // de bcings pas kyang bcings pa dang // de sdug pas kyang sdug nyid 'gyur //
translated: If one self were liberated, all would be liberated.üîΩIf one self were bound, all would be bound.üîΩIf one self were to suffer, all would suffer.

original: bdag gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the self would be one.

original: tsee tra'i bdag bde bar gyur pa na me tra'i bdag kyang bde bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tsee tra'i bdag bde bar gyur pa na me tra'i bdag kyang bde bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When the self of Caitra is happy, the self of Maitra would be happy.

original: tsee tra'i bdag grol ba na mee tra'i bdag kyang grol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tsee tra'i bdag grol ba na mee tra'i bdag kyang grol bar 'gyur /
translated: When the self of Caitra is liberated, the self of Maitra would be liberated.

original: mee tra'i bdag bcings par gyur pa na tsee tra'i bdag kyang bcings pa thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mee tra'i bdag bcings par gyur pa na tsee tra'i bdag kyang bcings pa thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: When the self of Maitra is bound, the self of Caitra would also obtain bondage.

original: tsee tra'i bdag sdug bsngal bar gyur pa na mee tra'i bdag kyang sdug bsngal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsee tra'i bdag sdug bsngal bar gyur pa na mee tra'i bdag kyang sdug bsngal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the self of Caitra suffers, the self of Maitra would also suffer.

original: gal te 'byung la sogs pa'i rten nyid dang / byis pa la sogs pa'i khyad par med pa gcig pa nyid du bdag gis btags su zin kyang gnod pa ni ci yang med de /
analyzed: gal te 'byung la sogs pa'i rten nyid dang / byis pa la sogs pa'i khyad par med pa gcig pa nyid du bdag gis btags su zin kyang gnod pa ni ci yang med de /
translated: But even if the self were designated as the very support of the elements and so on, and as the one that is undifferentiated in terms of the childish and so on, there would be no contradiction at all.

original: ji ltar bdag gis phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i bum pa'i nam mkha' dper bstan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i bum pa'i nam mkha' dper bstan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Just as I have used the example of the space that is the opposite of a pot, which is accepted by both parties.

original: de la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ste /
translated: To this we reply:

original: @265a * // bum pa'i nam mkha' dper bstan pa //
analyzed: @265a * // bum pa'i nam mkha' dper bstan pa //
translated: The example of space that is the opposite of a pot

original: kun la de ni 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: kun la de ni 'byung ba yin //
translated: is not applicable to all.

original: bde dang sdug bsngal la 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal la 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is not applicable to pleasure and pain.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang phyir nam mkha' gcig nyid du //üîΩkhyod kyi de ni ma grub ste //
analyzed: gang phyir nam mkha' gcig nyid du // khyod kyi de ni ma grub ste //
translated: Because space is not established as one.

original: nam mkha'i dpe bstan pa de ni shin tu ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dpe bstan pa de ni shin tu ma grub pa yin no //
translated: That example of space is not established at all.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩrdzas kyi ngo bos gang stong pa //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / rdzas kyi ngo bos gang stong pa //
translated: Why?üîΩThat which is empty of the nature of substance

original: de ni kun rdzob nam mkha' yin //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob nam mkha' yin //
translated: is the conventional space.

original: de la 'gro ldan 'gro ba dang // de ni skabs 'dod skabs can no //
analyzed: de la 'gro ldan 'gro ba dang // de ni skabs 'dod skabs can no //
translated: and that is the occasion of those who desire an occasion.

original: mdo sde pa'i lta ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas kyi dngos po med pa tsam nam mkha'o zhes bdag gcig kun rdzob tu khas blangs pa yin pas gang gi phyir de ni rdzas kyang ma yin //
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i lta ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas kyi dngos po med pa tsam nam mkha'o zhes bdag gcig kun rdzob tu khas blangs pa yin pas gang gi phyir de ni rdzas kyang ma yin //
translated: Following the view of the Sautrantikas, we conventionally accept that space is the mere absence of tangible obstructive objects.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin pas de'i phyir 'gro ba dang ldan pa rnams de la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba yang 'jug par byed la /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin pas de'i phyir 'gro ba dang ldan pa rnams de la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba yang 'jug par byed la /
translated: Since it is neither a substance nor permanent, it is the basis for the activity of going and coming and so on.üîΩThose who desire an occasion also obtain an occasion in relation to it.

original: de nyid la skabs 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang skabs thob par 'gyur bas des na nam mkha' zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid la skabs 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang skabs thob par 'gyur bas des na nam mkha' zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore it is called space.

original: yang 'di'i mdo'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: yang 'di'i mdo'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this sutra is as follows.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas kyi dngos po ri dang shing la sogs par gnas pa de la ni nam mkha' zhes 'dogs par mi byed la /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas kyi dngos po ri dang shing la sogs par gnas pa de la ni nam mkha' zhes 'dogs par mi byed la /
translated: Space is not designated as space in relation to tangible obstructive objects such as mountains and trees.

original: gnas gang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas med par gyur pa de ni nam mkha' zhes bya ba rdzas med pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas gang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas med par gyur pa de ni nam mkha' zhes bya ba rdzas med pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: That which is the absence of any substance that impedes the occurrence of something is simply the nonexistence of substance called space.

original: de la dngos po ni phra mo tsam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la dngos po ni phra mo tsam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is not even the slightest entity that exists in space.üîΩBecause it is dependent on the absence of substance, it is dependent.

original: gang gi phyir de ni rdzas med par gyur pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pas ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir na yang thung ngu dang ring po bzhin du 'di la nges pa med pa yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid yin noüîΩ// de'i phyir btags par yod pa yin pas na nam mkha' ni med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo yod pa zhig rdzas su yod cing gnas pa'i rten du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni rdzas med par gyur pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pas ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir na yang thung ngu dang ring po bzhin du 'di la nges pa med pa yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid yin no // de'i phyir btags par yod pa yin pas na nam mkha' ni med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo yod pa zhig rdzas su yod cing gnas pa'i rten du gyur pa yin la /
translated: Since it is dependent, it is not permanent, like short and long.üîΩTherefore, since space is imputedly existent, it is not tenable that it is the support for the existence and endurance of anything.

original: de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo ni brten par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni med do ;
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo ni brten par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni med do ;
translated: Since it is the nature of nonexistence, it is not tenable that it is the support for the existence and endurance of anything.

original: / gal te 'di ltar nam mkha' shin tu med pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: / gal te 'di ltar nam mkha' shin tu med pa zhig yin na /
translated: If space is a complete nonentity,

original: ci'i phyir khyod kyi ston pa sangs rgyas kyis de rlung gi rten yin par brten /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod kyi ston pa sangs rgyas kyis de rlung gi rten yin par brten /
translated: Why does your teacher, the Buddha, say that it is the support of wind?

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: goo ta ma sa ci la brten te gnas zhes gsol pa dang / bram zes ni chu la brten te gnas so //üîΩchu ci la brten chu ni @265b rlung la brten to //
analyzed: goo ta ma sa ci la brten te gnas zhes gsol pa dang / bram zes ni chu la brten te gnas so // chu ci la brten chu ni @265b rlung la brten to //
translated: When asked, ‚ÄúGautama, what does water rest on? ‚Äù the brahmin replied, ‚ÄúIt rests on wind.üîΩ‚Äù ‚ÄúWhat does wind rest on? ‚Äù ‚ÄúWind rests on space. ‚Äù

original: rlung ci la brten rlung ni nam mkha' la brten to zhes 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rlung ci la brten rlung ni nam mkha' la brten to zhes 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúBut doesn‚Äôt the Buddha say that space is without support? ‚Äù

original: mdo de nyid las nges par byas nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo de nyid las nges par byas nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: That s≈´tra was taught with a specific intention.

original: goo ta ma nam mkha' ci la brten zhes gsol ba dang / bram ze shin tu 'da' bar byed de dris pa'i mtha' rtogs par nus par dka'o //
analyzed: goo ta ma nam mkha' ci la brten zhes gsol ba dang / bram ze shin tu 'da' bar byed de dris pa'i mtha' rtogs par nus par dka'o //
translated: When asked, ‚ÄúGautama, what does space rest on? ‚Äù the brahmin replied, ‚ÄúIt is difficult to understand the end of a question.

original: nam mkha' ni gzugs med pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gzugs med pa /
translated: Space is formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: undemonstrable,

original: thogs pa med pa yin na de ci zhig la brten par 'gyur /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa yin na de ci zhig la brten par 'gyur /
translated: and unimpeded. What could it rest on?

original: 'on kyang snang ba la brten nas nam mkha' zhes 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang snang ba la brten nas nam mkha' zhes 'dogs par byed de /
translated: Nevertheless, space is designated in dependence on light.

original: de'i phyir gzugs med pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs med pa /
translated: Therefore, it is formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: undemonstrable,üîΩand unimpeded.

original: thogs pa med pa nyid dang / rten med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' ni rdzas med pa nyid du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa nyid dang / rten med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' ni rdzas med pa nyid du bstan pa yin te /
translated: Space is taught to be a non-existent substance because it is non-obstructive and non-resistant.

original: snang ba la brten nas btags pa nyid yin pas btags pa tsam nyid ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba la brten nas btags pa nyid yin pas btags pa tsam nyid ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
translated: Since it is imputed in dependence on light, it is a mere imputation.

original: des na nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i rdzas ni cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i rdzas ni cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is not even the slightest substance called ‚Äúspace.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni rtag pa dang / thams cad la khyab pa dang gcig pu nyid do zhes bya ba'i bdag gi dper bstan pa dang chos mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pas 'di ltar gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni rtag pa dang / thams cad la khyab pa dang gcig pu nyid do zhes bya ba'i bdag gi dper bstan pa dang chos mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pas 'di ltar gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since it is not a homogeneous example for the self, which is said to be permanent, all-pervading, and singular, it is not established for the other party.

original: des na nam mkha' sgrib med min //
analyzed: des na nam mkha' sgrib med min //
translated: Therefore, space is not non-obstruction.

original: skabs sbyin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skabs sbyin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the granting of an opportunity,

original: de yod gtan tshigs smras pa yis //
analyzed: de yod gtan tshigs smras pa yis //
translated: because the reason for its existence has been stated.

original: gtan tshigs 'di yang ma grub nyid //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di yang ma grub nyid //
translated: This reason is also unestablished.

original: nam mkha' ni sgrib pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni sgrib pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
translated: Space has the characteristic of non-obstruction.

original: skabs sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes bye brag tu smra bas 'dod la de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skabs sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes bye brag tu smra bas 'dod la de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas assert that space is the result of the act of giving way, but that is not so,

original: nam mkha' ni rdzas yod pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te yang nam mkha' ni yod de /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rdzas yod pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // gal te yang nam mkha' ni yod de /
translated: because space does not possess substantial existence.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Space exists because it is characterized by the absence of obstruction and

original: skabs sbyin par byed pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs sbyin par byed pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the result of the act of giving way.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la ni sgrib pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / skabs sbyin par byed pa med do //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la ni sgrib pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / skabs sbyin par byed pa med do //
translated: Space does not exist because it is not characterized by the absence of obstruction and it does not give way, like the horns of a rabbit and so on.

original: nam mkha' la ni sgrib pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang skabs sbyin par byed pa'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir yod pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni sgrib pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang skabs sbyin par byed pa'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir yod pa yin no //
translated: Space exists because it is characterized by the absence of obstruction and it gives way.

original: de skad smras pa'i gtan tshigs 'di dag ni gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de skad smras pa'i gtan tshigs 'di dag ni gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: These reasons that you have stated are not established for others.

original: nam mkha' ni rdzas @266a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rdzas @266a * //
translated: Space is not a substance.

original: kyi dngos po dang bral ba tsam nyid yin par kho bos khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi dngos po dang bral ba tsam nyid yin par kho bos khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we accept that it is merely the absence of a thing.

original: gzhan yang dngos po rtag pa thams cad la khyab pa'i bdag dngos po thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin no zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po rtag pa thams cad la khyab pa'i bdag dngos po thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin no zhes smras pa de la /
translated: Moreover, you say that the self, which is permanent and pervades all things, is the basis of all things, and is like space.

original: de las gzhan du rtog ge'i gnod pa nye bar dgod pa'i sgo nas slob dpon gyis smras pa /üîΩrgyu las nye bar ma byung ba //
analyzed: de las gzhan du rtog ge'i gnod pa nye bar dgod pa'i sgo nas slob dpon gyis smras pa / rgyu las nye bar ma byung ba //
translated: In response to that, the master Nagarjuna states the following, setting forth the faults of logic:üîΩSpace is not accepted as a thing

original: nam mkha' dngos por mi 'dod do //
analyzed: nam mkha' dngos por mi 'dod do //
translated: Because it does not arise from causes.

original: de ni gcig kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni gcig kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not even one,

original: mo gsham gyi ni bu bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi ni bu bzhin no //
translated: Like the son of a barren woman.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: The subject is called ‚Äúspace.‚Äù

original: de ni dngos po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i chos so //
analyzed: de ni dngos po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i chos so //
translated: The predicate is ‚Äúit is not a thing.‚Äù

original: rgyu las nye bar ma byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rgyu las nye bar ma byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause it does not arise from causes.‚Äù

original: 'byung bar 'gyur bas na dngos po ste /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur bas na dngos po ste /
translated: A thing is that which comes into existence.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las bskyed nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las bskyed nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the expression ‚Äúarises‚Äù is ‚Äúis produced from causes and conditions.‚Äù

original: nam mkha' ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu 'ga' las kyang byung ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu 'ga' las kyang byung ba ma yin pas /
translated: Space does not arise from any productive cause.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa 'di dngos por lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa 'di dngos por lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How can it be a thing, since it is not associated with a cause?

original: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: It is like the son of a barren woman.

original: de ni pha dang ma'i khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa rgyu las byung ba ma yin pas ji ltar de med pa nyid yin pa ltar nam mkha' yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni pha dang ma'i khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa rgyu las byung ba ma yin pas ji ltar de med pa nyid yin pa ltar nam mkha' yang de bzhin te /
translated: It does not arise from causes such as the semen and blood of a father and mother.

original: de ni gcig pu kun la khyab par ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad kyang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gcig pu kun la khyab par ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad kyang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that space is one, all-pervading, and so on.üîΩNow, someone might argue as follows: Although such things as pots are divisible, earth itself is not divisible at all.

original: gang yang ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa la dbye ba yod du zin kyang sa nyid yin pa la ni dbye ba 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa de la lan 'di yin te /üîΩbum sogs gzugs kyis rnams ni //
