analyzed: gang yang ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa la dbye ba yod du zin kyang sa nyid yin pa la ni dbye ba 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa de la lan 'di yin te / bum sogs gzugs kyis rnams ni //
translated: The response to that is as follows:üîΩAlthough such things as pots

original: sa yi rigs su gcig na yang //
analyzed: sa yi rigs su gcig na yang //
translated: are of the same type as earth,

original: sa sogs gzhan dang gzhan yin ltar //
analyzed: sa sogs gzhan dang gzhan yin ltar //
translated: Just as earth and so on are different,

original: des na bdag ni gcig ma yin //
analyzed: des na bdag ni gcig ma yin //
translated: so the self is not one.

original: sa'i rigs su gcig pa nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: sa'i rigs su gcig pa nyid yin na yang /
translated: Even though the earth is one type of element,

original: de lta na yang bum pa dang rdza bo la sogs pa'i byas pa'i bye brag gi dbye ba yod pa yin yang sar gcig pa bzhin du 'di yang gcig nyid yin na yang 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa dang / gzugs du ma can du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang bum pa dang rdza bo la sogs pa'i byas pa'i bye brag gi dbye ba yod pa yin yang sar gcig pa bzhin du 'di yang gcig nyid yin na yang 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa dang / gzugs du ma can du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: there are different types of products such as pots and bricks. Even though they are one in being earth, they are subject to change and have many forms.

original: de ltar na bdag ni gcig pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag ni gcig pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: In the same way, the self is not established as one.üîΩAlso, the statement:

original: gang yang / bdag ma shes shing ma rtogs pas //
analyzed: gang yang / bdag ma shes shing ma rtogs pas //
translated: Because the self is not known or realized,

original: rmi lam longs spyod nga rgyal bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang shes pa'i ngo @266b bo zhig yin pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rmi lam longs spyod nga rgyal bzhin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang shes pa'i ngo @266b bo zhig yin pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par 'gyur ram /
translated: it is like the pride of enjoying a dream.üîΩIs this the essence of consciousness, so that you are proud of it?üîΩOr is it the essence of ignorance?

original: mi shes pa'i ngo bo zhig yin par 'gyur zhes de la yang /üîΩshes nyid phyin ci ma log pas //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i ngo bo zhig yin par 'gyur zhes de la yang / shes nyid phyin ci ma log pas //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:üîΩIt is not right to be proud of

original: shes 'di nga rgyal mi rigs so //
analyzed: shes 'di nga rgyal mi rigs so //
translated: this consciousness, which is itself undistorted.

original: mi shes nyid na'ang log med pas //
analyzed: mi shes nyid na'ang log med pas //
translated: But if it is ignorance, it is not erroneous.

original: mi shes nga rgyal mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mi shes nga rgyal mi 'dod do //
translated: So the conceit of ignorance is not accepted.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what he said.

original: re zhig shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni mig dang ldan pa'i skyes bu bzhin du /
analyzed: re zhig shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni mig dang ldan pa'i skyes bu bzhin du /
translated: If it is the nature of consciousness, then like a person who has eyes,

original: don ci lta ba bzhin du rigs pa yin pas phyin ci log med pa yin no //
analyzed: don ci lta ba bzhin du rigs pa yin pas phyin ci log med pa yin no //
translated: it is in accordance with the object, and so is not erroneous.

original: mi shes pa gcig yin na yang dmus long bzhin du ci yang shes pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa gcig yin na yang dmus long bzhin du ci yang shes pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it is ignorance, then like a person who is blind from birth, it is not conscious of anything.

original: phyin ci log med pa yin na ci ltar longs spyod par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyin ci log med pa yin na ci ltar longs spyod par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par 'gyur /
translated: If it is not erroneous, how can it be the conceit of enjoyment?

original: gang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du /
translated: And also,

original: lus la gnas kyang ma chags dang // spyod par byed kyang mi gos te //
analyzed: lus la gnas kyang ma chags dang // spyod par byed kyang mi gos te //
translated: ‚ÄúIt abides in the body, but is not attached to it. It engages in activity, but is not defiled by it.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra bar byed pa de la yang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra bar byed pa de la yang /
translated: But in that case,

original: nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur med phyir //üîΩde bzhin chags pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur med phyir // de bzhin chags pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is unchanging like space,üîΩit is not attached.

original: bdag ni byed por mi rigs la //
analyzed: bdag ni byed por mi rigs la //
translated: So it is not reasonable that the self is the agent,

original: za ba por yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: za ba por yang mi rigs so //
translated: nor is it reasonable that it is the experiencer.

original: 'gyur ba'i chos can zhig yin na byed pa po dang za ba por rigs te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i chos can zhig yin na byed pa po dang za ba por rigs te /
translated: If it were a thing that changes, it would be a creator and an experiencer.

original: chun pa la sogs pa rtag tu bya ba de la zhugs shing byed pa po nyid yin pas 'bras bu smin pa'i dus na yang zas la sogs pa la chags pas zab po nyid yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chun pa la sogs pa rtag tu bya ba de la zhugs shing byed pa po nyid yin pas 'bras bu smin pa'i dus na yang zas la sogs pa la chags pas zab po nyid yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a farmer, etc., is a creator because he is always engaged in his work and is the creator himself. And at the time of reaping the fruit, he is the experiencer because he is attached to the harvest, etc.

original: yang gang dag sngon dang phyi ma'i dus na ngo bo gcig tu gyur cing rang gi bya ba la 'jug par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: yang gang dag sngon dang phyi ma'i dus na ngo bo gcig tu gyur cing rang gi bya ba la 'jug par yang mi byed la /
translated: Moreover, if something is the same entity in the past and future, but does not engage in its own function,

original: yul rnams la chags pa med pa de ni byed pa po dang / za ba po yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig de la blo yid ches pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: yul rnams la chags pa med pa de ni byed pa po dang / za ba po yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig de la blo yid ches pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro /
translated: then it is not tenable to say that it is a creator and an experiencer.

original: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
translated: The Blaze of Reasoning, a commentary on the essence of the middle way

original: bam po nyi shu gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu gsum pa /
translated: Volume 23

original: gzhan yang / byed po bdag yin mi gos pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byed po bdag yin mi gos pa //
translated: Moreover, the self as the creator is not defiled,

original: byed po'i 'bras bu 'dod ci ltar //
analyzed: byed po'i 'bras bu 'dod ci ltar //
translated: so how could it desire the effects of the creator?

original: mi dbang sdig dang bcas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mi dbang sdig dang bcas pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the lord of men is sinful,

original: rgyal po'i dpe ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: rgyal po'i dpe ni mi rigs so //
translated: the example of the king is not tenable.

original: byed pa po'i byed pa po yin pa'i mtshan ma ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po'i byed pa po yin pa'i mtshan ma ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mark of the agent of the agent is this:

original: gang 'di dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bus gos par 'gyur nga'o //
analyzed: gang 'di dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bus gos par 'gyur nga'o //
translated: it is that which is affected by the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: 'bras bu rjes su spyod par 'gyur ba med na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rjes su spyod par 'gyur ba med na /
translated: If it did not experience the result,

original: byed pa po'i bya ba thams cad don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byed pa po'i bya ba thams cad don med par 'gyur te /
translated: then all the activity of the agent would be pointless.

original: des na tha ba po nyid dang yang ldan par mi 'gyur bas byed pa po nyid sgrub par shin tu dka'o //
analyzed: des na tha ba po nyid dang yang ldan par mi 'gyur bas byed pa po nyid sgrub par shin tu dka'o //
translated: Therefore, since it would not possess the quality of being an agent, it is very difficult to establish that it is an agent.

original: 'di'i dpe rgyal pos bstan @267a * //
analyzed: 'di'i dpe rgyal pos bstan @267a * //
translated: The example of the king that you taught

original: pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: is also unreasonable.

original: sdig pas rjes su gos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / chos mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: sdig pas rjes su gos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / chos mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: It is not similar to the example because it is affected by sin.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa mi dge ba byas pas rgyal po yang sdig pa'i skal ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa mi dge ba byas pas rgyal po yang sdig pa'i skal ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the king is affected by the sin of killing, stealing, lying, and so on, because he commits nonvirtuous actions.

original: gang gi phyir dmyal ba la sogs par lhung bas 'jigs pa yod pas 'di ni chos la mthun par spyad pa la sogs pa yang bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmyal ba la sogs par lhung bas 'jigs pa yod pas 'di ni chos la mthun par spyad pa la sogs pa yang bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Because there is fear of falling into the hells and so on, this also teaches the practice of Dharma in accordance with the Dharma and so on.

original: yang gal te 'di la sdig pa la sogs pas mi gos pa gcig yin na ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du skyod kyang 'gal bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhig yin na de ltar na ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang gal te 'di la sdig pa la sogs pas mi gos pa gcig yin na ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du skyod kyang 'gal bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhig yin na de ltar na ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: If this person is not tainted by sin and so on, then even if they move as they wish, there would be no contradiction. But that is not so.

original: des na mi'i bdag po yang sdig dang bcas par 'gyur ba bzhin du skyes bu yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu mi myong bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: des na mi'i bdag po yang sdig dang bcas par 'gyur ba bzhin du skyes bu yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu mi myong bar mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, just as the lord of men becomes sinful, it is not reasonable that a person does not experience the fruits of virtue and non-virtue.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rnams bdag gis myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rnams bdag gis myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The fruits of virtue and non-virtue are experienced by me.

original: des na mi rtag pa dang kun la khyab pa ma yin pa'i skyon yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa dang kun la khyab pa ma yin pa'i skyon yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, there would be the fault of being impermanent and not all-pervading.

original: zhing pa la rkun mo la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhing pa la rkun mo la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: Like thieves and so on arising for a farmer.

original: gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du //
analyzed: gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du //
translated: And you say this:

original: gcig pu kun khyab rtag pa ste //
analyzed: gcig pu kun khyab rtag pa ste //
translated: One, all-pervading, permanent,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang mi bden te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang mi bden te //
translated: That which is said, ‚ÄúThe self is one,‚Äù and so on, is also not true.

original: gang gi phyir ;üîΩphyi rol la ni ma ltos par //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ; phyi rol la ni ma ltos par //
translated: Why is it so?üîΩIt is not logical that the one

original: gcig nyid ngo bo nyid mi rigs //
analyzed: gcig nyid ngo bo nyid mi rigs //
translated: has an essence without depending on the external.üîΩIf it is said that the one is so

original: gcig nyid dang ldan pas she na //
analyzed: gcig nyid dang ldan pas she na //
translated: because it possesses oneness,

original: de ni de dang ldan ma yin //
analyzed: de ni de dang ldan ma yin //
translated: it does not possess that.

original: gnyis med pa'i gcig pu zhes bya ba ni ji ltar skye bo dbul po mang po'i nang na mi'i bdag po ni gcig pu'o zhes phyi rol gyi skye bo mang po la ltos nas /
analyzed: gnyis med pa'i gcig pu zhes bya ba ni ji ltar skye bo dbul po mang po'i nang na mi'i bdag po ni gcig pu'o zhes phyi rol gyi skye bo mang po la ltos nas /
translated: The so-called one that is not two is like the following analogy: In the midst of many poor people, the lord of men is called ‚Äúthe one‚Äù in dependence on many external people.

original: mi'i bdag po gcig pu yin par rjod par byed la /
analyzed: mi'i bdag po gcig pu yin par rjod par byed la /
translated: The lord of men is described as ‚Äúthe one.‚Äù

original: yang bdag ni nang dang phyi rol thams cad du de nyid gnas pa yin pas gang la ltos nas gcig nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: yang bdag ni nang dang phyi rol thams cad du de nyid gnas pa yin pas gang la ltos nas gcig nyid du 'gyur /
translated: But in dependence on what is the self, which is present in all inner and outer things, one?

original: gal te yang grangs gcig nyid dang ldan pas gcig nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang grangs gcig nyid dang ldan pas gcig nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the one is so because it possesses the number one,

original: bdag las gzhan pa'i gcig ces bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag las gzhan pa'i gcig ces bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then the so-called one that is other than the self does not exist.

original: des na ji ltar de de dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na ji ltar de de dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: So how could it possess that?

original: sor mo de nyid kyis sor mo de nyid kyi rtse mo la reg par mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sor mo de nyid kyis sor mo de nyid kyi rtse mo la reg par mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the fact that the tip of a finger cannot touch itself.

original: 'on te yang yul dang yul can gyi ngo bo du ma nyid du btags pa yin la de bsal ba'i sgo nas bdag gcig du nyid du brjod par bya'o @267b zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yang yul dang yul can gyi ngo bo du ma nyid du btags pa yin la de bsal ba'i sgo nas bdag gcig du nyid du brjod par bya'o @267b zhe na /
translated: But if the multiplicity of the natures of object and subject is imputed, and the oneness of the self is expressed by the elimination of that,

original: de yang 'di ltar mi rigs te //
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar mi rigs te //
translated: that also is not reasonable.

original: du ma nyid du btags pa dag / bsal ba gcig nyid yin zhe na //
analyzed: du ma nyid du btags pa dag / bsal ba gcig nyid yin zhe na //
translated: If the elimination of the multiplicity of imputations is oneness,

original: ji ltar btags pa kun rdzob phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar btags pa kun rdzob phyir //
translated: then because the imputations are conventional,

original: des na gcig de don dam min //
analyzed: des na gcig de don dam min //
translated: that oneness is not ultimate.

original: gcig nyid kyi rang bzhin ni med pas gcig ces bya ba de btags pa yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gcig nyid kyi rang bzhin ni med pas gcig ces bya ba de btags pa yin par 'gyur la /
translated: Since the nature of oneness does not exist, what is called ‚Äúone‚Äù is an imputation.

original: gang btags pa yin pa de ni don dam par gcig ma yin te /
analyzed: gang btags pa yin pa de ni don dam par gcig ma yin te /
translated: And that which is an imputation is not ultimately one.

original: btags pa ni kun rdzob nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btags pa ni kun rdzob nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an imputation is a convention.

original: gal te yang /üîΩrtag dang gcig sogs ngo bo yis //
analyzed: gal te yang / rtag dang gcig sogs ngo bo yis //
translated: But if you say,

original: don dam de yod yin zhe na //
analyzed: don dam de yod yin zhe na //
translated: ‚ÄúThe ultimate exists by way of the nature of permanence, oneness, and so on,‚Äù

original: gcig sogs sgra dang blo 'jug pa //
analyzed: gcig sogs sgra dang blo 'jug pa //
translated: then the application of the terms ‚Äúone‚Äù and so on and the cognition

original: don yod na ni skyon med 'gyur //
analyzed: don yod na ni skyon med 'gyur //
translated: would have an object, and there would be no fault.

original: sgra gang dag gis rtag pa nyid dang / gcig pa nyid la sogs par rjod par byed pa la blo gang dang gang gis rtag pa nyid dang / gcig pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgra de dag dang blo de dag 'jug pa ni de dag med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: sgra gang dag gis rtag pa nyid dang / gcig pa nyid la sogs par rjod par byed pa la blo gang dang gang gis rtag pa nyid dang / gcig pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgra de dag dang blo de dag 'jug pa ni de dag med par 'gyur na /
translated: The words that express permanence, unity, and so on, and the cognition that understands permanence, unity, and so on, do not apply to what is nonexistent.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po ni med pas ma nges pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po ni med pas ma nges pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Since there is no other entity apart from that, it is not indeterminate.

original: blo dang rtogs par bya ba gnyis gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo dang rtogs par bya ba gnyis gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the cognition and the object of cognition are identical.

original: lugs 'di ni skyon dang bcas pa yin no //üîΩgcig la sogs par rnam rtog pa //
analyzed: lugs 'di ni skyon dang bcas pa yin no // gcig la sogs par rnam rtog pa //
translated: This system is flawed.üîΩHow can the conceptualization

original: 'di ni ci ltar mi rtog nyid //üîΩrnam par rtog pa'i yul don la //
analyzed: 'di ni ci ltar mi rtog nyid // rnam par rtog pa'i yul don la //
translated: of one and so on be nonconceptual?üîΩWords do not apply to the object

original: tshig 'jug pa ni ma bkag go //
analyzed: tshig 'jug pa ni ma bkag go //
translated: that is the domain of conceptualization.

original: gal te blos 'di rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor rnams par rtog par byed kyi /
analyzed: gal te blos 'di rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor rnams par rtog par byed kyi /
translated: If cognition conceptually imagines the entity of what is called ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù and so on,

original: yang 'di nyid ni gang la yang rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: yang 'di nyid ni gang la yang rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: then it is not the case that it does not conceptualize anything at all.

original: des na 'di rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'di rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not a conceptual thought.

original: de ni mi bden te blo dang bdag la tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi bden te blo dang bdag la tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not true, because there is no difference between the mind and the self.

original: gang la rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa yod pa de la bdag kyang 'jug pa yod pas des na /üîΩ'di ltar blo yi yul min dang // ngag gi spyod yul min ji ltar //
analyzed: gang la rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa yod pa de la bdag kyang 'jug pa yod pas des na / 'di ltar blo yi yul min dang // ngag gi spyod yul min ji ltar //
translated: Where there is the operation of conceptual thought, there is the operation of the self.üîΩHow can it be said that the selfüîΩis not the object of the mind,

original: brjod med rtogs pa med pa yang //
analyzed: brjod med rtogs pa med pa yang //
translated: is inexpressible, and is not an object of conceptual thought?

original: sngar bstan rigs pas brdzun pa nyid //
analyzed: sngar bstan rigs pas brdzun pa nyid //
translated: It is false, as has been previously explained.

original: blos nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyi sha'i gong bu la lhas byin zhes ngag brjod par yang 'jug par 'gyur ba ltar de bzhin du gcig la sogs pa'i blo'i yul du gyur ba nyid ni gcig la sogs pa'i ngag 'jug pa'i yul yang yin no //
analyzed: blos nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyi sha'i gong bu la lhas byin zhes ngag brjod par yang 'jug par 'gyur ba ltar de bzhin du gcig la sogs pa'i blo'i yul du gyur ba nyid ni gcig la sogs pa'i ngag 'jug pa'i yul yang yin no //
translated: Just as the word ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äù is applied to a lump of flesh that is indicated by the mind, so the object of the mind, such as ‚Äúone,‚Äù is also the object of the word ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: des na brjod pa med pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya bar 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na brjod pa med pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya bar 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not established that the self is inexpressible and not an object of conceptual thought.

original: 'di ni sngar smras pa'i rigs @268a * //
analyzed: 'di ni sngar smras pa'i rigs @268a * //
translated: This is the argument that we have previously stated.

original: pas mi bden pa nyid yin pas ri bong gi rva bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pas mi bden pa nyid yin pas ri bong gi rva bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not real, it does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: gal te sangs rgyas pa rnams kyang ngag dang blo'i spyod yul las 'das pa ni don dam pa'o zhes 'dod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pa rnams kyang ngag dang blo'i spyod yul las 'das pa ni don dam pa'o zhes 'dod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the Buddhists do not accept that which transcends the domain of speech and mind is the ultimate,

original: de ni bden na 'on kyang rigs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden na 'on kyang rigs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: that is true, but this is the reasoning:

original: shes bya ye nas ma grub pas ;
analyzed: shes bya ye nas ma grub pas ;
translated: Since the object of cognition is not established from the beginning,

original: / blo yi yul du mi rigs so //
analyzed: / blo yi yul du mi rigs so //
translated: it is not reasonable as an object of mind.

original: blo yi yul las log pas na //
analyzed: blo yi yul las log pas na //
translated: Since it is the opposite of the object of mind,

original: ngag gi yul las log pa'ang yin //
analyzed: ngag gi yul las log pa'ang yin //
translated: it is also the opposite of the object of speech.

original: kun rdzob tu rnam par shes pa drug gi yul gyi shes bya yongs su btags pa yin la /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam par shes pa drug gi yul gyi shes bya yongs su btags pa yin la /
translated: Conventionally, the object of cognition is the object of the six consciousnesses.

original: de kho na nyid du ni yongs su btags pa ni rnam pa thams cad du grub par gyur pa med pas yul de la blo yang skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir blo'i spyod yul du gyur ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ni yongs su btags pa ni rnam pa thams cad du grub par gyur pa med pas yul de la blo yang skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir blo'i spyod yul du gyur ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Ultimately, since the object of imputation does not exist in any way, the mind does not arise with respect to that object, and therefore it is not an object of the mind.

original: blo'i spyod yul las log par gyur pas rten med pa'i phyir dag kyang 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo'i spyod yul las log par gyur pas rten med pa'i phyir dag kyang 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is the opposite of the domain of thought, it is without support.

original: des 'di ltar don dam pa nyid du ngag gi spyod yul du gyur pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des 'di ltar don dam pa nyid du ngag gi spyod yul du gyur pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not even the domain of speech in the ultimate sense.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi brdzun pa'i ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi brdzun pa'i ;
translated: The non-deceptive system of the Tathagata

original: / lugs 'di dge bar shes nas ni //
analyzed: / lugs 'di dge bar shes nas ni //
translated: is known as virtue.

original: de phyir mu stegs 'dod skyes te //
analyzed: de phyir mu stegs 'dod skyes te //
translated: Therefore, the tirthikas generate desire for it

original: de la bdag gir byas pa yin //
analyzed: de la bdag gir byas pa yin //
translated: and claim it as their own.

original: brgya la res 'ga' de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung bar gyur cing /
analyzed: brgya la res 'ga' de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung bar gyur cing /
translated: If by chance a Tathagata appears in the world,

original: des brdzun pa ma yin pa'i gsung rab kyi lugs kyang rab tu bstan nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan pa na de'i lugs de la mu stegs pa rnams 'dod pa skyes par gyur nas rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i nang du bsres shing lugs 'di
analyzed: des brdzun pa ma yin pa'i gsung rab kyi lugs kyang rab tu bstan nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan pa na de'i lugs de la mu stegs pa rnams 'dod pa skyes par gyur nas rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i nang du bsres shing lugs 'di
translated: and he teaches the non-deceptive system of his scriptures and also teaches his transcendence of suffering, then the tirthikas generate desire for that system and mix it into their own tenets.

original: ni kho bo cag gi yin no zhes bdag gir yang byed do //
analyzed: ni kho bo cag gi yin no zhes bdag gir yang byed do //
translated: They claim it as their own, saying, ‚ÄúThis is ours.‚Äù

original: de ni sngon dang phyi mar yang 'gal ba'i skyon dang bcas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' 'dres pas rnam par rtog pa yin par mtshon par bya ba yin te /üîΩdes na / sngon dang phyi mar 'gal ba yi //
analyzed: de ni sngon dang phyi mar yang 'gal ba'i skyon dang bcas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' 'dres pas rnam par rtog pa yin par mtshon par bya ba yin te / des na / sngon dang phyi mar 'gal ba yi //
translated: That is a theory that is mixed with faults that are contradictory in the past and future.üîΩTherefore,üîΩWho would rely on a systemüîΩThat is contradictory in the past and future?

original: de yi lugs la su zhig dang // shin tu rigs mi gcig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi lugs la su zhig dang // shin tu rigs mi gcig pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is very different,

original: lcags las nor bu rin chen bzhin //
analyzed: lcags las nor bu rin chen bzhin //
translated: Like a jewel from iron.

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig lcags kyi rang bzhin gyi nor bu la nor bu rin po che dang 'dra bar bya'o zhes shin tu phyi bdar byas kyang de ni bsreg pa dang phyi ba dang bdar ba la sogs pa bzod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig lcags kyi rang bzhin gyi nor bu la nor bu rin po che dang 'dra bar bya'o zhes shin tu phyi bdar byas kyang de ni bsreg pa dang phyi ba dang bdar ba la sogs pa bzod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as someone might polish a jewel that has the nature of iron, thinking, ‚ÄúI will make it like a precious jewel,‚Äù it is very different because it cannot bear being burned, polished, and rubbed.

original: shin tu mi 'dra bar gyur pa yin pas nor bu rin po che rtog pa la mkhas pa su zhig de la rin po che'i 'du shes bskyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: shin tu mi 'dra bar gyur pa yin pas nor bu rin po che rtog pa la mkhas pa su zhig de la rin po che'i 'du shes bskyed par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, what wise person who knows about jewels would generate the idea that it is a precious jewel?

original: de bzhin du bdag dang / rtag pa dang / @268b kun la khyab pa dang / gcig pu las bzlog pa bdag mad pa mi rtag pa kun la ma khyab pa du ma'i ngo bo nyid 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir shin tu mi 'dra ba'i rnam par gyur pa yin bas de kho na nyid rtog pa la mkhas pa su zhig de la de
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag dang / rtag pa dang / @268b kun la khyab pa dang / gcig pu las bzlog pa bdag mad pa mi rtag pa kun la ma khyab pa du ma'i ngo bo nyid 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir shin tu mi 'dra ba'i rnam par gyur pa yin bas de kho na nyid rtog pa la mkhas pa su zhig de la de
translated: Likewise, the self, permanence, pervading all, and being one are mutually exclusive of the absence of self, impermanence, not pervading all, and having many natures. Since they are completely different, what wise person who is skilled in contemplating reality would think that the self is permanent, pervades all, and is one?

original: kho na nyid kyi 'du shes skyed par byed //
analyzed: kho na nyid kyi 'du shes skyed par byed //
translated: Likewise, the self, permanence, omnipresence, and oneness are mutually exclusive. The opposite of these is the nonself, impermanence, nonomnipresence, and manifold nature. Since these are completely different, what expert in the analysis of reality would generate the idea of reality in regard to that?

original: des na 'di ni ri dags kyi rnga ma bstan nas rta'i sha 'tshong bar byed pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni ri dags kyi rnga ma bstan nas rta'i sha 'tshong bar byed pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, this is like showing the tail of a deer and selling it as horse meat.

original: gal te yang dbu mar smra ba rnams la yang bdag dang bcas pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / skye ba dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med par smras bas 'gal ba chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang dbu mar smra ba rnams la yang bdag dang bcas pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / skye ba dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med par smras bas 'gal ba chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the Followers of the Middle Way speak of the self, selflessness, emptiness, external emptiness, arising, nonarising, things, and nonthings, would they not incur the great fallacy of contradiction?

original: 'di la lan brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la lan brjod pa /
translated: The answer to this is as follows.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni lugs 'di la //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni lugs 'di la //
translated: In this system,üîΩsome are led to the truth,

original: kha cig dag ni drang phyir dang // lhag ma 'dzin las bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kha cig dag ni drang phyir dang // lhag ma 'dzin las bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: and some are turned away from holding on to the remainder.

original: sna tshogs dag tu bstan pa yin //
analyzed: sna tshogs dag tu bstan pa yin //
translated: Thus, the Buddha taught in various ways.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta bas sems nyams par byas pa med par smra ba /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta bas sems nyams par byas pa med par smra ba /
translated: The Lord Buddha taught the existence of a self in order to turn away those who are nihilistic in their views, denying cause and effect,

original: yod pa ma yin par 'dzin pa rnams bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩbdag yod pa nyid du bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan te /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin par 'dzin pa rnams bzlog par bya ba'i phyir / bdag yod pa nyid du bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan te /
translated: and who hold that nothing exists.üîΩThe Lord Buddha taught the existence of a self in order to turn away those who are nihilistic in their views, denying cause and effect,üîΩand who hold that nothing exists.

original: de dag 'dren par mdzad pa dang // bdag tu smra ba rnams bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen cing 'jig pa rnams bzlog par bya ba'i phyir bdag med do zhes ston par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag 'dren par mdzad pa dang // bdag tu smra ba rnams bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen cing 'jig pa rnams bzlog par bya ba'i phyir bdag med do zhes ston par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: The Buddha taught the nonexistence of a self in order to turn away those who are attached to the belief in a self and who are lost in the belief in the transitory collection.

original: kun rdzob tu de dag tu 'dzin pa spang bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de dag tu 'dzin pa spang bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he taught in various ways in order to eliminate the grasping of those who hold to the extremes.

original: don dam par ni bdag kyang ma yin bdag med pa yang ma yin no zhes zab cing rgya che ba'i chos la bzod pa dang ldan pa rnams la bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni bdag kyang ma yin bdag med pa yang ma yin no zhes zab cing rgya che ba'i chos la bzod pa dang ldan pa rnams la bstan pa yin te /
translated: But ultimately, it is neither a self nor a selflessness.

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung rab rnam pa du mar bstan pa nyid ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rdzas su 'brangs nas bstan pa ste 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung rab rnam pa du mar bstan pa nyid ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rdzas su 'brangs nas bstan pa ste 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, the teachings of the Lord in the scriptures are not contradictory, for they are given in accordance with the conventional and ultimate realities of things, in order to teach those who are ready for the profound and vast teachings.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: dngos po rnams ni ma skyes nyid //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni ma skyes nyid //
translated: Things are not produced,

original: rang bzhin bcos ma med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin bcos ma med pa'i phyir //
translated: because their nature is unfabricated.

original: 'di la nyams pa med pas na //
analyzed: 'di la nyams pa med pas na //
translated: Since there is no cessation here,

original: bdag ces kyang ni brjod pa yin //
analyzed: bdag ces kyang ni brjod pa yin //
translated: it is also said to be a self.üîΩSince things are not produced from themselves, from others, from both, or without cause, I have already demonstrated that things are not produced.

original: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las yod pa dang med pa skyes pa ma yin pas dngos po rnams ma skyes pa nyid du bdag gis sngar bsgrubs zin pa de nyid dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin bcos ma ma yin pa nyams pa med
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las yod pa dang med pa skyes pa ma yin pas dngos po rnams ma skyes pa nyid du bdag gis sngar bsgrubs zin pa de nyid dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin bcos ma ma yin pa nyams pa med
translated: That very fact that things are not produced establishes that the nature of things is unfabricated and does not cease.

original: pa yin pas de nyid @269a * //
analyzed: pa yin pas de nyid @269a * //
translated: Therefore, it is the ultimate.üîΩ

original: dngos po thams cad kyi bdag yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩtha dad dngos kyang dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi bdag yin par 'gyur ro // tha dad dngos kyang dbyer med phyir //
translated: Therefore, it is the self of all things.

original: ngo bo gcig phyir gcig nyid yin //üîΩkun khyab chos rnams thams cad phyir //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig phyir gcig nyid yin // kun khyab chos rnams thams cad phyir //
translated: It is one, because, although different things, they are not divided.

original: rtag pa'ang de yin mi nyams phyir //
analyzed: rtag pa'ang de yin mi nyams phyir //
translated: It is permanent, because it is all-pervading and does not deteriorate.

original: de ni ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas bdag yin no ;
analyzed: de ni ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas bdag yin no ;
translated: It is the self, because it is the nature of the unborn.

original: / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched tha dad du zin kyang dbye ba med pa'i phyir gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched tha dad du zin kyang dbye ba med pa'i phyir gcig nyid yin no //
translated: It is one, because, although the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields are different, they are not divided.

original: dngos po thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i chos can yin pas kun la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i chos can yin pas kun la khyab pa'o //
translated: It is all-pervading, because it is the nature of all things, which are the bearers of the characteristics of the absence of characteristics.

original: 'di ni ma skyes pas nyams pa med pa yin pa'i phyir rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma skyes pas nyams pa med pa yin pa'i phyir rtag pa'o //
translated: It is permanent, because it does not deteriorate, being unborn.

original: ma skyes phyir na skye med nyid //
analyzed: ma skyes phyir na skye med nyid //
translated: It is unborn, because it is not born.

original: de nyid phyir na rga shi med //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na rga shi med //
translated: It is not subject to old age and death, for the same reason.

original: 'pho ba med phyir 'di 'pho med //
analyzed: 'pho ba med phyir 'di 'pho med //
translated: It is not subject to transmigration, because it does not transmigrate.

original: rab mthar thug phyir mchog nyid yin //
analyzed: rab mthar thug phyir mchog nyid yin //
translated: It is supreme, because it is the ultimate.

original: ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir na skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir na skye ba med pa'o //
translated: Because it is unborn, it is non-arising.

original: skye ba med pa nyid kyi ngo bo la rga ba dang 'chi ba med pas rga shi med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa nyid kyi ngo bo la rga ba dang 'chi ba med pas rga shi med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no aging and death in the nature of non-arising, it is free from aging and death.

original: ma skyes pa ni 'pho ba yod pa ma yin pas des na 'pho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni 'pho ba yod pa ma yin pas des na 'pho ba med pa'o //
translated: Since the unborn does not undergo transference, it is free from transference.

original: de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo nyid mchog tu gyur pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin pas mchog ces bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo nyid mchog tu gyur pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin pas mchog ces bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Since there is no other nature superior to it, it is considered to be supreme.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri sogs min //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri sogs min //
translated: It is not form, sound, smell, and so forth.

original: sa dang me dang chu klung min //
analyzed: sa dang me dang chu klung min //
translated: It is not earth, fire, water, or wind.

original: nam mkha' zla ba nyi ma min //
analyzed: nam mkha' zla ba nyi ma min //
translated: It is not space, the moon, or the sun.

original: yid dang shes pa'i mtshan nyid min //
analyzed: yid dang shes pa'i mtshan nyid min //
translated: It is not the characteristics of mind and cognition.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi yul du ma gyur pa'i phyir de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas yul gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi yul du ma gyur pa'i phyir de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas yul gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not the object of any entity, it is not the nature of non-entity. Therefore, it is not an object.

original: sra ba dang gsher ba dang / tsha ba dang / g-yo ba zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang ma yin pas de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sra ba dang gsher ba dang / tsha ba dang / g-yo ba zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang ma yin pas de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the essence of the elements, earth, water, fire, and air, because it is not the characteristic of the elements, solidity, fluidity, heat, and motion.

original: rdzas su med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'ga' la yang go 'byed pa med pa dang / snang ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pas nam mkha' dang ri bong can dang nyi ma la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'ga' la yang go 'byed pa med pa dang / snang ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pas nam mkha' dang ri bong can dang nyi ma la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not space, the rabbit horns, the sun, etc., because it is not a non-existent substance, because it is not a non-existent opening for anything, and because it is not the nature of light.

original: sems par byed pas na yid dang dngos po rab tu shes pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas na shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems par byed pas na yid dang dngos po rab tu shes pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas na shes pa ste /
translated: It is the mind because it thinks, and it is consciousness because it is characterized by the knowledge of things.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i mtho ris dang / byang grol la sogs pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i mtho ris dang / byang grol la sogs pa'i yul can no //
translated: It is the subject of heaven, liberation, etc., in the past and future.

original: yang de ni de kho na nyid kyi ngo bor yod par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang de ni de kho na nyid kyi ngo bor yod par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it does not exist as the essence of reality.

original: thams cad 'di yin ngang bzhin phyir //
analyzed: thams cad 'di yin ngang bzhin phyir //
translated: Because it is the nature of all,

original: nyams pa med phyir thams cad min //
analyzed: nyams pa med phyir thams cad min //
translated: it is not all because it is not subject to deterioration.

original: de la nyon mongs skye med phyir //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs skye med phyir //
translated: Because the afflictions do not arise in it,

original: dag pa 'di yin zhi nyid 'di //
analyzed: dag pa 'di yin zhi nyid 'di //
translated: This is purity, this is peace.

original: dngos po @269b thams cad kyi rang bzhin gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di ni thams cad yin no //üîΩkun kyang nyams par 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid can yin la /
analyzed: dngos po @269b thams cad kyi rang bzhin gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di ni thams cad yin no // kun kyang nyams par 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid can yin la /
translated: This is all, because of the oneness of the nature of all things.

original: yang de ni nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin pas thams cad ma yin no //
analyzed: yang de ni nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin pas thams cad ma yin no //
translated: This is not all, because of the non-defiled nature of the realm of the real.

original: rdzas skyes pa med pas rten med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pas kyang skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas 'di ni dag pa ste dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas skyes pa med pas rten med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pas kyang skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas 'di ni dag pa ste dri ma med pa'o //
translated: This is purity, because of the absence of the origination of the defilements, since there is no origination of substance and therefore no basis.

original: de nyid ni zhi ba ste bya ba thams cad las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni zhi ba ste bya ba thams cad las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is peace, because of the transcendence of all activity.

original: de ni btags pas sgro btags nas //üîΩbrjod bya yang dag brjod bya min //
analyzed: de ni btags pas sgro btags nas // brjod bya yang dag brjod bya min //
translated: It is imagined by the imagination,üîΩand is not the object of expression.

original: ye nas brjod bya ma yin phyir //
analyzed: ye nas brjod bya ma yin phyir //
translated: It is not the object of expression from the beginning,

original: 'di ni dri ma med ces bstan //
analyzed: 'di ni dri ma med ces bstan //
translated: and is taught to be stainless.

original: yang de ni de kho na nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin na yang btags pas sgro btags nas de la skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ges kun rdzob tu gzhan dag gis rtogs par bya ba'i don du tshig tu rjod par byed do //
analyzed: yang de ni de kho na nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin na yang btags pas sgro btags nas de la skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ges kun rdzob tu gzhan dag gis rtogs par bya ba'i don du tshig tu rjod par byed do //
translated: Moreover, since it is not to be expressed as reality, it is verbally expressed by the words ‚Äúnon-production,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-entity,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-cessation,‚Äù and so on, in order to make others understand conventionally, through the superimposition of designations.

original: gsal por gyur pa med pa'i phyir rnam pa kun gyis brjod par bya ba ma yin pas dri ma med pa zhes brjod do //üîΩgang zhig 'di ltar mngon 'dod pa //
analyzed: gsal por gyur pa med pa'i phyir rnam pa kun gyis brjod par bya ba ma yin pas dri ma med pa zhes brjod do // gang zhig 'di ltar mngon 'dod pa //
translated: Since it is not to be expressed in any way, because it is not manifest, it is called ‚Äústainless.‚ÄùüîΩIf you also assert

original: khyod kyis bdag kyang yin na ni //üîΩming sogs chos mang 'dra ba la //
analyzed: khyod kyis bdag kyang yin na ni // ming sogs chos mang 'dra ba la //
translated: a self that is like that,üîΩthen you have a faultless position

original: skyon med rigs pa dang bcas yin //
analyzed: skyon med rigs pa dang bcas yin //
translated: that is similar to the many dharmas of name and so on.

original: gang skye ba med par spyi'i mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa bzhin du skyon dang bral ba nyid du khyod kyis bdag kyang 'dod na ni ming tsam la rtsod par zad de /
analyzed: gang skye ba med par spyi'i mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa bzhin du skyon dang bral ba nyid du khyod kyis bdag kyang 'dod na ni ming tsam la rtsod par zad de /
translated: If you assert a self that is like the stainlessness that is the general characteristic of non-production, as it has been explained, then you have a faultless position.

original: khyod ni bdag mchog ces zer la kho bo cag ni skye ba med pa zhes zer bas 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: khyod ni bdag mchog ces zer la kho bo cag ni skye ba med pa zhes zer bas 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: You say ‚Äúself‚Äù and we say ‚Äúnon-arisen.‚Äù What is the contradiction here?üîΩTherefore:

original: des na / bdag med nyid kyis 'jigs pa rnams //
analyzed: des na / bdag med nyid kyis 'jigs pa rnams //
translated: Those who are afraid of selflessness

original: 'jigs kyang de nyid la gnas te //
analyzed: 'jigs kyang de nyid la gnas te //
translated: Should still rely on it,

original: nam mkhas 'jigs par gyur ba dag / gzhan pa'i gnas 'ga' med pa bzhin //
analyzed: nam mkhas 'jigs par gyur ba dag / gzhan pa'i gnas 'ga' med pa bzhin //
translated: Just as those who are afraid of the skyüîΩShould still rely on the sky.

original: ji ltar blun po 'ga' zhig nam mkhas 'jigs shing skrag na yang /
analyzed: ji ltar blun po 'ga' zhig nam mkhas 'jigs shing skrag na yang /
translated: Some fools are afraid of the sky and terrified by it.

original: de las gzhan pa'i gnas ma mthong bas nam mkha' de nyid la gnas par byed do //üîΩde bzhin du khyod kyang bdag med pas 'jigs shing skrag na yang bdag med pa de nyid la brten cing gnas te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gnas ma mthong bas nam mkha' de nyid la gnas par byed do // de bzhin du khyod kyang bdag med pas 'jigs shing skrag na yang bdag med pa de nyid la brten cing gnas te /
translated: But since they see no other place to go, they still rely on the sky.üîΩIn the same way, you are afraid of selflessness and terrified by it.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rten med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rten med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But since you see no other place to go, you still rely on selflessness.

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten gnyen rnams kyis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten gnyen rnams kyis //
translated: The buddhas, the friends of the world,

original: de nyid bdud rtsi mchog 'di la //
analyzed: de nyid bdud rtsi mchog 'di la //
translated: Have said that this is the supreme nectar.

original: 'di ni 'ga' yang bkag med pas //
analyzed: 'di ni 'ga' yang bkag med pas //
translated: No one has ever refuted it,

original: @270a * // legs par 'ongs so ngoms par gyis //
analyzed: @270a * // legs par 'ongs so ngoms par gyis //
translated: So come and enjoy it!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi ro myang ba'i phyir 'dir 'ongs pa legs kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi ro myang ba'i phyir 'dir 'ongs pa legs kyi /
translated: You have come here to taste the nectar of the Tathagata's teachings.üîΩ So be satisfied with the nectar of the Dharma.

original: chos bdud rtsi'i ros tshim par gyis shig / skye gnas dang / na tshod dang / rigs dang / yul dang / dus kyi skyon thugs rje chen pos spangs par mdzad pa'i thugs can yang dag pa'i lta ba bzhin gyi don rig pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsung rab 'di la bkag pa med do //
analyzed: chos bdud rtsi'i ros tshim par gyis shig / skye gnas dang / na tshod dang / rigs dang / yul dang / dus kyi skyon thugs rje chen pos spangs par mdzad pa'i thugs can yang dag pa'i lta ba bzhin gyi don rig pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsung rab 'di la bkag pa med do //
translated: The teachings of the Buddhas, who are endowed with a mind that, through great compassion, has abandoned the faults of birth, age, caste, country, and time, are not refuted in this world.

original: de kho na nyid ni bdud rtsi ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni bdud rtsi ste /
translated: The truth is nectar,

original: ngoms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngoms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it satisfies.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i de kho na nyid gzhan med pas mchog ste dam pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i de kho na nyid gzhan med pas mchog ste dam pa'o //
translated: Since there is no other truth like it, it is supreme, that is, the best.

original: yang dag lta la sgrib med pa'i //
analyzed: yang dag lta la sgrib med pa'i //
translated: The truth is not obscured by wrong views,üîΩ because it is not obscured by wrong views.
